loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Paul; he is forty three years old, married and has five children.

He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to be trained on entrepreneurial skills. Through this training he was able to identify a market gap in paraffin retailing in his area. Paul was also equipped with the skills to run his paraffin retailing business effectively.

He is borrowing from Kiva to add stock in his shop so as to meet the rising demand from his customers. He hopes his business will earn more profit to enable him cater for his children school fees and general family needs.

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support and promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of paraffin to help meet customers rising demand, thus more income to cater for family rising needs.

loans.name: Farhat

texts.en:
Farhat is a 58-year-old woman. She lives with her family including one son and one daughter in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son has been running a mobile shop for the past 10 years. He sells new mobiles and mobile accessories such as chargers, batteries, hand frees, blue tooth devices, etc in his shop. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his customers. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built very good relations with his customers. 

Therefore, Farhat's son requested a loan so that he would be able to buy more stock of new mobiles as well as accessories such as batteries, chargers, hand frees, and blue tooth devices to increase his business, but due to insufficient financial means, he was unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Farhat has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, her son will be able to purchase relevant items for his business purposes so that he can earn a more profitable income to manage his business and household.

Farhat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new mobiles and accessories such as batteries, chargers, hand frees, and blue tooth devices for her son's mobile shop

loans.name: Delmar Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres (CLAUDIA MARIA, ENGRACIA y MARIBEL) de la etnia miskita de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que trabajan día a día con el empeño de lograr el crecimiento de sus pequeños negocios de venta de mariscos. Se organizaron como grupo solidario desde hace aproximadamente 3 años, para poder obtener préstamo en Pana Pana. El nombre de DELMAR, es porque sus negocios los tienen ubicados frente al mar Caribe.

MARIBEL: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer luchadora, tiene 37 años madre soltera de 2 hijos que estudian su primaria. Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos y sacar adelante a sus hijos, desde hace 4 años se dedica a la comercialización de mariscos. Está solicitando préstamo para comprar camarones, pescados, langostas, caracoles, pulpos, entre otros mariscos e incrementar su nivel de ingresos y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three women (Claudia Maria, Engracia, and Maribel) who come from the "Miskita" ethnic group in the town of Bilwi and city of Puerto Cabezas in Nicaragua.  They are entrepreneurial women who day after day work to grow their small businesses involved in selling seafood.  They have been organized as a communal banking group for the past three years.  They organized in order to obtain a loan from Kiva field partner Pana Pana.  They named themselves "DelMar," or "Of the Sea" because their businesses are located in front of the Caribbean ocean. 

Maribel is the coordinator of this communal banking group.  She is a fighter who is 37 years old and a single mother with two children who study in elementary school.  With the goal of having her own source of income and helping her children get ahead, she began to sell seafood four years ago.  She is asking for a loan in order to purchase shrimp, fish, lobster, snails, octopus, and other seafood that will help her increase her income and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase shrimp, fish, lobster, snails, octopus, and other seafood

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
Teodoro tiene 32 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus 5 hijos en el distrito de Cañaris, una comunidad pequeña donde la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café de variedad catimore, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 15 años y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarias, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para la cosecha de su cultivo de café, esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Teodoro is 32 years old and lives in his own home made of rustic material.  He lives with his life partner and five children in the district of Cañaris, a small community where life is peaceful and the residents work in agriculture and livestock.  It is located in the province of Ferreñafe, in the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Perú.

He works in agriculture, specifically cultivating coffee of the catimore variety.  He has around 15 years of experience in this field and he has good personal and work references in the district.  The loan that he will be given will be used for agricultural labor, applying and incorporating feed and fertilizers, and for manual labor in order to harvest his crop of coffee.  This will help him improve not only the quality but also quantity or his crop, giving him a well-timed harvest and in that way offering higher yield and better product.  He will thus not have trouble selling his crop and it will generate more income which will improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural labor, applying and incorporating feed and fertilizers, and for manual labor in order to harvest his crop of coffee.

loans.name: Mastonoi

texts.en:
Mastonoi is a hospitable woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1968. She is living in a village with her family. There it is a good place  to keep livestock and do agriculture. She is married and has 24 year of experience of doing business. She keeps livestock and plants rice in her yard. 

In order to sell livestock, her husband helps her to sell in the domestic market. She is planning to get a good harvest next season. She asked for a loan to buy fertilizer, livestock and pay for hired workers. She hopes her business will be efficient and she can earn money to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, livestock and pay for hired workers and to run an efficient business

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia en una zona rural dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral como cuyes, pollos, gallinas, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace 3 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como cuyes, pavos, gallinas, entre otros, para incrementar el stock de su negocio, el préstamo le ayudará para tener una mayor variedad de animales, esto con la finalidad de incrementar su negocio de los mismos y satifacer las necesidades de sus clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marina is 48 years old and is in a common-law marriage.  She lives in her own house in a rural zone that is engaged in agriculture and cattle raising, located in the district of Oyotún, in the province of Chiclayo, in the region of Lambayeque, on the northern coast of Peru.

She works raising and selling farmyard animals, such as guinea pigs, chickens, and hens, among others.  She has carried out this business for three years.  Her business is located in her home.  

She is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity of animals such as guinea pigs, turkeys, and hens, among others, to increase her business’s stock.  The loan will help her to have a greater variety of animals, with the goal of growing her animal business and satisfying the needs of her customers.  This will bring in greater income for her, which will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of animals such as guinea pigs, turkeys, and hens, among others, to increase her business's stock.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52 years old and married with 3 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) so as to benefit from training, especially on enterprise development and financial management. 

She practices livestock farming where she keeps dairy and poultry. She is applying for a Kiva loan to buy dairy feeds and chicken feeds which will enable her increase production of milk and eggs to earn more income. She will then be able to pay for better and quality health care services for her family.

Elizabeth is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy animal feeds which will increase production of eggs and milk and hence earn more income and better healthcare for her family

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 43 year-old-woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is the guardian of her family. He has been running a mobile phone shop for the past 12 years. He sells new mobiles, mobiles accessories; such as chargers, batteries, hand frees, blue tooth devices, etc in his shop. He speaks with monotonous tone which is impressive and he easily wins the trust of his customers. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up very good relations with his customers. 

Therefore Shazia's husband requested for a loan, so that he would be able to buy more stocks of new mobiles, as well as accessories such as batteries, chargers, hand frees, blue tooth devices for increase his business, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Shazia has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. 

Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's mobile phone shop

loans.name: Mbembani Central S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is Samuel, a member of Mbembani Central S.H.G. He is 34 years old and a father of 2 children, who are in primary school. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014 to benefit from the training, especially on savings mobilization, enterprise development and financial management.

Samuel operates a kiosk and also sells building materials. He is borrowing Kiva loan to buy more household items so as to add stock to his kiosk for increased income.  This will enable him cater for his family's basic needs with ease.

loans.use: To buy more household goods to increase stock for his kiosk for increased income, hence cater for his family's basic needs with ease.

loans.name: Wanjala

texts.en:
Wanjala is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity or piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.In addition she also operates a poultry business selling chicken in the market.  She faces a major challenge of transportation in her place of operation.

With the loan, she is requesting to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour and chicken feeds. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and chicken feeds, to boost her business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman aged 47 years and taking care of her six children. She runs a farm supply business where she sells farm related herbicides and seeds  She also carries out agriculture where she grows beans, maize and matoke (plantain) and started her business in 2011.

She works 6 days a week and 10 hours per day and started the business to develop, get school fees for her children and get food for the family and acquired the loan to add stock in the business.

Her hope for the future is to open more businesses in other trading centers and the challenge she faces is that many clients take long to settle their debts.
 
She describes herself as a hardworking woman who is committed to growing her business by taking advantage of the low interest loans available.

loans.use: To boost her herbicide sale business by buying more stock for trade and will grow her business in a committed way

loans.name: Noreen

texts.en:
Noreen is 41 years-old-woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the responsible mother of two sons and one daughter. Her husband is an electrician by profession. Her husband has been providing his services to the people of his society as a good electrician for the last 10 years. He has some basic electricity tools like cables, switches, fan regulators, lights, etc. at home for resale. Some tools for his own work were required by him. 

So Noreen made contact with Brac Pakistan for a loan. Brac Pakistan issued her a loan for purchasing electrical tools such as lights, cables, switches etc. Noreen is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more electrical tools for her husband's electrician work

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Milka. She is 49 years old and married with eight children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to learn and gain more experience in enterprise start-up and development. She also learned skills in financial management, which has helped her manage her finances well. 
 
She does maize, beans and potato farming, which has enabled her to earn income for her family's basic needs. She is borrowing a loan to purchase farm inputs such as hybrid seeds and fertilizer. This will enable her to increase the crop yield, to have more harvest thus meeting the demand for maize and beans in her locality and to improve her income and be in a position to educate her children. 

Milka is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support. She, therefore, promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer that will boost her maize and beans farming.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
Maria tiene 38 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive con su familia en el distrito de Oyotún, en una zona rural donde los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a brindar los servicios de bar y licorería contando con herramientas propias de trabajo, con más de 1 año de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio esta ubicado en su misma casa. Solicita préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de cervezas, esto le ayudará en la implementación de su negocio para asi poder dar un buen servicio a los clientes lo que le generará mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old. She lives with her partner. She and her family live in the Oyotún district, in a rural area where the population works in farming or raising livestock. The area is in the province of Chiclayo, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. 

She runs a bar and liquor store and has the equipment needed for the job. She has more than one year experience in the business, which is located in her own home. 

She is seeking a loan to buy a larger quantity of beers. This will help her to operate her business and offer good service to the customers, which will generate greater income, improving her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of beers.

loans.name: Rozina

texts.en: Rozina’s age is 30. She is married, the mother of two children and lives with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a ready-made garments shop in the market. He purchases garment articles from the market for low prices and sells them for a profitable price from his shop. The ladies of town especially like his garment collection and selection a lot. Now the summer season is going to be starting, so he wants to buy the garments of summer season to sell. But he does not have the necessary amount due to household expenses. Therefore, Rozina requested a loan so that her husband can buy garments for the summer season to fulfill the demand. Rozina wishes for the bright future of her children and her dream is to provide a better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's garments business

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 75 years old and a mother of 10 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013 to benefit from the trainings and especially on savings mobilization, enterprise development and financial management.

Martha practices horticultural farming and also operates a grocery store. She is borrowing to buy assorted fruits and vegetables to add stock to her green grocer store for increased income.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy assorted fruits and vegetables to add stock to her green grocer store for increased income.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Valentín tiene 68 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el caserío de Huacapampa, una zona rural del distrito de Cañaris, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Ferreñafe, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la carpintería desde hace 14 años, tallando madera para mesas, sillas, bancas, puertas entre otros, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de una mayor cantidad de madera para realizar sus trabajos y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia lo que mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Valentin is 68 years old. He lives with his children in the hamlet of Huacapampa, a rural zone of the district of Cañaris. Its population works in agriculture, commerce, and livestock-raising. It is located in the province of Ferreñafe, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He has been working in carpentry for 14 years, forming wood into tables, chairs, benches, and doors, among other items. He has experience in the business and good personal and work references in his district. He has applied for a loan for the purchase of a greater quantity of wood to do his work and in this way to offer it to his customers, generating greater income for his family, which will improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of wood for his work.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en: Munira is one of the business women of Khujand city. She is 34 years old and has already achieved a lot, including being a faithful wife and a happy mother. She lives with her husband and children. Munira is a very sociable and friendly woman. She has her own shop where she sells groceries. Through this business, Munira is able to feed her family. Unfortunately at the moment, her business is not going well because she does not have enough money to buy new goods. For this reason, Munira requested a loan, hoping that with your help she will develop her business as before.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her shop

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela and her husband are both farmers who are raising their family in a rural community. She is 52 years old and has three adult-age children. Due to financial hardship, Adela operates their motorcycle transport business to have additional income.

She aims to continue and strengthen this business, but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is asking for an additional loan of PHP 10,000 to buy gasoline, spare parts, and accessories needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle. She believes that this financial assistance will be a great help for her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, spare parts, and accessories needed for the maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Jose Mercedes

texts.es:
José, tiene una familia formada por su esposa y sus hijos, actualmente todos dependen económicamente de él; aprendió de su padre a trabajar en el campo, tiene más de 20 años de cultivar maíz y frijol como una forma de tener ingresos para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, realiza estas actividades ciertas temporadas del año. 
Necesita capital para comprar abono, insecticidas, herbicidas y semilla, con lo que limpiara el terreno en donde cultiva y mejora la calidad de sus granos, espera tener más ingresos con los que seguirá cuidando del bienestar familiar y cumpliendo con el pago de sus deudas.
Su aspiración es lograr una buena inversión para ampliar su negocio y asegurar un futuro más confortable para su familia.
texts.en:
José has a family consisting of his wife and his children. They all depend on him economically at this time. He learned from his father to work in the fields. He has been raising corn and beans for more than 20 years as a way to have income to cover the basic needs of his family. He does this work during certain seasons of the year.

He needs capital to buy compost, insecticides, herbicides, and seeds, and he will clean the land that he cultivates and improve the quality of his grains. He hopes to have more income, with which he will continue caring for the well-being of his family and making the payments on his debts.

His aspiration is to make a good investment to expand his business and assure a more comfortable future for his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticides, herbicides, and seeds and clean the land that he cultivates so that he can improve the quality of his grains.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
Adolfo tiene 64 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y su hijo en la provincia de Callayuc, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con terreno agrícola en el cual cultiva café variedad catimore, las cuales se encuentran en buen estado, cuenta con bastante experiecia en el rubro y con clientes fijos quienes brindan muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. El destino del crédito es para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, con esto el espera mejorar la calidad de su producto lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Adolfo is 64 years old and lives with his wife and son in the Callayuc province, an agricultural and livestock Community, located in the Cajamarca region in the northern Peruvian mountains.

He is a farmer and has farmland where he raises catimore coffee.  The land is in a good shape and he has lots of experience and steady customers who provide very good personal and professional references.  He will use the money from this loan to buy fertilizers to maintain his coffee crops and he expects to improve the quality of his product, which will increase his income so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Los Pensamientos Group

texts.es:
Los Pensamientos es grupo conformado por socios de la misma zona se conocen entre si. Daniel es un joven emprendedor  de 19 años de edad soltero. Hace cinco años se dedica  al transporte urbano con su propia moto taxi. Años atrás tuvo problemas y dejo sus estudios a pesar de las circunstancias que paso continua sus estudios secundarios y piensa ahorrar un pequeño capital para continuar sus estudios superiores.  Con los ingresos de su trabajo apoya a sus padres con los gastos de su familia. Solicito el crédito para regularizar los documentos de su moto taxi ya que es su herramienta principal de trabajo. Daniel es la persona que esta a lado izquierdo de la foto viste polo de color amarillo.
Está muy agradecido por haber recibido el apoyo de los inversionistas Kiva.
texts.en: Los Pensamientos is a group made up of members from the same area who know each other.  Daniel is a young, single, 19 year old entrepreneur who has been providing urban transportation years with his moto taxi for five.  Years ago he had some problems and had to quit school, but despite what happened, he has been continuing his high school education and plans to save some money so he can pursue a higher education.  He helps his parents with the household expenses with his income and is asking for this loan to complete the paperwork on his moto taxi, which is his main work tool.  Daniel is on the left side of the image, wearing a yellow polo shirt.  He is very happy to have received support from the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to complete paperwork on his moto taxi.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married and has one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and healthcare for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry farming business which is her source of income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbours. Her major challenges are high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 11,500 KES loan, she wants to purchase insurance for her children. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase insurance for her children

loans.name: Rosaminda

texts.en:
Rosaminda is 47 years old and blessed with one child, who is 10 years old. Her husband works as a porter in a market.

Rosaminda started her business in order to help her husband with their expenses. With a 5,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan, she bought school supplies in bulk. Because she operated the only store in her community selling school supplies, the supplies became popular with students, and she was able to pay back the loan on time. As her retail store grow, she came up with the idea of selling her school supplies wholesale, at a much lower price. Customers, especially mothers, bought the supplies to save money and Rosaminda increased her net income from 500 PHP to 700–1,000 PHP daily.

Today, Rosaminda operates not just a retail store but also a wholesale school-supplies store and is now delivering her products – such as notebooks and pencils – to nearby stores in their community.

Bulk orders are piling up, especially now that the beginning of the school year is near. Rosaminda wanted to take this opportunity to increase her income by having more stock to sell to her customers.

Rosaminda is requesting a loan for 50,000 PHP to buy 20 boxes of notebooks, 20 boxes of paper pads, 25 boxes of pencils, ballpoint pens, erasers, sharpeners, crayons, and other school supplies to sell to her customers.

She hopes to expand her school-supplies business in the future to help with their child’s education until college.

loans.use: To buy 20 boxes of notebooks, 20 boxes of paper pads, 25 boxes of pencils, ballpoint pens, erasers, sharpeners, crayons, and other school supplies to sell.

loans.name: Zinnatoi

texts.en: Zinnatoi is a gentle woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1965. She lives in a village with her family. She is a widow and has a child. She has 15 years of experience doing business in agriculture. She plants sunflowers and her son helps her with the business. Each year from her harvest she provides for her family and the growth of her son. She takes care of her land and knows her activity well. This season she did not fertilize her plantings but plans to do it. She requested a loan from Kiva lenders and IMON to buy fertilizer and pay for rental land. She hopes to get a good harvest and to provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for rental land

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 49 years old and a mother of five. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from the trainings, especially on savings mobilization and enterprise development.

Agnes practices poultry farming and also supplies indigenous chickens in her local market. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more chicks and chicken feed to boost production of her poultry farming business. She will therefore earn more income and be able to provide for the basic needs of her family with ease. 

She is happy with Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Con Un Proposito Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por tres mujeres que son muy alegres (BRENDA, REYNA ARMINDA y VEIRA DONIA) las tres son miskitas que viven en Bilwi, en el municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que luchan día a día por hacer crecer sus pequeños negocios de venta de ropa nueva, pulpería y venta de artesanía. se organizaron hace año y medio, para poder acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.

REYNA ARMINDA: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora cordial de 50 años de edad, madre soltera de 1 hijo de 24 años de edad. Con el propósito de apoyar a su hijo en su carrera técnica de mecánico automotriz, desde hace 3 años estableció su pequeña pulpería en su vivienda de tambo y madera. Recuerda con gran alegría que inicio con capital propio con C$1,500(Un Mil Quinientos Córdobas Netos). Gracias al crédito otorgado anteriormente por PANA PANA y financiado por KIVA, le han permitido diversificar sus productos. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar: pollo, carne molida y verduras. Ella sueña con establecer una tienda de repuestos de moto y establecerle un taller a su único hijo.
texts.en:
This united group is made up of three women who are very happy (BRENDA, REYNA ARMINDA and VEIRA DONIA).  The three Miskita women live in Bilwi, in the municipal of Puerto Cabezas.  They are enterprising women who struggle day after day to grow their small businesses selling clothing, artesanal crafts, and general goods.  They organized themselves a year and a half ago, in order to be able to gain access to community secured loans through Pana Pana.

Reyna Arminda is a member of this group, a kind 50 year old woman who is a single mother of one son who is 24 years old.  With the goal of supporting her son with his technical degree in automechanics, three years ago, she established a small general store in her wooden shack.  She remembers with great joy that she began with her own capital with C$1,500 (Córdobas Netos).  Thanks to the loan she received previously from PANA PANA and financed through KIVA, she has been able to diversify her products.  She is requesting financing to purchase chicken, ground beef and vegetables.  She dreams of starting a spare autoparts store and establishing an auto repair shop with her only son.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, ground beef and vegetables.

loans.name: Mwatsaka

texts.en:
Mwatsaka is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of customers taking too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha was able to buy more stock of flour, sugar, rice, cooking oil, milk and tea leaves with her previous loan. Her business expanded and she was able to get more profits that enabled her to cater for her family's needs with ease. She is borrowing another loan to expand her dairy and vegetable farming by buying fodder and pesticide. She looks forward to more income that will help her to meet her family's needs.

Martha is grateful to Kiva for the continued support.

loans.use: to buy fodder and pesticide that will boost her dairy and vegetable farming thus providing more income.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Amos. He is 44 years old, married, and blessed with four children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013. He practices maize, beans, and poultry farming. He went through HiH EA enterprise and financial training and has been able to commercialize his farming business an an enterprise.

He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and seeds. This will increase the quality of his yields thus earning him more income. With increased income, Amos will be able to provide for his family's basic needs, education, and medical care.

Amos is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds that will boost crop yields

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida lives in the town of Alegria, Cebu. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store selling various commodities like biscuits, cooking oil, eggs, canned goods, beverages, condiments, and beverages. She is a 46-year-old married woman with four children aged 18 to 25 years old. Aside from running a store, she engages in gardening. She grows and sells vegetables.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for the farm and to purchase a cow. With these, it would help improve her farm and she would be able to grow more vegetables to sell. Her income will start to increase and she will be able to handle her finances. She will be able to continue to send her children to school.

Leonida hopes that she will become successful in handling both sources of income to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for the farm and to purchase a cow

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.en:
Mukaddas is a bright woman. She was born in a northern part of Tajikistan in 1978. She is living in village with her family, is divorced and has one son. She is busy in agriculture buying and selling livestock for ten years. She well knows her duties and takes care of her livestock. Her father helps her to do business; he takes livestock to the domestic market Mukaddas feeds and cares for the livestock. 

Recently, she has two head of livestock.  She is planning to enlarge her business and has asked help from IMON to buy livestock. Her income she spends for the family needs, food and clothing and the rest is spent on working capital for her business. 

She awaits Kiva lenders kindness and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to enlarge her business

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie is 37 years old, married and has five children. Due to financial hardship, she operates a motorcycle transport to help her husband in gaining income. She aims to make this business profitable in order to earn a higher income. 

To continuously operates the motorcycle, Ronie is asking for an additional of PHP12,000.00 to buy wheels, gasoline and spare parts needed for the motorcycle. She is hoping that she will improve the business and increase her income through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy wheels, gasoline and spare parts needed for her motorcycle which will improve her family income

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman  and has two kids whom all attend school. She  owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a poultry farming business which earns her other source of income. She sells to restaurant operators and local neighbours. Her major challenges is high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Ksh 40,000 she wants to purchase chicks and chicken feeds for resale in her business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve his living standards

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feeds in order to improve her living standards

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma raises and sells hogs for 5 years now.  She is a married woman with an eleven-year old child. Her husband works as a construction worker.  She resides in Alegria, Cebu.  She needs funds to be able to support her existing business.

She has requested a loan to buy piglets and feed.  Alma will be able to raise and sell healthy hogs and start to augment her income. She could now provide her family with good food and build a better shelter . 
 
With the additional  capital, Alma is determined to expand her hog raising business to improve the family's livelihood status.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed in order to raise her family's standard of living

loans.name: Nurokhim

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Nurokhim. Nurokhim lives in Depok, a city located at the south of Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Nurokhim is a young guy who has big spirit to become an entrepreneur. He owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits and mobile phone accessories to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. Eventhough he is still young, Nurokhim already has many customers. It is because he is a friendly and kind guy. Moreover, his community sees him as an informative and trusted mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Nurokhim needs additional funds and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Nurokhim’s goal towards Ruma in the near future is to serve an e-commerce business for his community, a Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Nurokhim is the one who is smiling. He is thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Lucy, forty seven years old, married, and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. 

She is a farmer growing maize and beans on her piece of land. After undergoing Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise development and financial management, Lucy received skills to manage her farm well. This has enabled her to keep proper records of her farming activities thus managing her finances prudently.

She is borrowing from Kiva in order to commercialize her farming by purchasing enough seeds and fertilizer to increase the quantity of her farm produce and hence diversify her sources of income to provide her family food, clothing, and pay for her children's school fees with ease.

Lucy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana is a 40 year-old-woman, residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She looks after her family at home. Her son has been running a photo studio for the last five years. He provides services to people for photography on weddings, birthdays and party functions. He learn this art from his childhood and now he is adept it as a profession. He is a good photographer and people like his work very much. 

To develop his photography skills, he wants to purchase a new and latest technology camera. In this regard Rehana made contact to the Kiva field partner Brac Pakistan for a loan.   Brac issued loan to Rehana to purchase a camera for her son's work.
 
Rehana is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new camera for her son's photography work to improve his business

loans.name: Joy Lord

texts.en:
Joy Lord is 31 years old with 4 children all in school.

She and her husband operate their wholesale toy store in their community.

Joy Lord business started with PhP 500 from their savings. She bought small toys in the market to be retailed at a table stall in front of the street in their area. Her business became popular as the children in their area patronized her toys. Then she added personal accessories for children such as ponytails, headbands and combs which increased her income.
 
Through time Joy Lord store grows from a single table into whole stall of toy store and now goes from retail into wholesale toy sale and delivery and earning a net of PhP 2,000-3,000 daily.

Just recently, a crisis hit Joy Lord when a fire broke out in their area and hit her home and her stocks of toys. But instead of backing down and succumbing to depression, Joy Lord used the crisis by buying small toy flashlights and sold it in the area. After 2 months she got her business back selling toys and repairing her house little by little.

Now Joy Lord is requesting a loan amounting to PhP 50, 000 to buy bulk of assorted toys to sell and deliver to her customers.

Joy Lord hopes to expand her store more to help her children in schooling and finish building her home again.

loans.use: To bulk buy assorted toys to sell and deliver to her customers, after a fire destroyed her business

loans.name: Gie Book Jom B Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Book Jom B de l’association ALLAW, regroupe cinq personnes qui habitent le même village. Le président s’appelle Birame Yandé, il gère une fontaine publique dans le village. Il a ouvert une cantine dans la maison où il commercialise des céréales ; il a une expérience de dix ans dans ce domaine et reste actif toute la journée. Il va acheter du mil, du maïs, du pain de singe, de l’arachide pour mettre dans sa cantine et revendre. Il peut avoir une recette journalière minimum de 5 000 à 7 000f cfa dont la moitié sert à la dépense quotidienne et l’autre moitié à renforcer le stock.
Il est marié et père d’une fille âgée de 18 ans. 
Birame Yandé a comme projet, d’agrandir son espace commercial et d’en faire un magasin.
texts.en:
The economic interest group “Book Jom B” of the association ALLAW is composed of five persons living in the same village. The president is named Birame Yandé. He manages a public fountain in the village. He opened a kiosk in his house where he markets grains; he has ten years of experience in this domain and is active the entire day. 

Birame Yandé  is going to purchase some millet, corn, monkey bread [the fruit of the baobab tree], and peanuts to stock his kiosk and make retail sales. His daily receipts may at least reach 5,000 to 7,000 francs CFA, of which half is for covering day-to-day expenses, and the other, for bolstering his inventory.  

Birame Yandé is a married father of an 18-year-old daughter. His plans include expanding his commercial space and making a store out of it.

loans.use: to purchase grains: millet, corn, and peanuts to resell

loans.name: Marlyne

texts.en:
Marlyne is 48 years old, widowed and has four children. The family is currently living in a rural community where they make their living by farming.

To make more money, Marlyne became an authorized dealer of an Aqua Pure water station in her community. She wants to continue and strengthen this business, but she has limited capital to draw on. For this reason she is asking for a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner ASKI to buy more gallons and other supplies she needs.

With this financial assistance Marylne believes that she will be able to further improve her business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more gallons and other supplies she needs.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen  is a married woman with two children ages 19 and 21 year old respectively from Alegria, Cebu. She operates a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells various commodities like bottled mineral water, soft drinks, canned goods, biscuits, chips, seasonings and toiletries. She has been running a store for 10 years now. Aside from that, she also raises and sells hogs.

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted groceries and pig feed. In this way, Belen would be able to raise and sells more hogs in few months to come. With these, her income will start to augment and able to handle her finances. She could now start to expand he business and manage her hog raising as well.

Belen hopes that she will be able to build a comfortable home for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries and pig  feed, thus to have a comfortable home for her family.

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 28 years old, living in Telavi district with his wife and an infant son. Davit works as a baker at a local bakery and generates daily income. In order to increase family income David decided to start an additional activity. 

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2700 USD. With the received credit he will purchase calves, raise them and will resell at higher price. This will increase his income and David will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase calves, raise and resell at a higher price in order to increase income and improve his family's living conditions

loans.name: Mutulani Adult Education Centre S.h.g Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand is Angelina. She is married and the mother of five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) to benefit from the trainings especially on savings mobilization and financial management.

She practices farming where she grows maize and beans. She is requesting a Kiva loan to buy organic fertilizer to increase the farming production of maize and beans, and hence, earn more income.

Angelina is so grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman and mother of two children, and they both attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity or piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar.  She faces a major challenge of customers waiting too long to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to start another business selling poultry.  She will use the loan to purchase chicks and chicken feed. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and chicken feed

loans.name: Phelestiana

texts.en:
Phelestiana is a married woman and mother of two children, both of which attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a metal shop business for the past seven years, selling metal scraps.  She faces a major challenge of transportation to her place of operations.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more scraps for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more metal scraps for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase vegetables and spices to resell in her stall

loans.name: Diana Yudith

texts.es:
Diana tiene 27 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico en la parte rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad pequeña donde la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como gallinas, patos, pollos, entre otros, cuenta con 10 años dedicándose a este rubro por lo que tiene experiencia y clientes fijos quienes brindan buenas referencias de ella. El destino del crédito será para la compra de más aves para incrementar el stock de su negocio, esto le generará mayores ingresos y así podrá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Diana is 27 years old and lives in a home of her own, built from rustic materials, in the Pucara district.  This is a small community where life is relaxed and its residents farm, work as merchants, or raise animals.  It’s located in the Jaen province and Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

She raises and sells small animals such as chickens, ducks, and others and has been doing it for 10 years.  She has experience and steady customers who provide her with good references.  She will use the money from this loan to buy more birds to increase her stock.  This will generate more income for her and she will be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chickens, etc.

loans.name: Asiou

texts.en:
Asiou, thirty years old, is married and has six children. For the past two years she has raised and tended sheep and goats. The income from her herd has enabled her to provide her family with food and household needs.

Asiou joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 where she obtained skills regarding enterprise development and financial management. This training helped her learn how to manage her business.

Asiou is borrowing 25,000 KES to buy fodder for her sheep and start raising chickens. She appreciates Kiva and their lenders for their support and help, and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her sheep and start raising chickens.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian  is married, and has one child who attends school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a poultry farming business. She sells eggs to restaurant operators and local neighbors. Her  major challenge is the high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase chicken feed and medicine for her chicken. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and medicine for her chicken

loans.name: Rohman

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! It’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Rohman. Rohman lives in Depok, located in the South of Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia.  Rohman is a young guy who has a huge spirit to become an entrepreneur. He owns a stall where he sells mobile airtime credits and mobile phone accessories to his community. 

He decided to join Ruma because he heard that Ruma has the best service and system. Rohman is a really hardworking young guy who wants to learn about anything new. His community sees him as an informative and trusted mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Rohman needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Rohman’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to establish an e-commerce business for his community, Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Rohman is smiling. He is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to process more prepaid mobile airtime purchases for members of his local community

loans.name: Hamiya

texts.en:
Homiya is a talented woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1974. She is married and has one child. 

For more than seven years now she has been teaching at a secondary school. She teaches math and students are satisfied with her teaching. She is well known in her community.  She likes her duty and wants her son to be educated as well. She hopes her son will be educated and helps his community by contributing to social change. 

She asked for a loan from KIVA lenders and IMON to pay for her son’s education. 

She awaits KIVA lenders kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s education

loans.name: Wendenda Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur LASSANE est le représentant du groupe WENDENDA. Marié, il est  père de 02enfants. Le plus âgé à 06 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. Personne ne va à l’école. Il a 04personnes en charge.
Monsieur vend des téléphones portable depuis plus de 03 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés de son quartier. 
Il veut s’acheter  08 téléphones portables.
Monsieur veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour aménager un point de vente. Il ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mr. LASSANE is the representative of the group WENDENDA. He is a married father of two children. The oldest is 6 years old, and the youngest is 3. None goes to school. He has four persons to support. LASSANE has been selling mobile phones for over three years. He gets his supplies from the markets in his district. He is going to purchase 8 mobile phones. LASSANE wants to use his profits to fix up a sales outlet. His ambition is to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase eight mobile phones

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
Cruz es un hombre que se encuentra muy agradecido por el crédito anterior pues gracias a ello logro comprar más productos y surtir mejor la tienda, él ahora ha mejorado mucha la calidad de vida de su familia, pues con esta inversión obtuvo muy buenas ganancias,   pero el nuevamente solicita un crédito porque tiene la necesidad de seguir mejorando su negocio comprando más productos como arroz, frijol, aceite, golosinas, jugos entre otros para satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes.
El gran sueño de Cruz es comprarse un carro y con ello realizar fletes y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Cruz is very grateful for the previous loan because thanks to it he was able to buy more products and better stock his store.  He is improving his quality of life now because this investment allowed him to improve his income, but now he is asking for another loan because he needs to continue improving his business by buying rice, beans, cooking oil, juices, and other things so he can better meet his customers’ needs.

Cruz’s great dream is to buy a car so he can move freight and increase his income.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is thirty-nine years old, married, and the mother of four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the enterprise development and financial management training.

She does dressmaking and is requesting a Kiva loan to buy an additional sewing machine that will enable her to improve her tailoring services to meet her customers' demands. She will then earn more income to meet her family's needs such as food, access to better health care and education. 
 
She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.  

She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy an additional sewing machine to improve her tailoring services

loans.name: Peris

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Peris. She is 48 years old, married, and has 6 children.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This improved her knowledge in business management in both her poultry and donkey transport businesses.

After the trainings, Peris was able to advance her donkey transportation services through proper record keeping and using the profits prudently.
With these skills she was able to educate her children and also provide them with enough food and clothing. 

Peris is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy another donkey to transport more water to meet the increased demand of water in the area. 

She appreciates Kiva for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy a donkey that will ensure transportation of water

loans.name: Kyeni Kya Muuini W.g Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand on the photo is called Peninah.  She is 37 years old and the mother of 3 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from the trainings, especially on enterprise development.

She practices dairy farming and sells milk in nearby markets. 

She is requesting a Kiva loan to buy feed which will enable her to increase her milk production and meet customers demands. 

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy feed to increase milk production

loans.name: Desideria

texts.en:
Fifty-five year old Desideria is a widow, and has a hog raising business.  She has one adult dependent. 

She raises and sells hogs to earn a living.  She has been raising hogs for 10 years now.  She is in need of funds to sustain her existing livelihood.

She is asking for a loan to buy pig feed.  This loan will help her raise healthy hogs for sale in the few months to come. Thus, Desideria will expand her hog raising business and improve her finances.

She hopes that, someday she will be able to build a comfortable home to live in.

loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Everlyin

texts.en:
Everlyin is a married woman with four kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Everlyin operates a vegetables stall, and sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the 20,000 KES loan she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Lali

texts.en:
Lali is a 50-year-old married woman, from Sagarejo district, Kakheti region. She lives with her husband and 2 sons, one of whom gets an invalid pension from the government, which is only for his medicines. 

The family is involved in small agricultural activities, they have cows and produce dairy products to sell. To satisfy her children's increased needs, Lali is eager to start a trading business that will give her a chance to make a more stable income. 

Lali requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The startup loan program envisages provisions for business startups and re-startup credits, with soft conditions for the country's rural poor who were regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income and lack of access to credit products. With the received credit, she will purchase food products that she will sell from her house. 

The family's living conditions will significantly improve and the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, in case of need. 

Lali will be very grateful for having a chance to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to start trading food products to get a stable source of income

loans.name: Minata's Group

texts.fr: Minata qui se trouve sur la photo arretant de la droite vers la gauche de la photo deuxieme dame, est membre d’un groupe de 20 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro qui vivent et travaillent dans le village de Samako au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Minata, âgée de 64 ans, est la mère de 4 enfants âgés de 22 à 40 ans, ils sont tous scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi son marriage avec un agriculteur, ont incité Minata à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 47 ans. Minata cultive l'arachide, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles et de main d'œuvre. Minata entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro et de l'image positive de myAgro dans les villages avoisinants. Cette année Minata effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.25 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 47 ans que Minata cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Elle a expliqué que, "nous faisons tout avec l'arachide." Minata planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerceet d'acheter du matériel agricole comme . Enfin Minata espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Minata, the woman standing second from the right in the photo, is a member of a group of twenty farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Samako, southwest of Bamako, in Mali. She is 64 years old and the mother of four children, aged 22 to 40, of whom all have been provided with schooling. 

Minata is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and of food self-sufficiency at home. Because of this and her marriage to a farmer, she was encouraged to do this work for 47 years. She grows peanuts and rice on her parcel of land. But, as a farmer, she must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of farm supplies and manual labor. 

Minata is starting her first year with myAgro and signed up because of the possibility of increasing her yields through the services offered by myAgro, as well because of the positive image myAgro has in the neighboring villages. This year, she is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts, so as to increase her yields on her 0.25 hectare parcel of land. 

She has been growing peanuts for 47 years for their commercial value as a staple crop. She explains that peanuts can be directly consumed by the family and are used as a sauce base in cooking. And peanuts also have commercial value, since they are a food she sells on the market. “We make everything with peanuts,” she explains. 

With greater yields and higher income, Minata is planning on working in commerce and purchasing farm supplies and equipment. Ultimately, she hopes also to cover her children’s schooling costs, as well as to ensure her family’s self-sufficiency in food.

loans.use: to acquire a packet of seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts in order to increase her farm output

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a 49-year-old mother who was blessed with three children. They live in a rural community and she earns their living through farming. Despite the hardship of living, she has the determination to become successful someday. To have additional income, Marilou operates a motorcycle transport business in her community. She aims to continue operating the business, but she has limited capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy wheels, spare parts, and accessories needed. 

Through this financial assistance, she believes that someday, she will earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy wheels, spare parts, and accessories needed

loans.name: Ruphence

texts.en:
Ruphence is a married woman and mother of two kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Ruphence operates a vegetables stall, and sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale

loans.name: Sompopo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está conformado por 3 mujeres muy emprendedoras (EUFEMIA, HOCENIA y REMALIN) todas pertenecen a la etnia miskita de Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron hace unas semanas, con el propósito de acceder a financiamiento para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, asegurar la educación de sus hijos y ampliar sus negocios. Ellas nombraron al grupo solidario sompopo ya que representa el trabajo en equipo para salir adelante.

EUFEMIA: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una mujer alegre de 34 años de edad. Casada con 3 hijos adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria. Su esposo trabaja como buzo. Ella, desde hace cinco años se dedica a la venta de chiverías, fritos, refrescos y gaseosas en un colegio del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Su jornada laboral inicia de lunes a viernes de 7:00am a 5:00pm. De esta manera, contribuye con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos. Esta solicitando su primer financiamiento para comprar chiverías, gaseosas, insumos e ingredientes para elaborar fritos y refrescos naturales: filipitas, repollo, tomate, pepino, vinagre, aceite, pollo, frutas, azúcar, entre otros productos. Sueña con establecer en su vivienda una pulpería y venta de bastimentos.
texts.en:
This group is composed of 3 very enterprising women (Eufemia, Hocenia, and Remalin). They all belong to the Miskita ethnic group of Bilwi, in the Puerto Cabezas Municipality. They were organized a few weeks ago with the purpose of accessing funding to improve their life conditions, being able to cover their households' basic needs, ensuring their children's education, and expanding their businesses. They named their solidary group Sompopo since it represents the teamwork to move forward. 

Eufemia is a member of the solidary group. She is a 34-year-old happy woman, married, and with 3 teenagers that are studying at primary and secondary school levels. Her husband works as a diver. For 5 years now, she's been selling dairy products, deep-fried snacks, and refreshments and carbonated drinks in a school at the Puerto Cabezas Municipality. Her working hours start from Monday through Friday, from 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM. In this way, she contributes to the household's expenses and her children's studies. 

She is requesting her first loan to buy dairy products, carbonated drinks, supplies and ingredients to make deep-fried snacks and natural drinks, "filipita" bananas, cabbage, tomatoes, cucumbers, vinegar, oil, chicken, fruits, sugar, among other products. She dreams of establishing a small grocery store in her home and selling food complements.

loans.use: to buy dairy products, carbonated drinks, and supplies and ingredients to make deep-fried snacks and natural drinks.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice resides in Moalboal, Cebu with her two-year-old daughter and husband. While her husband works as a cook, Alice operates a Sari-sari (variety) store to help in raising their child. 

She would now like to improve her inventory. She is asking for a loan from CEVI to buy seasoning and sachet items like coffee, milk, cooking oil, canned goods, and chips. Once her store is fully stocked, it is more attractive to her customers and they will not resort to buying goods downtown for their needs.
 
In the future, Alice hope to have her own restaurant as another business. She also dreams of sending her child to school.

loans.use: to buy items to restock her general store.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 67 years old and from Moalboal, Cebu. Even at her age, she works hard to earn a living by selling fresh fish in her neighborhood. She also raises hogs for additional income. This business started 30 years ago. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more fish for additional profit. Since Lucia also takes care of a four-year-old boy, her income will be used to buy healthy meals for her family and to feed her hogs. 

In the future, she hopes to build a house or apartment that she can rent out to other people for additional income.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Philisiter

texts.en:
Philisiter is married with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Philisiter operates a vegetable stall, where she sells vegetables at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Tuliya Group

texts.fr: Katsuva est une commerçante, membre d’un collectif de crédits «Tuliya», âgé de 51 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants, dont un seul est scolarisé et 7 autres n'etudient pas. Elle est vendeuse des bois de chauffage dans un marché de la ville depuis 1 an. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va s’approvisionner en un stère de bois de chauffage. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien  apporté aux entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique. Nous tenons a signaler que certaines clientes portent leur bébés.
texts.en:
Katsuva is a merchant and a member of the loan collective “Tuliya”. She is 51 years old and a married mother of eight children, of whom one is in school, and the seven others are not. Katsuva has been a vendor of firewood at a town market for a year. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She is going to supply herself with a cord of firewood. Thus, she would like to provide schooling and food for her children. 

She thanks Hekima for its support of entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system. We really want to indicate that certain clients are holding their babies.

loans.use: to supply herself with a cord of firewood

loans.name: Papaya Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Papaya, está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (MARIBEL, NILSKA JHAJAIRA y SANTOS BENITA), viven en Bilwi; municipio de Puerto Cabezas, se unieron hace un año, con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder tener acceso a préstamos en Pana Pana, que les permitiera incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar poco a poco las condiciones de vida de sus familias.

NILSKA JHAJAIRA: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una mujer luchadora, madre soltera de 2 hijos: El mayor de 10 años estudia su cuarto grado de primaria y un pequeño de 2 años. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa usada y artículos como trastes de manera ambulante, de esta manera genera ingresos propios y saca adelante a sus hijos, cubre los gastos del hogar y estudios de su hijo. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua: paca mixta para hombres y mujeres y venderla a precios accesibles a su clientela de Bilwi. Sueña con tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
The Papaya solidarity group is formed of 3 entrepreneurial women (Maribel, Nilska Jhajaira, and Santos Benita). They live in Bilwi, in the Puerto Cabezas municipality. They joined a year ago, with the intention of working together in solidarity to be able to have access to loans in Pana Pana which will permit them to increase the inventory of their small businesses, improve their income, and in that way little by little improve the living conditions of their families. 

Nilska Jhajaira is the coordinator of the solidarity group. She is a born fighter, single mother of 2 children: the oldest is 10 years old and is in the fourth grade and the little one is 2 years old. For the last two years, she has been selling used clothing and other items, like dishes, as a street vendor. In this way, she generates her own income and gets her children ahead, covers the household costs and the cost of her son's studies. She is asking for financing to buy in Managua: a bundle of clothing for men and women and to sell them at prices her clientele in Bilwi can afford. She dreams of having a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy in Managua: a bundle of clothing for men and women

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like canned goods, coffee, seasonings, cooking oil, noodles and toiletries. She is a married woman with six children. Three of her children still attend school, and are 11-16 years old.

Evelyn is asking for a loan to buy assorted groceries and food. These will enhance the stock of her store and attract more buyers to come. With these, her income will improve and she will be able to start handling her finances. She will be able to continue sending her children to school and providing for their needs as well.

In the future, Evelyn dreams of handling her sari-sari store to improve her family's living conditions, and she also hopes that someday she will be able to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries and food.

loans.name: Randy

texts.en:
Randy is a 32-year-old sari-sari store owner from Moalboal, Cebu. He is married with two children, who are three and eight years old. 

Randy's store has been operating for five years. He would like to increase his inventory. He is asking a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy shampoo, bath soap, detergent, canned goods, seasonings and noodles. His income will be used for providing his family with healthy meals and for his children's school expenses. In the future, he plans to buy a commercial van for a transportation business.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, bath soap, detergent, canned goods, seasonings and noodles.

loans.name: Morena Group

texts.es:
Es un grupo solidario mixto, está conformado por 2 mujeres y un hombre emprendedor (DELFINA ZENAIDA, GRISELDA ISABEL y MARTIN FRANCISCO); viven en Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas; se unieron hace año y medio, con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana  para poder tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios de venta de ropa usada y repostería y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.

Con el primer crédito otorgado por PANA PANA y financiado por KIVA, a las integrantes del grupo solidario le permitieron incrementar su inventario de ropa usada y venderla a precios accesibles a su clientela de Bilwi.

MARTIN FRANCISCO: Es nuevo integrante del grupo solidario, es un señor amable de 47 años de edad. Soltero, tiene una hija de 10 años de edad que estudia su sexto grado.  Con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, apoyar a su mamá, desde hace 20 años estableció un pequeño negocio de fritanga, en un tramo que tiene en uno de los mercados del municipio. Esta solicitando su primer financiamiento para mejorar el local. El sueña con diversificar el menú de la comida y refrescos que ofrece.
texts.en:
It is a mixed group, formed of 2 women and an enterprising man (Delfina Zenaida, Griselda Isabel, and Martin Francisco). They live in Bilwi, in the Puerto Cabezas municipality. They joined a year and a half ago with the intention of working in solidarity to be able to access loans through Pana Pana to be able to have the opportunity to improve their small businesses of selling used clothes and food, and in that way improve the quality of life of their families.

With the first loan received from Pana Pana and financed by Kiva, the members of the solidarity group were able to increase their inventory of used clothing and sell it at affordable prices to their clientele in Bilwi.

Martin Francisco: He is a new member of the solidarity group. He is a friendly 47-year-old man. He is single and has a 10 year old daughter who is in sixth grade. With the intention of having his own source of income and to support his mother, 20 years ago he started a small fried food business in a stall that he has in one of the municipality's markets. He is asking for his first financing to improve the stall. He dreams of diversifying the menu of food and drinks he offers.

loans.use: to improve his eatery

loans.name: Yvone

texts.en: Yvone is 32 years old. She is married with a nine-year-old son. For a year now, she has been operating a printing shop in Moalboal, Cebu where she and her family also live. She prints tarpaulin, advertising materials and accepts photocopying services. She is asking for a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy bond papers, tarpaulin and ink. Yvone hopes that she can build her own house and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy bond papers, tarpaulin and ink.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 59 years old and has three children. She and her husband operate a wholesale grocery store.

Nora started the business to help her husband with school and household expenses. From her husband's salary of 5,000 PHP from his former job, she rented a place in a market and opened a retail sari-sari store (grocery store). Since the location is in the market, their business easily gained customers, and they were able to become a wholesale grocery store with regular customers.

Today, Nora gains a net of 20,000 PHP monthly and has one helper in her wholesale grocery store. Nora, having a kind heart, helps her relatives by supporting her nieces and nephew in their education.

Nora is requesting a loan amounting to 30,000 PHP to buy 20 boxes each of noodles, biscuits, coffee, and canned goods, as well as bottled goods and other grocery items to sell in her store. These are in demand by her customers. 

In the future, Nora wants to expand her business to help her family with their expenses, to continue educating her children and to generate employment in her community.

loans.use: to buy 20 boxes each of noodles, biscuits, coffee, and canned goods, as well as bottled goods and other grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta is married, and has two kids who attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses come from domestic needs.
