For the past seven years, Marieta has operated a poultry farm business, which gives her a source of income. She sells her poultry to restaurant operators and local neighbours. Her major challenges are the high costs of transportation to her place of operation.

With the 50,000 KES she wants to purchase more chicken for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more chicken for her business.

loans.name: Jose Leonel

texts.es:
José es un ganadero de 47 años de edad, un hombre que desde tempranas horas de la mañana se levanta a realizar sus labores, mira sus vacas, sus reses, las alimenta, las rota de sitio, mira que no estén enfermas, que estén comiendo, un hombre preocupado y dedicado en cuerpo y alma a su profesión.

José vive solo, se separó de su esposa pero con ella tuvieron 3 hijos dos adolescentes y la menor de 12 años de edad, les envía dinero periódicamente para su sostenimiento, estudio y alimentación.

José llega a solicitar un préstamo por cuestión de necesidad, una enfermedad acabo con la vida de varios de su ganado, dejándolo con pocos animales para trabajar.

En base a este problema José quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar 4 terneros y vacunas, este préstamo le permitirá tener animales para trabajar y seguir cumpliendo con su deber de mandar dinero para el mantenimiento de sus hijos.

El sueño de José es en un futuro ver a sus hijos graduarse de la universidad y que se conviertan en unos profesionales exitosos.
texts.en: José is a 47 year old cattle farmer. He is a man who, from early morning, rises to do his chores, look at his cows, his cattle, feed them, rotates them from place to place, checks that they are not ill, and that they are fed. He is a concerned man, dedicated in body and soul to his profession. Jose lives alone, he separated from his wife and they had three children, two teenagers and the youngest who is 12 years old. He sends them money periodically for their support, studies, and food. Jose is asking for a loan for necessity. An illness ended the lives of some livetock leaving him with few cattle to work. Based on this problem, Jose wants to ask for  a loan to buy 4 calves and cows. This loan will allow him to have animals to work and continue his obligation to send money to support his children. Jose's dream is that in the future, he can see his children graduate from college and that they become successful professionals.

loans.use: To buy livestock because several animals died.

loans.name: Veranissie Elizabeth

texts.es: Veranissie de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y adornos para el hogar, tiene 10 años de tener su negocio el cual está ubicado en su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para surtir con mas productos y asi poder atender mejor a sus clientes y ella tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Veranissie is 35 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner. She sells clothing and home decorations for a living and has had her business in her place of residence for ten years. With the earnings she makes, she is able to pay for some of her household expenses. 

She is asking for a loan to purchase more wholesale merchandise in order to offer more products and thus be able to better serve her clients and make more profit.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and home decorations.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros tiene 15 años de experiencia en la actividad la cual inicio con capital propio, gracias a su trabajo y a la ayuda de su esposo es como pueden salir adelante con su familia, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Sandra is 37 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children. She sells women's and men's clothing for a living and has 15 years experience in this business, which she began with her own capital. Thanks to her work and the help of her husband, her family is able to get ahead. 

She is asking for a loan to purchase more wholesale clothing in order to continue with her sales and thus have more income.

loans.use: to purchase more wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Maimai Village. Musa joined Babban Gona to improve the lives of his family and children. Since joining Babban Gona, he no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to pay for his children's school fees.

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Musa will have access to high quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the national average of 14 bags per hectare. This year, Musa has set high goals of harvesting 55 bags of maize. With increased yields and income, Musa has made it his ultimate goal to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase yields.

loans.name: Luchie

texts.en:
Luchie is from Badian, Cebu. She is married and engaged in making mats. Mats are used like a mattress in a Filipino household. Many people use them and prefer using this type of mat for sleeping because it is cool to the skin. Some also prefer this type over a real mattress because of its affordability.

Luchie is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy buri and dye so that she can manufacture more mats to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and engage in other business ventures.

loans.use: to buy buri and dye.

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.en:
Zaynura is a hardworking woman. She was born into a family of workers in 1972. She lives in a rural area with her family. She is a widow and has four children. 

Zaynura has ten year of experience in business. She keeps livestock and plants agricultural products in her yard. It was hard for her after the death of her husband, because keeping livestock was her responsibility. Her sons help her in her business. 

She has decided to send her elder son to Russia to earn money, because in their area there are few jobs and low earnings. She appealed to IMON and asked for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a ticket for her son. She hopes to be supported and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a ticket for her son to go find work

loans.name: Rizky

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Rizky. Rizky lives in South Bogor, located in West Java, around two hour's drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. Rizky is a young guy who has a big passion for becoming an entrepreneur. He sells mobile airtime credits and mobile phone accessories to his community.

He decided to join Ruma because he heard that Ruma has the best service and system. His community sees him as an informative and trusted mobile provider. Rizky feels happy because since he joined Ruma, he can contribute more to his community and learn more about expanding his business.

As the business grows, Rizky needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Rizky’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to provide an e-commerce business for his community, through Ruma’s latest product, called Mapan. As seen in the photo, Rizky is the one who is standing in his own stall. He is thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Ayaga Yaro

texts.en:
Ayaga Yaro is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tafida Village. Ayaga Yaro joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ayaga Yaro will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. 

This season, Ayaga Yaro has ambitious goals to harvest 100 bags of maize. This will see him increase his household income considerably.  Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ayaga Yaro now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farm's yields

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She  owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past seven years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Mika

texts.en:
Mika is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Maimai Village. Mika joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Mika will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. 

This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Mika now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase the farm’s yields

loans.name: Sapto

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Now it’s time for you to meet one of Ruma’s agents, Sapto. Sapto lives in South Bogor, located in West Java, around two hour's drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. 

Sapto is a young guy who has big spirit to become an entrepreneur. He owns a stall that sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits to his community. He decided to join Ruma because he already heard before that Ruma has the best service and system. His community sees him as an informative and trusted mobile provider. 

As the business grows, Sapto needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. He will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to his community. Sapto’s goal towards Ruma in the nearly future is to serve as an e-commerce business for his community with Ruma’s latest product called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Sapto is the one who is smiling. He is thankful for your kind and endless support.

loans.use: to give his community better access to communication services by selling mobile airtime credits.

loans.name: Nhóm 40 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en:
Hien, 53, makes about $35 monthly working in the rice paddies. She has three grown children but they don't have stable jobs or decent income yet. Besides that, her mother has been sick for the whole year and is unable to move by herself. 

Due to the economic hardship, her household does not have a hygienic latrine yet. However, as a member of the local Women's Union since 1985, she recently joined a campaign to improve the community's sanitation and hygiene. With this loan, she will be able to buy bricks, cement and sand in order to build a hygienic toilet at home. This will not only improve her family's quality of life but also contribute to environmental protection. 

In the picture, Hien is pictured first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Siaka's Group

texts.fr: Siaka qui se trouve assit sur la photo, est membre d’un groupe de 12 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro qui vivent et travaillent dans le village de Samako au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Siaka, âgé de 55 ans, est le père de 9 enfants âgés de 1 à 20 ans, dont 6 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Siaka à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 35 ans. Siaka cultive le mais, le mil, le sorgho, le maraichage, le coton sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Siaka entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison des formations et techniques agricoles. Cette année Siaka effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 25 ans que Siaka cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Siaka planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage comme . Enfin Siaka espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Siaka, who is seated on the photo, is a member of a group of 12 crop farmers enrolled in myAgro, who live and work in the village of Samako, to the southwest of Bamako, Mali.

55-year-old Siaka is the father of nine children from one to 20 years of age, six of whom are currently attending school. The family tradition is anchored in agricultural practice, which is the main source of income and food self-sufficiency of the home. To ensure his family's self-sufficiency, Siaka has practiced this activity for the past 35 years.

Siaka cultivates maize, millet, sorghum, garden vegetables and cotton on his parcel of land, but as a farmer must face difficulties such as lack of rain and agricultural equipment. Siaka is in his first year with myAgro, and enrolled because of the training in agricultural techniques that was offered.

This year Siaka is making payments to buy a package of myAgro OPV (Open-Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertilizer to cultivate maize and increase the crop yield on his 0.5 hectare plot (1.24 acres). Siaka has been growing maize for the past 25 years for its nutritional value and also for its productivity and commercial value.

With increased yields and income, Siaka plans to raise livestock. Finally, he also hopes to ensure his family's food self-sufficiency.

loans.use: buy a package of OPV (Open-Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and benefit from training in agricultural techniques from myAgro

loans.name: William Andres

texts.es:
William junto con su madre trabaja en su hogar vendiendo mercancía, realizan esta actividad por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente y por tener una actividad económica para sostenerse, solo son ellos dos contra el mundo y siempre buscan alternativas para mejorar sus ingresos.
La actividad el inicio en el año 2014 desde entonces les ha ido muy bien, venden bien, pagan sus cuentas, y están en la constante búsquedas de clientes y alianzas para formalizar cada vez más su negocio pues su sueño es a finalizar este año tener un local comercial.
La primicia de William junto a su socia (su madre, ver foto), es mejorar las ventas, salir a vender a las calles aumentar sus clientes, incrementar ganancias y en un futuro generar empleo, quiere tener un grupo de vendedoras distribuidos por toda la ciudad ofreciendo sus productos en almacenes y centros comerciales.
William quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de surtido en calzado, del préstamo destinara el 66.7% y el resto en camisas y jeans.
texts.en:
William and his mother work in their home selling merchandise. They do this work because they enjoy it and they have a vocation for working independently and to have an economic activity to sustain themselves. It is only the two of them against the world and they are always looking for options to improve their income. 

They started this work in 2014, and since then it has gone really well. They sell well, pay their bills, and they are constantly looking for clients and partners to formalize their business. Their dream is to have a commercial establishment by the end of this year.

William and his mother's (see photo) first priority is to improve sales, to go out and sell in the streets to increase their clientele, increase earnings, and in the future create jobs. They want to have a group of vendors distributed throughout the city, offering their products in stores and shopping malls.

William is asking for a loan, which he will invest in buying an assortment of shoes, to which 66.7% of the loan will go, and the rest will be invested in shirts and jeans.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of shoes, to which 66.7% of the loan will go to, and the rest will be invested in shirts and jeans.

loans.name: Moriba's Group

texts.fr: Moriba qui se trouve sur la photo au centre, portant un boubou blanc, 2 eme personne de gauche à droite, est membre d’un groupe de 4 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Soulouba au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Moriba, âgé de 89 ans, est le père de 7 enfants âgés de 15 à 57 ans, dont aucun d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Moriba à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 89 ans. Moriba cultive l'arachide, le maïs, le sorgho, le riz, le maraichage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et de terres cultivables. Moriba entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison des engrais de qualité. Cette année Moriba effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 1 an que Moriba cultive le maïs pour sa valeur commerciale, car le maïs est un aliment qu'il vend sur le marché. Moriba planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'acheter du matériel agricole . Enfin Moriba espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Moriba, the second person from left to right in the photo and wearing a white robe, is a member of a group of four crop farmers enrolled in myAgro, who live and work in the village of Soulouba, to the southeast of Bamako, Mali.

89-year-old Moriba is the father of seven children from 15 to 57 years of age, none of whom currently attend school. The family tradition is anchored in agricultural practice, the main source of income and food self-sufficiency of the home, which prompted Moriba to practice this activity all his life.

Moriba cultivates groundnuts, maize, sorghum, rice and garden vegetables on his parcel of land, but as a farmer must face difficulties such as lack of rain, agricultural equipment and arable land. Moriba is in his first year with myAgro, and enrolled because of the fertilizer's quality.

This year Moriba is making payments to buy a package of myAgro OPV (Open-Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertilizer to cultivate maize and increase the crop yield on his 0.5 hectare plot (1.24 acres). Moriba has been growing maize for one year for its commercial value, because maize is a food product he sells at the market..

With increased yields and income, Moriba plans to acquire agricultural equipment. Finally, he also hopes to ensure his family's food self-sufficiency.

loans.use: buy a package of OPV (Open-Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertilizer to cultivate maize

loans.name: Auzenda

texts.pt:
Viúva a 18 anos, mãe de 3 filhos 2 maiores e 1 menor ainda a estudar, tem 44 anos de idade, estudou ate 7ª classe, vive na casa própria que construiu sozinha apos ter perdido marido, vive a base de negocio de venda de carne de vaca a mais de 15 anos sua única fonte de renda e esta a repetir o credito pela 8ª vez . Investe todo seu negocio  na melhoria das condições de sua vida. 
Com  o empréstimo pretende comprar uma cristaleira .
Seu maior sonho é tirar carta de condução e comprar uma viatura que facilite o transporte da carne ate aos seus clientes.
Ela se sente uma mulher realizada, toma credito apenas para manter o seu nome activo na Hluvuku, porque tem capital suficiente para o seu negocio.
texts.en: As a widow for 18 years, Auzenda has been caring for her 3 children - 2 of whom are already fully grown and 1 more is still studying - and living in the home that she built on her own after her husband passed away. She has been running her own beef business for the last 15 years and this is her only source of income. She invests all of her income in improving her living conditions so this will be her 8th loan cycle, with which she plans to buy a cabinet. Her dream is to one day pass her driving test and buy a vehicle which would enable her to deliver her meat products to her customers. She feels quite fulfilled and is applying for this loan merely as a way of keeping her name active with Hluvuku, as she currently has enough money to maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy a cabinet

loans.name: Celia

texts.pt:
Mãe viúva de 36 anos de idade que muito cedo perdeu marido, tem 4 filhos menores a estudarem e seus únicos dependentes.  vive na casa própria, é negociante a mais de 10 anos e com os rendimentos do seu negocio que cria os seus filhos, esta a tomar o credito pela 2ª vez, com o primeiro ampliou o seu negocio e conseguiu devolver antes do tempo previsto.
Com o mesmo pretende ampliar o seu negocio na compra de diversos produtos alimentares como: arroz, açúcar, óleo, ovos, farinha, bebidas, etc, os mesmos são vendidos em sua barraca no mercado local.
Desenvolver mais o negocio, construir um estabelecimento comercial maior e melhorar as condições de vida de seus filhos e da sua casa, é o seu maior sonho, bem como adquirir uma viatura que lhe facilite o transporte de sua mercadoria.
A falta de fundos suficientes e o facto de ser a chefe da família constitue o maior desafio.
texts.en: Celia is a 36 year old widowed mother who lost her husband very early. She has 4 young children who are all still studying and these are her only dependents; they all live together in their own home. Celia has been running her own business for the last 10 years and she uses the income earned to raise her children. This will be her second loan cycle and she used her first loan to expand her business and even managed to repay her loan early. She plans to use this loan to further expand her business by buying a diverse range of food items, such as: rice, sugar, cooking oil, eggs, flour and soft drinks as she sells these items on her stall at the local market. She dreams of growing her business, setting up her own larger shop and improving her children's living conditions as well as their home. The greatest challenges that she faces are owing to her lack of money and the fact that she is the head of her household.

loans.use: to buy a diverse range of food items, such as: rice, sugar, cooking oil, eggs, flour and soft drinks.

loans.name: Awaskira Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Awaskira, es un grupo mixto integrado por 2 mujeres y un varon (ALICIA, NORMA YESENIA y JORGE LUIS) de la ciudad de Bilwi, Municipio Puerto Cabezas, se unieron hace un año, para acceder a financiamiento mediante crédito para ir incrementando sus pequeños negocios de venta de granos básicos y abarrotería, para mejorar sus ingresos y poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de sus hogares, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas.

Con los 2 financiamientos anteriores otorgados por Pana Pana y financiados por KIVA, le permitieron incrementar el inventario de sus productos de sus pequeñas pulperías, diversificar sus productos, actualmente venden verduras y bastimentos.

JORGE LUIS: Es nuevo integrante del grupo solidario, es un joven emprendedor de 36 años de edad. Soltero. Con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 3 estableció su pequeño negocio de venta de artículos de vidrios para el hogar en un tramo que alquila, pagando una mensualidad de C$2000 (Dos Mil Córdobas Netos). Esta solicitando financiamiento su primer financiamiento para comprar en Managua: platos, vasos, picheles, panas de vidrios y venderlos a precios accesibles a su clientela de Bilwi. El sueña con diversificar sus productos.
texts.en:
The Awaskira loan group has three members – two women, Alicia and Norma Yesenia, and one man, Jorge Luis. They are from the city of Bilwi in Puerto Cabezas municipality. The group came together one year ago in order to apply for a loan and expand their little businesses selling groceries and basic grains. They also wanted to increase their income and to be able to cover basic household expenses, and pay for their children’s education and to make improvements to their homes.

Using the two previous loans granted by Pana Pana and funded by Kiva, the group members have invested and increased stock at their grocery stores. The members have diversified their products and now sell vegetables and other foods.

Jorge Luis is a new member to the group. He is 36 years old, enterprising and single. With an aim of having his own source of income, three years ago he started a small business selling glass products for the home. He sells his products at a stall that he rents for 2000 Córdobas per month.

Jorge is applying for a loan in order to buy plates, cups, mugs, and glass bowls in Managua. He will sell the products at affordable prices to his customers in Bilwi. Jorge dreams of diversifying his product range.

loans.use: to buy plates, cups, mugs, and glass bowls in Managua.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
Comprar una cerda de cría, pollos de engorde, gallinas ponedoras e insumos para alimentar sus animales son los motivos por los cuales Dora se encuentra solicitando un préstamo, Ella que es una mujer del campo que solo tiene su granja para ganar ingresos y mantenerse, no tiene hijos solo son su pareja y ella, trabajando diariamente por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y que tratan de aprovechar cada oportunidad que se les presenta como lo está, con lo que compraran los animales y el alimento que necesitan para consolidar y mantener su negocio,
Tu apoyo permitirá que una familia campesina tenga materia prima para trabajar y seguir realizando la actividad que han hecho gran parte de su vida y que esperan trasmitirla a futuras generaciones si es que llegan a tener hijos.
texts.en:
Dora is motivated to apply for a loan because she wants to: buy a sow to raise, buy chickens to fatten up and laying hens, and buy supplies to feed her animals. Dora is from the countryside. She has only her farm to earn an income and support herself. She has a partner but no children. Dora works every day in order to improve her living conditions. She tries to take advantage of every opportunity, including this loan. She will use the loan to buy the animals and feed she needs to strengthen and maintain her business.

Your support will give a peasant family the basic materials to work and continue in the trade that has become such a big part of their lives. This trade will be passed on to future generations if the couple has children.

loans.use: to buy chickens, hens and feed.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.pt:
Tem 57 anos de idade, pai de 7 filhos dos quais 2 maiores de idade e apenas 5 ainda sob sua responsabilidade, cuida de netos que vivem com eles, é antigo combatente e tem casa própria. Vive na   base de negocio e de agricultura de subsistência. Está repetindo o credito pela 3ªvez, com os anteriores conseguiu construir um estabelecimento com material convencional, pois antes vendia num de material precário.
Com o credito pretende comprar:  açúcar, amendoim, óleo, farinha, massas, fósforo, velas, rebuçados, arroz, feijão, bebidas, etc, para ampliar o seu negocio que faz numa banca que acabou de construir em sua casa.
O seu maior sonho, é melhorar o seu negocio e crescer para loja e poder  pedir ao banco valores mais elevados e começar a construção de sua casa pois, já tem uma parte do material acumulado.
A sua maior dificuldade é o fraco negocio, dado que na zona onde vive maior parte da população vive de agricultura,  o que faz com que os seus produtos demorem a ser comprados, mas mesmo assim gostaria de diversificar para satisfazer a procura destes.
texts.en: Pedro is 57 years old and is a father to his 7 children: 2 of whom are fully grown and his 5 other children are still living in his care. He also cares for his grandchildren who live with him. Pedro is a former soldier and he lives in his own home, using the income earned from his business and subsistence farming to provide for his family's needs. This will be his third loan cycle and he has used his previous loans to build himself some premises, using conventional building materials, from which to sell his goods as prior to that his stall was precariously built. He plans to use this loan to buy sugar, peanuts, cooking oil, flour, pastries, matches, candles, candies, rice, beans and soft drinks etc in order to expand his business, which he has set up in his home. He dreams of expanding his business, being able to set up a proper shop and to apply for larger loans from the bank as well as starting to build his own home as he has already gathered some of the building materials he will need. The greatest difficulty that he faces is building up his business as most people in the area make their living from agriculture and, consequently, it can take a long time for him to sell his goods; however, he would like to diversify the range of goods that he offers in order to satisfy those who are seeking such items.

loans.use: to buy sugar, peanuts, cooking oil, flour, pastries, matches, candles, candies, rice, beans and soft drinks etc.

loans.name: Recuperando Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres luchadoras (JUANA PASTORA, LEANICIA y YOLANDA) que se integraron hace aproximadamente año y medio, para gestionar  financiamiento mediante créditos con garantía solidaria, para comprar mercadería para sus pequeños negocios de venta de ropa usada y bastimentos. De esa manera poder vender más y mejorar sus ingresos. Todas ellas quieren lograr mejorar sus condiciones de vida, poder cubrir las necesidades básicas, asegurar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar sus viviendas. Ellas decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario recuperando, porque con los créditos otorgados por Pana Pana y financiado por KIVA, le han permitido irse recuperando poco a poco en sus negocios y calidad de vida.

JUANA PASTORA: Es la Coordinadora del grupo solidario recuperando, es una señora jovial de 37 años de edad, pertenece a la etnia miskita del municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Está casada, tiene 1 hijo de 15 años que estudia su tercer año de secundaria. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como pescador artesanal. Con el propósito de apoyar con los gastos del hogar y estudios de su hijo, desde hace 3 años vende ropa usada en un tramo que alquila en uno de los mercados del municipio, pagando una mensualidad de C$100 (Cien Córdobas Netos). Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua 2 pacas de ropa usada mixta y una para niño. Ella sueña con establecer una tienda de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
This communal bank is formed by 3 determined women (Juana Pastora, Leanicia and Yolanda). They got together about one and a half years ago to manage funding through joint guarantee loans in order to buy merchandise for their small businesses selling used clothing and supplies. They all want to be able to improve their living conditions, to be able to cover the basic needs, to assure their children's education, and to improve their homes.  They decided to name their communal bank "Recuperando" because the loans given by Pana Pana and financed by KIVA have allowed them to recuperate themselves little by little in their businesses and quality of life. 

Juana Pastora is the coordinator of the Recuperando loan group. She is a cheerful 37 year old woman. She belongs to the Miskito ethnic group from the town of Puerto Cabezas. She is married and has one 15 year old son that is in his third year of high school. Her husband works informally as an artesanal fisherman. With the purpose of supporting the house expenses and her son's schooling, for 3 years she has sold used clothing in a section that she rents in one of the markets of the town, paying C$100 (Cien Córdobas Netos) each month. She is asking for funding to buy 2 bundles of mixed clothing and one for children in Managua. She dreams of setting up a new clothing store.

loans.use: to buy 2 bundles of mixed used clothing and one for children in Managua.

loans.name: Sitan's Group

texts.fr: Sitan qui se trouve assit sur la photo, au premier rang  avec le bracelet vert de MyAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 18 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivent et travaillent dans le village de Samako au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Sitan, âgée de 60 ans, est la mère de 7 enfants âgés de 30 à 40 ans, dont deux d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi son marriage avec un agriculteur, ont incité Sitan à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 50 ans. Elle a mentionné que, "je suis née dans l'agriculture." Sitan cultive l'arachide, le riz, le maraichage,l'haricot sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles et d'herbicides. Elle a partagé que, "sans engrais les cereales sont des œuvres." Sitan entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison d'essayer le modèle de MyAgro. Cette année Sitan effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 40 ans que Sitan cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Sitan planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage comme . Enfin Sitan espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que financer le mariage de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Sitan, sitting in the first row in the photo wearing myAgro's green bracelet, is a member of a group of 18 crop farmers enrolled in myAgro, who live and work in the village of Samako, to the southwest of Bamako, Mali.

60-year-old Sitan is the mother of seven children from 30 to 40 years of age, of whom two currently attend school. The family tradition is anchored in agricultural practice, the main source of income and food self-sufficiency of the home. Being married to a farmer also prompted Sitan to practice this activity for over 50 years. She mentioned she was "born a farmer".

Sitan cultivates groundnuts, rice, garden vegetables and beans on her parcel of land, but as a farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of agricultural equipment and herbicides. She said that "growing cereals without fertilizers is a work of art". Sitan is in her first year with myAgro, and enrolled to try out the myAgro model.

This year Sitan is making payments to buy a package of myAgro OPV (Open-Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts and increase the crop yield on her 0.0625 hectare plot (0.15 acres).

Sitan has been growing groundnuts for over 40 years for its food value, explaining that groundnuts are directly edible by the family and used as a basic sauce for food preparations. They also have commercial value, as groundnuts are a food product she sells at the market.

With increased yields and income, Sitan plans to raise livestock. Finally, she also hopes to cover the children's tuition fees and finance her children's weddings.

loans.use: buy a package of OPV (Open-Pollinated Variety) seeds and fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts and benefit from myAgro's training in agricultural techniques

loans.name: Antonio

texts.pt:
Sr. António é casado maritalmente pai de 6 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os 12 a 25 anos de idade, tem como seus dependentes duas enteadas, é reformado e neste momento dedica se mais na actividade agrícola especificamente a apicultura, tem dois tanques que possuem peixe. 
E cliente da Hluvuku-Adsema já a bastante tempo, tendo conhecida a mesma a partir de amigos e colegas de trabalho. Com o valor financiado pretende comprar uma viatura da marca Tata que pretende usa lá na sua actividade agrícola. Tem como sonho produzir peixe em grandes quantidades nos seus tanques e melhora-los, e posterior a produção de hortícolas.
Tem como seu principal desafio multiplicar os tanques para produção do peixe e melhora-los.
texts.en: António is a married father to 6 children who ages range between 12 and 25, and he is also responsible for caring for his two stepdaughters. He is retired and currently makes his living from farming, in particular from bee keeping, and he also has two tanks containing fish. He has been a Hluvuku-Adsema customer for some time, ever since his friends and work colleagues told him about the institution. He plans to use this loan to buy a Tata vehicle which he wants to use to assist with his farming activities. He dreams of improving his fish tanks so that he can produce greater numbers of fish and then he would like to expand into growing vegetables.The greatest challenge that he faces is increasing the number of fish tanks that he owns and increasing his production of fish.

loans.use: to buy a Tata vehicle.

loans.name: Candido

texts.pt:
Sr. Cândido é casado maritalmente pai de dois filhos, tem mais uma sobrinha e sua mãe como dependentes. Vive neste momento numa casa de material precário e com o valor financiado pretende comprar 40 sacos de cimento, 12 caixas de tijoleira, uma porta e  pagar a mão de obra para terminar a sua casa.
Tem como seu maior sonho ter uma criação de gado bovino e caprino, e gostaria de ter uma viatura para uso pessoal. Seu maior desafio é concluir a sua casa e fazer um furo de água na sua residência.
texts.en: Cândido is a married father to 2 children and he is also financially responsible for his niece and his mother. He currently lives in a flimsily-built house and he plans to use this loan to buy 40 sacks of cement, 12 cases of bricks, a door and to pay labour costs so that he can finish the building work on his home. He dreams of raising cattle and goat herds and he would like to buy a vehicle for personal use. The greatest challenge that he faces is finishing the building work on his home and boring a hole for a water tap on his property.

loans.use: to buy 40 sacks of cement, 12 cases of bricks, a door and to pay labour costs so that he can finish building his home.

loans.name: Celina

texts.pt: Sra Celina é mae solteira, tem de dois filhos do sexo feminino e masculino com idades compreendidas entre 11 e 12 anos. É cliente KIVA e da instituiçao pela primeira vez. Esperando desde ja trabalhar com a Hluvuku pois tem muitos projectos que espera concretizá-los com a ajuda da mesma. Com o montante financiado a cliente pretende comprar material de construçao nomeadamente: 20 sacos de cimento e nove chapas de zinco pra a cobertura da sua obra. Do momento seu maior desafio é concluir sua obra porque a casa onde esta a viver actualmente é feita de material precario. Em termos de sonhos e esperança, a nível profissional sente se satisfeita e a nível pessoal a cliente sonha em gerir um negocio próprio que ira ajudar no sustento do seu agregado
texts.en: Celina is a single mother to 2 children - one girl and one boy - who are aged 11 and 12. This is her first time applying for a loan through a microfinance institution and she hopes to apply for further loans with Hluvuku in the future as she has many projects which she would like to undertake with the institution's help. She plans to use this loan to buy building materials, namely 20 sacks of cement and 9 zinc corrugated roofing sheets for her home. Currently the greatest challenge that she faces is finishing the building work on her home as the house she now lives in is rather precariously built. With regards to her hopes and dreams for the future, she is quite satisfied with her professional life and, on a personal level, she would like to run her own business which would help her to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as 20 sacks of cement and 9 zinc corrugated roofing sheets for her home.

loans.name: Evenaldo

texts.pt:
Sr.Evenaldo é casado maritalmente, pai de um filho vivendo este com sua ex esposa, tem como dependentes suas duas irmãs. É cliente da Hluvuku-Adsema pela segunda vez, o valor financiado será usado para compra de 18 chapas de zinco, 15 sacos de cimento, uma carrada de pedra e pagamento de transporte do material. 
Tem como sonhos ver suas irmãs casadas e a trabalharem e a nível pessoal sente se satisfeito, o seu principal desafio e concluir a sua casa.
texts.en: Evenaldo is a married father to one son, who currently lives with his ex-wife from whom he is separated, and he is also financially responsible for his 2 sisters. This will be his second time applying for a loan through Hluvuku-Adsema and he plans to use this loan to buy 18 sheets of corrugated zinc roofing, 15 sacks of cement, a large amount of stone and to pay for hiring a vehicle to transport all these materials. He dreams of seeing his sisters happily married and in work. Personally, he feels satisfied with his life and the greatest challenge that he faces is finishing the building work on his home.

loans.use: to buy 18 sheets of corrugated zinc roofing, 15 sacks of cement, a large amount of stone and to pay for hiring a vehicle to transport these materials.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 55 years old, married and has five children. Two of her five children are presently in school.

Myrna is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Myrna has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer d 35 años de edad, feliz y alegre, se pasea por las calles de Sincelejo visitando sus clientes, ella ofrece servicios de manicura y pedicura a domicilio, carga su bolso en el cual tiene todos los implementos necesario para dar un buen servicios y dejar un trabajo de uñas admirables en cada uno de sus clientes.

Claudia empezó su negocio pro necesidad económica, en Sincelejo no abundan las oportunidades de empleo y es más por emprendimiento que por emplearse que las familias logran salir adelante.
Junto con su marido se dividen los gastos y se propusieron un sueño el cual es pagar a sus tres hijos que hoy en día tienen 13, 7, 5 una educación digna y de calidad, ofrecerles un hogar cómodo, amoroso, estable y cuando salgan a flote y ganen muchísimo dinero viajar y conocer otros países.

Claudia quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de implementos para realizar su trabajo de manicura y pedicura, esmaltes, barnice, limas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Claudia is a happy and cheerful woman of 35 years. She walks the streets of Sincelejo visiting her customers at home to offer her manicure and pedicure services. She is carrying her bag in which she has all the supplies needed to give a good service and carry out an admirable nail job for each of her customers.

Claudia started her business because of financial needs. There are few job opportunities in Sincelejo and most families make a living through entrepreneurship rather than through employment.

She shares the household expenses together with her husband. They dream about being able to pay for a decent and quality education for their three children, that are 13, 7, and 5 at the moment, and about offering them a comfortable, loving, and stable home. And when they stand on their own feet for them to earn a lot of money and be able to travel and get to know other countries.

Claudia is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her manicure and pedicure business, such as nail polish, gloss, files, and so on.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her manicure and pedicure business, such as nail polish, gloss, files, and so on.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a metal shop business for the past five years, selling scrap metal. A major challenge for her is transportation. Joyce is requesting a loan to purchase metal scraps to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase metal scraps to resell.

loans.name: David Dio

texts.en:
David Dio is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Sarki Kuya Village. David Dio joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, David Dio will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds. This will will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, which is double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags/hectare. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, David Dio now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilisers, herbicides and seeds to improve the farm's yield.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn is married and works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines.

Rodelyn requested a PHP 5,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional hot dogs, ham, sausages and other frozen foods to sell.

Rodelyn has been in this business for four years now. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional hotdogs, ham, sausages and other frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Gulnoza

texts.en:
Gulnoza is a creative woman. She was born into a family of workers in 1989. She is living in a rural area with her family, and is married with one child. Her husband is a constructor and works seasonally. 

Gulnoza has many years of experience in the agricultural business. She keeps, feeds, and trades livestock. She has two heads of livestock in her working capital. Progressively she wants to enlarge her business. 

She is asking for financial support from KIVA lenders to pay for an event to celebrate her anniversary. The money would be spent on food and items like tablecloths. She hopes to be supported, because the event is her anniversary.

loans.use: to pay for an event celebrating her anniversary.

loans.name: Nafisa

texts.en:
Nafisa is a wise woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1983. She is living in a small town with her family. She is married and has four children. 

Nafisa has 13 year of experience doing business. Her first business was planting cotton and cereals. She did not get a good harvest from that business and had to declare bankruptcy. Then she decided to go into business planting watermelons, melons, tomatoes and so on. Now she is satisfied with her business and gets a good harvest. 

She is planning to dig wells and has asked for the help of KIVA and IMON. She hopes her business will be efficient and feed her family.

loans.use: to dig wells.

loans.name: Dunyamali

texts.en:
Dunyamali is a 45-year-old married man with four kids. His family are internally displace persons (IDPs) and they live in an IDP settlement. His wife is a housekeeper.  

Dunyamali has been raising livestock such as sheep and cows for 20 years. He sells milk, meat and sheep wool at the local bazaar and earns 230 AZN monthly. The region in which he lives is very cold in winter, which is why the demand for wool is very high. People make coats, jackets, gloves and socks to keep themselves warm. They use the meat to prepare dishes every day and drink milk because it is very useful for health.

Dunyamali wants to increase his income because his current earnings are not enough to cover the demands of life. He applied for a loan of 1,200 AZN in order to buy more livestock. Please support him.

loans.use: to buy more sheep and cattle.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 60 years old and a mother of 3 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2012 so as to benefit from the trainings, especially on savings mobilization, enterprise development and financial management.

She operates a food cafe and she is seeking a Kiva loan to buy more stock which will enable her to meet her customers' demands by providing different varieties of food. This will greatly increase her income and enable her pay for her family's needs including education, clothing and food.

Dorcas is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her cafe to meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a Babban Gona farmer from Dutse Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realise better yields from his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to increase his farmland. Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, increasing his income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim now has the opportunity to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertlizers, herbicides and seeds to increase the farm's yield.

loans.name: Nhóm 41 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lan, 43, works in agricultural production with a monthly income of about US $20. She is married but her husband went away years ago and left her with three children. The two elder ones are still in university while the youngest one is suffering from amnesia due to a traffic accident. Moreover, her mother has been paralytic for three years and she herself also has a chronic disease. Her household is among the poorest ones in her commune and does not have a sanitary toilet yet. 

Lan has been a member of the local Women's Union since 1985. She is fully aware of the fact that using a degraded double-pit latrine has many risks, including potential adverse effects on the health of her family members and her community, as well as environmental contamination. With this loan, Lan will build a septic tank toilet, which will improve the hygiene and health for the family members and contribute to sanitary improvement in her community. In this photo, Lan is pictured first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap.

loans.name: Yonatan Antonio

texts.es:
Quien se lo propone lo puede, Yonathan un joven de tan solo 21 años de edad ya lleva un año de operación en un negocio que con sus ahorros y creatividad formo un negocio en cuál  es la venta de ropa como jean, blusas, faldas, abrigos, pantalones, camisetas todo para damas, este joven no solo monto el local, lo adorno y lo pinto a su gusto y míralo vendiendo y luchando por salir adelante demostrando las cualidad y la madera del que está hecho.
Yonathan tiene su negocio para poder cumplir sus sueños, se paga sus estudios, ayuda a su madre con los gastos del hogar, pero desde ya quiere lo suyo, quiere comprar una vivienda, iniciar con un terreno e ir consiguiendo los materiales poco a poco para ir formando lo que será su fortaleza, que seguro que con el orden, entusiasmo, disciplina, responsabilidad de este joven lo lograra.
 Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de accesorios en acero, como aretes, pulseras, manillas, comprara relojes, y objetos en general para dama.
texts.en:
Where there is a will, there is a way. Yonatan is a young man of only 21 years, and he has already been running a business for a year. With his savings and his creativity he built a business selling women's clothes like jeans, blouses, skirts, coats, pants, and shirts. This young man did not only set up the store, he decorated and painted it after his liking. One can see how he is selling and fighting to make a living, demonstrating his qualities and the material he is made of.

Yonatan runs his business to be able to realize his dreams: to pay for his education, and to help his mother with her household expenses. But he already likes to have his own. He wants to buy a house, starting with the land, and then little by little get the materials to build what will be his castle, which surely he will achieve with his neatness, his enthusiasm, his discipline, and his responsibility.

He is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of accessories made of steel, like earrings, bracelets, wristlets, watches, and lady's objects in general.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of accessories made of steel, like earrings, bracelets, wristlets, watches, and lady's objects in general.

loans.name: Gie Seelal Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Seelal de l’association ALLAW est composé de cinq femmes qui s’activent dans le commerce et la transformation. La dame Daba, est commerçante et transformatrice. Elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont l’ainé, un garçon de 22 ans et son plus jeune enfant âgé de 5 ans.
Daba a démarré son commerce il y a de cela 4 ans, un commerce de chaussures. Grâce au crédit, elle va pouvoir acheter 40 à 50 paires dont la moitié est une commande. Pour l’autre moitié, elle fera l’ambulant pour le vendre, pour cela, elle tourne de 10h à 13h et l’après midi de 15h à 18h. Avec les recettes, elle participe à la dépense quotidienne du foyer et aux besoins de ses enfants.
Daba travaillait dans un hôtel, elle aimerait bien reprendre afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et augmenter son fond de commerce.
texts.en:
“GIE Seelal” of the association “ALLAW” is composed of five women who are active in business and transformation. The woman Daba is a shopkeeper and transformative woman. She is married and the mother of 6 children of whom the oldest is a boy of 22 years and her youngest child is 5 years old. 

Daba started her business 4 years ago, a shoe business. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to buy 40 to 50 pairs, half of which is an order. For the other half, she will be traveling to sell it. For this, she goes around from 10am until 1pm and in the afternoon from 3pm until 6pm. With these takings, she participates in the daily household spending and the needs of her children. 

Daba used to work in a hotel. She would like very much to begin again in order to improve the conditions of her life and her family and to increase her business assets.

loans.use: to buy shoes to resell

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en: Nuhu is a Babban Gona farmer from Sarki Kuya Village. He joined Babban Gona so that he could realize better yields on his farm. Since joining Babban Gona, Nuhu no longer has to worry about having inadequate income to increase his farmland.Through Babban Gona’s input loan he will have access to top of the range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, increasing his income considerably.This season, Nuhu has ambitious plans to harvest 50 bags of maize. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Nuhu now has the opportunity to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en:
Armine is from Tsaghkalanj village. She lives with her husband and 18-years-old son, Aram.
Armine is occupied in land cultivation work; she cultivates wheat, potato, cabbage, and greens. Her husband and son help Armine with farming work and sell the gathered harvest in local markets. 
To be able to enrich the farm and earn income for the family's living, Armine has applied for this loan.  As this is Armine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Armine get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Armine hopes for the lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for 10 piglets, a cow, forage for the livestock, and fertilizer for land cultivation.

loans.name: Moussa's Group

texts.fr: Moussa qui se trouve sur la photo arrêtant a gauche avec un t-shirt bleu, est membre d’un groupe de 5 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Bougoula au sud de Bamako au Mali. Moussa, âgé de 31 ans, est le père de 4 enfants âgés de 1 à 6 ans, dont aucun d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Moussa à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 24 ans. Moussa cultive le mais, le sorgho sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Moussa entame sa troisième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrit en raison de l'avis favorable de son entourage sur l'impact positif de myAgro. Cette année Moussa effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 24 ans que Moussa cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Moussa planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Moussa espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Moussa, who is found in the photo to the left with a blue t-shirt, is a member of a group of 5 farmers enrolled in myAgro, living and working in the village of Bougoula in the south of Bamako in Mali. Moussa, 31 years old, is the father of 4 children, ages 1 to 6 years, of which none among them are currently schooled. The anchoring of the family tradition in the practice of agriculture, the primary source of revenue and of household food self-sufficiency, encouraged Moussa to practice this activity for 24 years now. 

Moussa cultivates corn, the sorghum on his plot, but must face up to the difficulties as a farmer; such as the lack of rain, of agricultural materials, and of quality fertilizer. Moussa has begun his third year with myAgro, and he reenrolled on account of the favorable opinion of his family on the positive impact of myAgro. 

This year, Moussa carried out payments to buy a packet of myAgro OPV (openly pollinated variety) seeds and fertilizer to grow peanut plants in order to increase his yield on his plot of 0.0625 hectares. Moussa has now been cultivating corn for 24 years for his food-producing value and also for his productive profitability and in order to conduct business.

Finally, Moussa hopes also to be able to build a house for the family as well as to assure the food self-sufficiency of the family.

loans.use: to offer himself a packet of OPV (openly pollinated variety) seeds and fertilizer for growing peanut plants

loans.name: Intizora

texts.en: Intizora is a hard-working woman. She was born in the north-west part of Tajikistan in 1996. She is living in beautiful nature scenery where hospitable people live. She is single and lives with her parents. At her young age, she has a business. After graduating high school, she used to do business in order to help her family to live. They lived poorly and she started doing business selling grocery products at a small store in a domestic market. Now, she is experienced and knows her duties well. She appealed to IMON and asked for a loan to buy working capital; meaning grocery products. She hopes to be supported by KIVA lenders.

loans.use: to buy working capital; meaning grocery products

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Philip. He is 29 years old, married, and blessed with two children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.

He operates a food cafe, which he has been running for the last three years. He is grateful to have acquired Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on savings, enterprise development, and financial management from which he acquired the skills on how to manage his business prudently. 

He is borrowing from Kiva to enable him to purchase more foodstuffs such as flour, sugar, and rice for his food cafe in order to meet customers' rising demand and thus increase his income. This will help him meet his family’s basic needs and pay school fees for his children with ease.

Philip is happy for Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs such as flour, sugar, and rice that will boost business.

loans.name: Sitan's Group

texts.fr: Sitan qui se trouve sur la photo au centre, portant un t-shirt blanc et deux pochetes en main, est membre d’un groupe de 20 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Soulouba au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Sitan, âgée de 40 ans, est la mère de 10 enfants âgés de 4 à 23 ans, dont 8 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Sitan à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 20 ans. Sitan cultive l'arachide, le riz, le maraichage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles, d'engrais de qualité et de semences de qualité . Sitan entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement et des engrais de qualité. Cette année Sitan effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 20 ans que Sitan cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Sitan planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l’élevage. Enfin Sitan espère aussi pouvoir faire du commerce.
texts.en:
Sitan is found in the center of the photo, wearing a white t-shirt and with two envelopes in hand. She is a member of a group of 20 farmers enrolled in myAgro, living and working in the village of Soulouba in the southwest of Bamako in Mali. Sitan, 40 years old, is the mother of 10 children, ages 4 to 23 years, of which 8 among them are currently schooled. 

The anchoring of the family tradition in the practice of agriculture, the primary source of revenue and of household food self-sufficiency, has encouraged Sitan to practice this activity for 20 years now.  Sitan cultivates peanut plants, rice, and vegetables on her plot but must face up to the difficulties as a farmer such as the lack of agricultural materials, of quality seeds, and of quality fertilizer. 

Sitan has begun her first year with myAgro and she enrolled on account of the system of payment and the quality seeds. This year, Sitan carried out payments to buy a packet of myAgro OPV (openly pollinated variety) seeds and fertilizer to grow peanut plants in order to increase her yield on her plot of 0.0625 hectares. Sitan has now been cultivating peanut plants for 20 years for their food-producing value, explaining that peanuts are directly consumable by the family and are utilized as a base sauce in food. She also cultivates peanuts for their commercial value, because peanuts are a food that she sells at the market. 

Sitan plans with this increase in yield and income to raise livestock. Finally, Sitan hopes also to be able to conduct business.

loans.use: to acquire a packet of OPV (openly pollinated variety) seeds and fertilizer for growing peanut plants to increase the agriculture productivity of her plot

loans.name: Nhóm 42 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en:
Tuyet is a 36-year-old farmer who makes a monthly income of approximately US $20. She is married with three school-age children. Her husband has a severe chronic disease which makes him unable to work. 

Due to economic hardship, they have not been able to install a hygienic toilet at home. However, as a member of the local Women's Union since 1985, she recently joined a campaign to improve the community's sanitation and hygiene. With this loan, she will buy building materials in order to build a septic tank. This will help her family enjoy better health by avoiding many of the common infections and diseases associated with the unsafe latrines currently being used. 

In the photo, Tuyet is pictured first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap

loans.name: Begne's Group

texts.fr: Begne qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à gauche, portant un chapeau bleu, est membre d’un groupe de 11 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Falan au sud de Bamako au Mali. Begne, âgé de 63 ans, est le père de 7 enfants âgés de 4 à 27 ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Begne à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 54 ans. Begne cultive le mais, le sorgho sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque d'engrais de qualité et autre. Begne entame sa troisième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrit en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Begne effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture de maïs  afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.25 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 3 ans que Begne cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car le maïs est un aliment qu'il vend sur le marché. Begne planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Begne espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que financer le mariage de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Begne is found in the photo in the back row to the left, wearing a blue hat. He is a member of a group of 11 farmers enrolled in myAgro, living and working in the village of Falan in the south of Bamako in Mali. Begne, 63 years old, is the father of 7 children, ages 4 to 27 years, of which 3 among them are currently schooled. 

The anchoring of the family tradition in the practice of agriculture, the primary source of revenue and of household food self-sufficiency, has encouraged Sitan to practice this activity for 54 years now. Begne cultivates corn, the sorghum on his plot, but must face up to the difficulties as a farmer, such as the lack of quality seeds and others. 

Begne has begun his third year with myAgro, and reenrolled on account of the prospect of being able to increase his yields through the services offered by myAgro. This year, Begne carried out payments to buy a packet of myAgro seeds for growing corn, in order to increase his yield on his plot of 0.25 hectares. Begne has now been cultivating corn for three years for its food-producing valueandt also for its commercial value, because corn is a food that he sells at the market. 

Begne plans with the increase of his yield and his income to be able to conduct business. Finally, Begne hopes also to be able to cover the school fees of his children as well as to finance the marriage of his children.

loans.use: to acquire a packet of seeds for growing corn to increase the agricultural productivity of his plot

loans.name: Habila

texts.en:
Habila is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Dutse Village. Habila joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Habila will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. 

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Habila now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to build a better home for his family.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase this farmer’s yields

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina is 30 years old. With five children in school, Rina works very hard to provide for them.

Rina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries.

Rina has been in this business for 1 year now. 

In the future, Rina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home product care and other groceries, to save money for college education later for her children

loans.name: Lubna

texts.en:
Lubna is 38 years old and a married woman. She is the mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Lubna’s husband. He runs a shop selling spare parts to meet the family's expenses. He offers various spare parts for different vehicles. 

For the improvement of her husband’s business, Lubna availed a murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR. In this way, her husband was able to purchase more spare parts of good quality to increase his sales and profits alongside.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts of good quality to increase his sales and profits alongside

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Aida is 45 years old now.

Aida has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Aida requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy vegetables to sell in her business.

Aida has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Aida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her business so as to provide a secure future for her family

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Sajida is 35 years old, a married woman running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purpose. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has 1 child. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her child. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation.  Now, she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her child.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her child.

loans.name: Kadiatou's Group

texts.fr: Kadiatou qui se trouve sur la photo arrêtant a gauche avec un habit marron, est membre d’un groupe de 18 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Bougoula au sud de Bamako au Mali. Kadiatou, âgé de 50 ans, est la mére de 3 enfants âgés de 7 à 30 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés.  L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi son mariage avec un agriculteur, ont incité Kadiatou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 40 ans. Kadiatou cultive l'arachide, le maraîchage sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Kadiatou entame sa troisième année avec myAgro, et s'est réinscrit en raison des semences de qualité et des engrais de qualité, ainsi que de la conviction des agents myAgro sur les bénéfices apportés par la méthode myAgro. Cette année Kadiatou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 40 ans que Kadiatou cultive l'arachide pour sa rentabilité productive et marchande. Kadiatou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de pouvoir faire du commerce. Enfin Kadiatou espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi que construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Kadiatou, who is found in the photo at far left with a brown habit, is a member of a group of 18 farmers enrolled in myAgro, living and working in the village of Bougoula in the south of Bamako in Mali. Kadiatou, 50 years old, is the mother of 3 children, ages 7 to 30 years, of which two among them are currently schooled. 

The anchoring of the family tradition in the practice of agriculture, the primary source of revenue and of household food self-sufficiency, but also her marriage with a farmer, have encouraged Kadiatou to practice this activity for 40 years now. Kadiatou grows peanut plants and vegetables on her plot, but must face up to the difficulties as a farmer, such as the lack of rain, of agricultural materials, and of quality fertilizer. Kadiatou has begun her third year with myAgro and reenrolled on account of the quality seeds and fertilizer, as well as the conviction of the myAgro agents on the benefits brought by the myAgro method. 

This year, Kadiatou carried out payments to buy a packet of myAgro fertilizer for growing peanut plants in order to increase her yield on her plot of 0.125 hectares. Kadiatou has now been cultivating peanut plants for 40 years for their profitability and marketability. 

Kadiatou plans with the increase of her yield and of her income to be able to conduct business. Finally, Kadiatou hopes also to be able to cover the school fees of her children as well as to build a house for the family.

loans.use: to acquire a packet of fertilizer for growing peanut plants to increase the agricultural productivity of her plot

loans.name: Robin

texts.en:
Robin is a married man with 3 children. He describes himself to be trustworthy. He operates a retail business where he sells thatching materials. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of roof thatching materials. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of roof thatching materials and to provide more working capital

loans.name: Chadi

texts.en:
Chadi is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells soap, bread, sugar, salt and other items. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. 

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of soap, sugar, flour, salt and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of soap, sugar,flour, salt and other items and to increase her working capital

loans.name: Zacharia

texts.en:
Zacharia is a single man. He describes himself as motivated.

He operates a retail business where he sells livestock and has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

Zacharia identifies insufficient working capital as his biggest business challenge. He will use the KES 90,000 loan to buy more livestock.

His business goal is to become a great livestock supplier within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will be successful. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. Zacharia will use the anticipated profits to open a butchery.

loans.use: buy more livestock

loans.name: G.s Unidas En Cristo Group

texts.es:
EL G.S UNIDAS EN CRISTO ESTA CONFORMADA POR TRES INTEGRANTES DOS MUJERES Y UN HOMBRE, PADRES Y MADRES RESPONSABLES DE CINCO HIJOS BAJO SU RESPONSABILIDAD MENORES DE EDAD LOS CUALES ESTÁN ESTUDIANDO EN PRIMARIA RESPECTIVAMENTE , ELLOS SON ORIGINARIOS DE ACHUAPA SE CARACTERIZAN POR SER TRABAJADORES, RESPONSABLES, CON GANAS DE SUPERACIÓN PERSONAL. LUCHAN DÍA A DÍA PARA SACAR ADELANTE A SUS HIJOS, Y BRINDARLES MEJORES OPORTUNIDADES DE VIDA.
GRACIAS A SUS GANAS DE SALIR ADELANTE LA CORDINADORA ES SANTOS JUANA Y TIENE POR ACTIVIDAD ECONOMICA LA VENTA DE CUAJADAS EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN Y DE FORMA AMBULANTE, ELLA DEDICA UNAS DIEZ HORAS DIARIAS A SU ACTIVIDAD, LA RUTINA DE TRABAJO DE ESTA MUJER ES LEVANTARSE A  LA 4: DE LA MANAÑA PREPARARLAS LA CUAJA Y SALIR EN UN BUS PARA PODER DISTRIBUIR LA CUAJADA A CLIENTES FIJOS Y EVENTUALES, CON UNA PANA EN SU CASA CABEZA DE UNOS 20 KG, DOS VECES A LA SEMANA, TRES VECES A LA SEMANA VENDE SU PRODUCTOS EN LAS ZONAS CERCANA DE SU COMUNIDAD. EL OBJETIVO DEL CREDITO ES INVERTIR EN CAPITAL DE TRABAJO Y SURTIR SU NEGOCIO EN LA VENTA DE CUAJADA PARA QUE EN UN FUTURO NO MUY LEJANO PUEDA OBTENER MEJORES INGRESOS.  EL G.S UNIDAS EN CRISTO AGRADECE LA AYUDA QUE LOS INVERSIONISTAS KIVA LE BRINDAN A PERSONAS DE ESCASOS RECURSOS Y PAISES POBRE COMO ES NICARAGUA PARA TENER UN MEDIO DE TRABAJO DIGNO.
texts.en:
The Unidas en Cristo solidarity group is made up of three members, two women and a man, responsible parents of five children in their care who are minors and are primary school.
