They are from Achuapa and are characterized by being hard-working, responsible, with desire to improve themselves. They struggle day by day to get their children ahead and offer them better life opportunities. 

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, the coordinator is Santos Juana and she has the sale of curd from her house and as a street vendor as her economic activity. She spends ten hours each day at her work. This woman's work routine is to get up at 4 in the morning, prepare the curd and leave on a bus to be able to distribute the curds to established and occasional customers with a basin on her head of some 20 kilograms. Two or three times a week she sells her products in the areas near her community. The objective of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business selling curd so that in a not-too-distant future she can get more income. The Unidas en Cristo solidarity group is grateful for the help of the Kiva investors who offer people of limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua a way to have a respectable means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital in the purchase and sale of curd.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a single woman with one child one who attends school . She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense food.

For the past three years, she has operated a cosmetic shop business and her potential customers being town dwellers and neighbours, especially women. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her family's basic needs. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, lipsticks and body lotions to meet her family's basic needs

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer de 41 años de edad, ella es soltera tiene dos hijos adolescentes, se dedicó parte de su vida a ser promotora, vendiendo ropa, adquirió buena experiencia y algunos conocimientos de mercadeo y administración, pero quiere hacer algo con ellos, tiene que aprovecharlos y sacar a flote sus habilidades, por ello hoy necesita de tu apoyo, de tu bondad dado que quiere iniciar un negocio de venta de mercancía, su idea es mejorar las condiciones de vivienda, tener capital para pagar sus cuentas y en futuro cuando su negocio este dando creces y buena rentabilidad comprar una vivienda propia.
La idea de Claudia es comprar una vitrina, comprar estanterías publicidad y surtido de jean, pagar el arrendamiento de un local y comprar un aviso exterior, quiere iniciar con pie derecho y con fuerza esta oportunidad laboral que como principal beneficio será brindarle a una familia que tiene por cabeza de hogar a una mujer un negocio, una herramienta para que salgan adelante y adquieren por sus méritos artilugios y cumplan sueños.
texts.en: Claudia is a 41 year old woman.  She is single and has two adolescent children.  She has dedicated part of her life to sales, selling clothing.  She has gained good experience and some knowledge of marketing and management, but she wants to do something more with those skills.  She wants to put her abilities to work and for that she needs your help.  With your kindness she wants to begin a new business selling merchandise.  Her idea is to improve the living conditions of her home, to have capital to pay her bills, and in the future when her business is growing and offering good income to purchase her own home.  Claudia wants to buy a display case, shelves for publicity, and a variety of jeans, and also pay rent for a storefront and buy a sign for outside.  She wants to step forward with strength and embrace this opportunity that, as the main benefit, will offer her family, led by a business woman, a tool for getting ahead.  She will use her skills and merits in order to accomplish her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a display case, shelves for publicity, and a variety of jeans, and also pay rent for a storefront and buy a sign for outside.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 33 year-old-married woman and the mother of 4 children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

She has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina is 48 years old, divorced woman. She has 2 children. Nagina  is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns by hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. 

She has requested for a loan of 50000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet orders of her customers on time to earn good amount of profits. This monetary help can take Nagina  closer to her dream of providing quality education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, frames to meet orders from her customers and to be able to afford a better education for her children .

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir is 61 years old, married, and he has 3 children. Tahir lives with his family in Imisli region. He has been a farmer his whole life, focusing on crops and cattle. He inherited this profession from his parents, so he gained much experience just by being born into it.

Tahir has a small portion of land where he grows onions, carrots, and other vegetables. He sows and harvests twice a year and usually brings in a good harvest. 

Now he intends to grow other kinds of vegetables and offer them to the locals, but his situation is very difficult: he needs to grow fruits and care for them, but the lack of water in the region makes this a problem for him. Due to this problem, productivity has fallen, and he can’t cover the family’s needs.

He applied for a 1200 AZN loan in order to be able to supply water to his garden weekly. This will increase productivity again, and the family’s income will rise. This will be his first loan; please support him.

loans.use: to supply water to his garden weekly.

loans.name: Kalekye

texts.en:
Kalekye is a married woman, with 3 children. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to open more business outlets within 5 years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use and to be able to open further outlets later

loans.name: Angie Paola

texts.es:
Está sorprendente Joven es Angie una joven de 20 años de edad que tiene un negocio donde vente productos de uso personal, productos de aseo personal, vende frituras de papas en bolsa y refrescos.
Ella es una madre de una bebe de tan solo 1 año de edad, con mucho esfuerzo, ayuda de sus padres y familiares tiene ese negocio y aunque se tuvo que salir de estudiar, está orgullosa de trabajar y sabe que todos sus esfuerzos son por el bien de su pequeña que tanta felicidad y amor le ha dado a su hogar.
Angie es muy creativa y quiere superarse cada día más, si le toco vender mercancía y productos de la canasta familiar quiere destacar en dicha profesión, en el momento quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una nevera e insumos para realizar embutidos como lo son salchicha, salchichón, chorizos, morcilla, tiene las maquinaria en su hogar y sabe realizar la profesión  que seguramente será muy lucrativa por la ganancia que deja está al ser ella misma quien los fabrica.
texts.en:
This surprising young woman is Angie.  She is 20 years old and has a business where she sells products for personal use, products for personal care, and she sells fried potatoes in bags and soft drinks. 

She is a mother with a 1 year old baby, and with much effort as well as the help of her parents and extended family, she has this business. Although she had to stop studying, she is proud of working and she knows that her efforts are for the good of her young child who brings such happiness and love into her home. 

Angie is very creative and she wants to improve herself everyday.  If right now it falls to her to sell merchandise and household products, then she wants to stand out in this profession.  At the moment she is asking for a loan in order to purchase a cooler and food items in order to make various types of sausages such as "salchicha," "salchichón," "chorizos," and "morcilla".  She has the machines necessary in her home and she knows how to make each item.  This will certainly be a lucrative endeavor since Angie herself makes the sausages and can keep all of her earnings.

loans.use: to purchase a cooler and food items in order to make various types of sausages such as "salchicha," "salchichón," "chorizos," and "morcilla".

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en:
Bintihamisi is a single woman and has been blessed with two children, all of whom attend school. Together with her children they live at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. 

She has operated a fish selling business for over 12 years, selling from home to restaurant operators and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and perishibility leading to losses.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale and to be able to expand her business in the near future

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Fatuma operates a grocery vegetables selling stall, she sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale and to boost her business

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia, aged 24, is a married woman and the mother of 3 children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business.  Currently she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earns profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Shamshad

texts.en:
Shamshad is 43 year-old-married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts in years. She is a mother of 3 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 45000 PKR  to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently to get boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle the increasing demands of her customers efficiently

loans.name: Alshba

texts.en:
Alshba is 42 years-old-married woman. She is running a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas.  Alshba ’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family.

However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Alshba  has requested for 40000 PKR  to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers for providing better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers and to provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ella es María una mujer viuda de 56 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de productos de aseo personal y productos de belleza, realizo esta profesión como necesidad económica ya que su pareja generaba todo el capital.
Este trabajo es lo único que tiene para generar ingresos y gracias a este negocio ha podido superar más fácil la muerte de su pareja, ya que se relaciona y entabla muchas relaciones con personas.
María quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de de productos de belleza y aseo personal la razón es que ella ofrece tiempos de pago y no ha recaudado cartera y necesita capital para invertir en productos y así ofrecerles mas tiempo para pagar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria is a 56 year old widow who works selling products for personal care and beauty.  She works in the profession out of necessity since her late husband generated all of the family income. 

This work is the only option she has for meeting expenses and thanks to this business she has been able to survive the difficult loss of her husband. She has many relationships with many different people who help to sustain the business. 

Maria is asking for a loan in order to buy beauty products and personal care items. She offers payment plans to her customers and she needs capital in order to invest in products and thus offer her customers more time for repayment.

loans.use: to buy beauty products and personal care items for resale.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Abida, 45 years old, is a very enthusiastic person. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been successfully running a general store. He offers a variety of daily-use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, he needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. 

For this reason, Abida has requested a loan from Murabaha of 25,000 PKR for her husband, who will buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, he will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at his store and improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, for her husband's business and to improve earnings

loans.name: Rozeena

texts.en:
Rozeena is a married woman. Her husband, also shown in the photo, started taxi driving business some time ago. He earns good amount of income and needs some financial help to pay for repair and maintenance costs of the taxi. 

Therefore, Rozeena has availed Murabaha of 25,000 PKR loan for her husband. She is hopeful that her husband’s business will prosper and their living standards will improve.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance costs of her husband's taxi, to make him prosper and improve their living conditions.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 26 years old. She is married with and supports 7 family members. She has had a farming business for 1 year. 

She will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer and seeds and get more farm produce for sell. She hopes this will help her provide for the needs of her family. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her farming by growing more cash crops and be successful.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and seeds and have more farm produce to sell and this will help her support her family.

loans.name: Guhlam  Fatima

texts.en:
Guhlam  Fatima is 59 years old; she is a widow.  She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 40000  to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stocks of groundnuts for sale, to be able to educate her children to a higher level and meet the family needs.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.es: ANGELINA: Es una señora amable de 37 años de edad, de la comunidad de Saupuka, que se localiza a 8 kilómetros del municipio de Waspam, pertenece a la etnia mayagna. Está casada con 3 hijos en edad escolar. Trabaja como docente de escuela de educación primaria. Con el propósito de brindarle a sus hijos una vivienda segura y digna, solicita financiamiento para cambiar la madera de su vivienda de tambo. Con el préstamo va comprar: madera cepillada, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en: Angelina is a friendly woman, 37 years old, from the community of Saupuka, which is located 8 kilometers from the municipality of Waspam, and belongs to the Mayagna ethnic group. She is married with 3 school-aged children. She works as a primary school teacher. With the goal of offering her children a secure and respectable house, she asks for a loan to replace the wood on her stilt house. With the loan, she will purchase planed wood, nails, and pay labor costs. She dreams of having a pretty house with better security and a better environment for her children.

loans.use: to replace the wood on her stilt house.

loans.name: Carla

texts.es: CARLA: Es una joven sonriente de 32 años de edad, originaria de Waspam-Rio Coco. Casada con 5 hijos: El mayor de 17 años es independiente y 4 en edad escolar. Desde hace 15 años estableció su pequeña pulpería en un tramo en el mercado municipal, de esta manera contribuye con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos. Esta solicitando su segundo financiamiento para comprar mercadería en Puerto Cabezas y ofrecer sus productos a precios accesibles en Waspam: productos lácteos, embutidos, verduras, granos básicos, chiverías, entre otros productos. Con el primer crédito otorgado por PANA PANA y financiado por KIVA, le permitieron comprar ropa interior para niños y niñas, productos de belleza y cosméticos. Ella sueña con vender mortadela, pollo, carne molida y que sea un negocio prospero.
texts.en: Carla is a smiling young woman, 32 years old, originally from Waspam-Rio Coco. She is married with 5 children. The oldest, 17 years old, is independent and 4 are school-aged. Fifteen years ago, she established her small store in a stall in the municipal market. In this way, she contributes to the household expenses and her children's education. She is asking for her second loan to purchase merchandise in Puerto Cabezas and sell her products at accessible prices in Waspam: dairy products, cold cuts, vegetables, basic grains, snacks, and other products.  With the first loan granted by Pana Pana and financed by Kiva, it permitted her to purchase underwear for boys and girls, beauty products, and cosmetics. She dreams of selling mortadella, chicken, ground meat, and that it is a prosperous business.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise in Puerto Cabezas: dairy products, cold cuts, basic grains, snacks, and other products.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es: CESAR: Es una señor luchador de 38 años de edad, originario del municipio de Waspam-Rio Coco, casado con 4 hijos en edad escolar. Es sociólogo, trabaja como docente. Con el propósito de brindarle a su familia una vivienda digna y segura, está solicitando su segundo financiamiento para construir un anexo de madera, que será utilizado como cuarto para sus hijos. Con el préstamo va comprar madera cepillada, clavos, zinc y cubrir costos de mano de obra.  Con el primer crédito otorgado por PANA PANA y financiado por KIVA, le permitieron realizar las divisiones internas de su casa de tambo y madera. El sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en: Cesar is a determined man, 38 years old, originally from the municipality of Waspam-Rio Coco, married with 4 school-aged children. He is a sociologist, and works as a teacher. With the goal of offering his family a respectable and safe house, he is asking for his second loan to build an addition in wood, which will be used as a bedroom for his children. With the loan, he will purchase planed wood, nails, zinc, and pay labor costs. With the first loan granted through Pana Pana, and financed by Kiva, he was able to make some internal divisions in his wooden stilt house. He dreams of having a pretty house, with better security conditions and a better environment for his children.

loans.use: to build an addition in wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve her farming through adoption of greenhouse planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bricks to supply to her customers and to help educate her children as well as expand her business for a better life

loans.name: Elmelda

texts.en:
Elmelda is a 39 years old and she supports 4 family members. She has been practicing farming for the last 9 years and the business earns her a monthly income of KES14,000. 

Elmelda has applied for her first loan of KES25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy more seeds for planting cattle feeds. She plans to use gained profit to repay the loan and expand the farming for more income.  

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more seeds for planting cattle feeds, so as to become financially stable and expand her farming for more income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts for repair and maintenance of his motorcycle so as to offer better transport services to clients and raise more income to meet family needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish building his wooden stilt house.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es: EULALIA: Es originaria de la comunidad de Ulwas, municipio de Waspam Rio Coco, pertenece a la etnia miskita. Casada con 7 hijos en edad escolar. Trabaja como docente de educación primaria. Con el propósito de brindarle a sus hijos una vivienda segura y digna, solicita financiamiento para cambiar la madera de su vivienda de tambo. Con el préstamo va comprar: madera cepillada, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en: Eulalia is originally from the community of Ulwas, in the municipality of Waspam Rio Coco, and belongs to the Miskita ethnic group. She is married with 7 school-aged children. She works as a primary school teacher. With the goal of offering her children a secure and respectable house, she asks for a loan to replace the wood on her stilt house. With the loan, she will purchase planed wood, nails, and pay labor costs. She dreams of having a pretty house with better security and a better environment for her children.

loans.use: to replace the wood on her stilt house.

loans.name: Nena

texts.es: NENA: Es una señora miskita amable de 32 años de edad, originaria del municipio de Waspam Rio Coco. Casada con 2 hijos: El mayor de 7 años estudia su segundo grado de primaria y una pequeña de 1 año de edad. Con el primer crédito otorgado por PANA PANA y financiado por KIVA, le permitieron establecer una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda. Con el propósito de brindarle a sus hijos una vivienda segura y digna, solicita su segundo financiamiento para cambiar la madera de su vivienda de tambo. Con el préstamo va comprar: madera cepillada, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Ella sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en: Nena is a friendly Miskita woman, 32 years old, originally from the municipality of Waspam Rio Coco. She is married with 2 children. The older one, 7, is in second grade in primary school and the little one is 1 year old. With the first loan granted by Pana Pana and financed by Kiva, it permitted her to establish a small general store in her house. With the goal of offering her children a secure and respectable house, she asks for her second loan to replace the wood on her stilt house. With the loan, she will purchase planed wood, nails, and pay labor costs. She dreams of having a pretty house, with better security and a better environment for her children.

loans.use: to replace the wood on her stilt house.

loans.name: Nighat

texts.en:
Nighat is a 35-year-old married woman; she is shown in the photo with her brother in law. A year ago she started a business selling cloth in her locality. She purchases cloth of different varieties at low prices from the city market and sells them in her own town. She has a strong customer base. 

Currently, Nighat has requested a Murabaha loan of 30,000 Pakistan rupees (PKR). She wants to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of cloth in different colors for her business to be able to boost her earnings

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman and has seven children all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, she has owned a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.
With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
47-year-old Sajida is a married woman with seven children. The man shown in the photo is her son. He has been running a food stall for a period of about three years. He earns sufficient income to cover the family’s expenditures. 

For the improvement of her son’s business, Sajida has availed herself of a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR to buy crockery and utensils along with stocks of oil, spices and food items etc. It will help him to increase his sales and profits as well.

loans.use: to buy crockery and utensils along with stocks of oil, spices and food items, so as to improve profits

loans.name: Hery Meline

texts.fr:
Meline a 34 ans, elle est mariée et mère de quatre enfants âgés de 13, 8 , 5, et 2 ans. Les deux premiers vont actuellement à l'école.
Meline était ouvrière dans une entreprise de zone franche mais elle était en chômage depuis 2011. A cause de la crise politique de 2009, beaucoup d’entreprise de zone franche ont dû fermé. Son mari aussi a subi le même sort qu'elle.
Depuis 2012, avec leurs efforts personnels, elle et son mari ont démarré une activité de vente de savons et puis après quelque temps, elle a emprunté chez CEFOR pour développer et étendre  l'activité. Actuellement, les marchandises sont constitués des produits de premières nécessites.
C'est une femme courageuse et qui travaille dure, elle possède en ce moment trois points de vente, une femme battante et dynamique, elle désire encore faire des extensions, ouvrir d'autres points de vente supplémentaires.
texts.en:
Meline is 34. She is married with four children aged 13, eight, five, and two. The two oldest go to school.
Meline was a worker in a business in the free zone, but she was unemployed since 20011. Due to the political crisis of 2009 many businesses in the free zone had to close down. Her husband suffered the same fate as she did.
Since 2012, thanks to their personal efforts, she and her husband started a business selling soap. Shortly afterwards she borrowed some money from Cefor to develop and expand the activity. At present, the merchandise they sell is made up of basic necessities.
She is a brave woman and she works hard. She now has three points of sale. She is dynamic and determined and she would like to expand her business further and open additional points of sale.

loans.use: to buy boxes of soap, soap powder, nappies, batteries, yellow pasta, and noodles.

loans.name: Pacificah

texts.en:
Pacificah is 32 years old. She is married with 4 children. She has had a farming business for 4 years. 

She will be using the loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds to grow more cash crops, such as maize, beans and vegetables and get more farm produce for sell.  She hopes this will help her educate the children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her farming and grow more cash crops.

loans.use: To purchase fertiliser and seeds and grow more cash crops for sell and make more income to help her educate the children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for farming and to be able to become a stable retail business

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ghazala is a married, hard working woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband.  He has been successfully running a general store. He offers a variety of daily-use products and has a good client base. In order to avoid shortages, he needs to have various goods in stock to efficiently meet customer demand. 

For this reason, Ghazala has requested a loan from Murabaha of 35,000 PKR for her husband, who will buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. In this way, he will be able to consistently meet the increasing demand at his store and improve his earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery items including oil, milk, sugar, juices, etc. so as to improve earnings

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
Monicah is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be loyal. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals, soda, flour, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations of products. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals, flour, sugar and other items. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: buy more stock of cereals, flour, sugar and other items and to be able to expand her stock levels

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that  neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses is school fees.

For over seven years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to begin to build her "minifalda" house (of concrete blocks, cement, and wood) little by little.

loans.name: Yahal Tangni Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Yahal Tangni, es un vocablo miskito que significa Flor de Chaparro, es una planta que la población utiliza para lavar traste y los pisos de madera de las casas de tambo. Es un grupo mixto integrado por 7 mujeres y 1 hombre (ADELAIDA, ASTRILIA, BENALICIA, BENANCIA, LIDIA, SARA, SENAYDA y CENICIO), pertenecen a la etnia miskita de Waspam Rio Coco. Se organizaron hace año y medio, con el propósito de acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria para incrementar el inventario de sus pequeños negocios y mejorar poco a poco la calidad de vida de sus familia.

Sara: Es la coordinadora, es una señora amable, tiene 54 años de edad. Esta casada, tiene 5 hijas: tres mayores de edad y dos adolescentes que estudian su primaria. Trabaja como cocinera en el hospital del municipio. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal, como albañil. Con el propósito de mejorar sus ingresos, solicita financiamiento para comprar productos básicos y poco a poco establecer una pequeña pulpería. Con el primer crédito otorgado por PANA PANA y financiado por KIVA, le permitió mejorar con gran esfuerzo su calidad de vida al vender de manera ambulante ropa usada. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa.
texts.en:
The Yahal Tangni communal bank group, which in the Miskito language means Flower of the Chaparro Tree, a plant that the population uses to wash dishes and the wooden floors of the stilt houses. It is a mixed group made up of 7 women and 1 man (Adelaida, Astrilia, Benalicia, Benancia, Lidia, Sara, Senayda, and Cenicio), who belong to the Miskita ethnicity in Waspam Rio Coco. They organized themselves a year and a half ago, with the goal of accessing loans with a solidarity guarantee to increase the inventory of their small businesses and little by little improve their families' quality of life.

Sara is the coordinator. She is a friendly woman, 54 years old. She is married and has 5 daughters: three adults and two adolescents who go to primary school. She works as a cook in the municipal hospital. Her husband works informally as a construction worker. With the goal of improving her income, she asks for a loan to purchase basic products and, little by little, establish a small general store. With the first loan granted by Pana Pana and financed through Kiva, it permitted her with great effort, to improve her quality of life by selling used clothing as a street vendor. She dreams of being a successful businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase basic products.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a married woman who describes herself as honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, salt, bread and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in an area with a good market and her primary customers are honest.

Sarah identifies insufficient working capital as being her biggest business challenge. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, salt and other items. Her business goal is to be a big supplier within five years.

She hopes that in the future she will improve her standards of living. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, salt and other items

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man. He has 5 children with ages ranging from 4 years to 26 years. He operates a farm where he grows maize and other crops. His business is located in a rural area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be fluctuation of prices. 

He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy water pipes for irrigating his farm. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy water pipes for irrigating his farm, to be even more successful in the future

loans.name: Athanasie

texts.en:
Athanasie is 42 years old. She is married with 4 children aged between 8 and 16 years old. They all go to school. She has farmed for 28 years. With the Kiva loan, she would like to buy fertilizers to grow maize and to sell the maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption and pay school fees for her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow maize and to sell the maize.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 53 years old and married with 5 children. She has been running a milk-selling business for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffalos for milking and she sells the milk in her area.

She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children; her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses.

She has taken out many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing her children with better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase her milk sales

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 45-year-old married woman involved in a cattle purchase and sales business with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo); they have been doing this for the past three years. After raising small animals for a year or two, her husband sells them in the local market.

Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is very motivated to provide her children with a beautiful life with good food, health and clothing.

For the growth of her business she has availed a Murabaha loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase more livestock like baby goats and calves etc. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock like baby goats and calves

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Nadia, age 26, is a married woman. Her husband (also shown in the photo) has been involved in a business of manufacturing shoes for years. He is an energetic person, and makes enough to provide the basic necessities for his three children. 

For the improvement of her husband’s business, Nadia has availed a Murabaha of 40,000 PKR for her husband to buy additional material to make shoes, including leather, artificial leather, plastic soles, etc. In this way he can handle the growing demand for his shoes in the market.

loans.use: to buy additional material to make shoes, including leather, artificial leather, to meet the growing demand.

loans.name: Evencio

texts.es:
Evencio es un adorable y admirable hombre de 70 años de edad, ni la vejez, ni la discapacidad para caminar ha vencido a este abuelo lleno de fortaleza, de espíritu de ganas de progreso.
Evencio se dedica a la venta de acolchados y productos para el hogar como son colchones, closet, bifes, almohadas, tendidos, entre otros productos en un almacén que tiene ubicado en su casa.
Evencio es un hombre viudo solo tiene su negocio, no es pensionado, necesita de los ingresos para subsistir.
El objetivo de Evencio es juntar capital para poder vivir bien pro el resto de lo que le queda de vida, vivir cómodamente y tener la satisfacción de que nadie lo mantuvo solo sus facultades y habilidades para el comercio fueron suficientes.
Evencio solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de closets y televisores, quiere incursionar en la venta de electrodomésticos para mejorar sus ingresos.
Apoya a esta persona discapacitada de 70 años de edad a mejorar y ampliar su oferta de productos a los clientes
texts.en:
Evencio is an adorable and admirable 70 year old man. Neither old age, nor walking disability has defeated this grandfather who is full of strength and spirit of forward progress. Evencio makes a living selling cushions and household products such as mattresses, closets, buffets, pillows, quilts, and other products in a store located in his house. 

Evencio is a widowed man. All he has is his business. He does not have a pension, and he needs the income to survive. Evencio’s objective is to gather capital to be able to live well for the rest of what is left of his life. He wants to live comfortably and to have the satisfaction that no one had to take care of him – his own devices and commercial abilities were sufficient. 

Evencio is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of closets and televisions. He wants to venture into selling appliances to improve his income. Support this disabled, 70-year-old person to improve and expand his product offering for his customers.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of closets and televisions. He wants to venture into selling appliances to improve his income.

loans.name: Shania Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (EMELY, MARLENE y NINSKA IVANNIA), viven en  Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Hace año y medio se organizaron en grupo solidario con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana y tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Decidieron nombrar al grupo solidario Shania, porque es el nombre de la hija menor de NINSKA IVANNIA, integrante del grupo solidario.

Con los 2 financiamientos otorgados anteriormente por PANA PANA y financiados por KIVA, le permitieron a NINSKA incrementar el inventario de accesorios de acero y oro laminado y a MARLENE comprar productos básicos para su pequeña pulpería.

Emely: Es nueva integrante del grupo solidario, es una joven luchadora de 21 años de edad, pertenece a la etnia miskita. Madre soltera de una pequeña de 4 años de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su hija, desde hace 2 años estableció una pequeña tienda de ropa nueva en un tramo que tiene en uno de los mercados del municipio. Esta solicitando su primer financiamiento para comprar en Managua: ropa interior, camisetas, pantalón y ropa para niños. Ella sueña con terminar su carrera universitaria de Ingeniería Ambiental, actualmente estudia en la modalidad sabatina, cursa su segundo año.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of 3 enterprising women (Emely, Marlene, and Ninska Ivannia), who live in Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. A year and a half ago, they organized themselves as a solidarity group with the goal of working in solidarity to access loans from Pana Pana and have the opportunity of improving their small businesses, increasing their income and, so, improving their families' quality of life. They decided to name their solidarity group Shania because it is the name of solidarity group member Ninska Ivannia's youngest daughter.

With the two loans granted previously by Pana Pana and financed by Kiva, they permitted Ninska to increase her inventory of steel and gold laminate accessories and Marlene to purchase basic products for her small general store.

Emely is a new member of the solidarity group. She is a determined young woman, 21 years old, of the Miskita ethnic group. She is the single mother of a 4-year-old little girl. With the goal of getting her daughter ahead, 2 years ago she established a small new clothing store in a stall that she has in one of the municipal markets. She is asking for her first loan to purchase in Managua: lingerie, shirts, pants, and children's clothing. She dreams of finishing her university degree in environmental engineering, and currently she is taking classes on the weekends, in her second year.

loans.use: to purchase lingerie, shirts, pants, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Doña Elena de 39 años de edad es casada, su esposo se dedica a la venta de carbón por quintal, tienen una hija quien ya estudia diversificado, doña Elena tiene una tienda de consumo diario desde hace ya veinte años, vende jugos, gaseosas, golosinas, también pastas, granos, pollo, y muchos otros productos, doña Elena también cría pollos en su casa y luego los vende, está feliz por sus logros con sus ganancias a logrado mejorar su vivienda a ayudado a su esposo a costear los costos. Su meta es ahorrar ahora para costear los gastos de la carrera de su hija, solicita el credito para la compra de productos comestibles.
texts.en: Elena is 39 years old and married. Her husband makes a living by selling charcoal by the quintal (100 pound bags). They have a daughter who is studying in secondary school. For the past 20 years, Elena has had a store that sells daily consumption items. She sells juices, sodas, and candies, as well as pastas, grains, chicken, and many other products. Elena also raises chickens in her house and sells them. She is happy about her successes. With her earnings, she has been able to improve her home and she has helped her husband pay for her daughter’s education costs. She is requesting the loan to buy edible products.

loans.use: to buy food products to sell.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past four years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of debtors taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer, seeds and manure and get more farm produce to sell to help her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock for her retail supply for her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase stocks of cosmetics in her business for resale and thus to expand for a better life

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina is farmer. She is the mother of two sons and lives with her husband and mother-in-law. 

Alina and her family members run a farm. The best agricultural business for local people is land cultivation. Alina and her family cultivate haricot, cabbage and some greens and sell the harvest in the market. 

Alina has already started the prep work for the summer. To insure that she and her husband are able to undertake all the necessary tasks, she has applied to SEF for a loan to acquire a car to transport their agricultural products to the market.

This is Alina's second loan. Unfortunately, the first loan, which she got from a local financial institutions, was very difficult to pay back, and Alina faced some difficulties. However, thanks to her recent hard work, she and her husband have been able to run their agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that they will be able to cover monthly payments. So, Alina has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a car needed to transport her harvest to market.

loans.name: Carlos Albeiro

texts.es:
Carlos es un hombre de 41 años de edad, comparte un hogar muy alegre con su señora esposa y sus dos hijos de 8 y 13 años de edad, su familia lo es todo, por ellso trabaja, se quiere superar, sufre cuando en un día le va, porque sabe que en la noche hay unas personas que lo esperan con un abrazo un beso y una sonrisa en su rostro y es su deber como cabeza de familia mantener esa alegría y ese equilibrio en su hogar.
Carlos se dedica a la reparación de motocicletas que más que un trabajo es una pasión que desarrollo desde joven, ese amor por el transporte de dos ruedas que lo llevo a iniciar su propio negocio. 
El sueño de Carlos es poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, siguiendo siempre una mentalidad de seguir adelante y superar cualquier adversidad que se le presente.
Carlos quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de repuestos de motocicletas más usados y más requeridos como lo son (pastas de frenos, aceite, luces, retrovisores).
texts.en:
Carlos, 41 years old, shares a very happy home with his wife and two children aged 8 and 13 years.

His family means everything to him, and for them he works and wishes to improve himself. He is pained if there is a slow day at work, because he knows that in the evening  his loved ones are waiting for him with hugs, kisses, and smiles on their faces, and it is his responsibility as head of the family to maintain that happiness and balance. 

He earns a living repairing motorcycles. This is more than work for Carlos, it is a passion he developed from a young age, a love for bikes that prompted him to start his own business.

He dreams of being able to pay for his children's education and improve the quality of life for his family, always looking to get ahead and overcome any obstacle on the way.

Carlos is requesting the loan to buy the most frequently needed motorcycle parts and supplies for his repair work, including brake pads, oil, lights, and rearview mirrors.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle repair parts and supplies that are most frequently used and in demand, including brake pads, oil, lights, and rearview mirrors.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tsoro Village. Ibrahim joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Ibrahim will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Ibrahim now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farmer’s yields and his household income considerably

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 27-year-old married woman who has been running a school. Nasreen has always believed that quality education should be available to all children so that they are given the chance to succeed. With this in mind, Nasreen started her own school after completing her education. Today, there are 116 students in her school. She requires a loan of PKR 75,000 to repair the school building so that she can give her students a comfortable and safe learning environment.

loans.use: to repair the school building so that she can give her students a comfortable and safe learning environment.

loans.name: Djeneba's Group

texts.fr: Djeneba qui se trouve sur la photo détenant la fiche blanche de myAgro , est membre d’un groupe de 5  agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Zamblebougou au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Djeneba, âgée de 35 ans, est la mère de 3 enfants âgés de 11 à 20 ans, dont aucun d’entre eux n’est actuellement scolarisé. L'amour de l'agriculture a incité Djeneba à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 10 ans. Djeneba cultive l'arachide, le mil, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles . Djeneba entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Djeneba effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 10 ans que Djeneba cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Djeneba planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage.
texts.en: Djeneba, who is in the photo holding a white myAgro card, is a member of a group of five farmers who are members of myAgro and who live and work in Zamblebougou in the south east of Bamako in Mali. Djeneba, who is 35, has three children between the ages of 11 and 20, none of whom attends school at present. Her love of farming incited Djeneba to take up this profession that she has practised for 10 years. Djeneba grows peanuts, millet, and rice on her land, but as a farmer, she has to cope with difficulties such as sparse rain and lack of farming tools. Djeneba is starting her first year with myAgro, she registered with them in the hope of being able to increase her production through the services proposed by myAgro. This year, Djeneba will make payments for a packet of myAgro OPV seeds and fertiliser for the cultivation of peanuts in order to increase the production on her plot of 0.0625 hectares. Djeneba has now been growing peanuts for the food producing qualities of this crop, for ten years. She explains that her family can consume it directly, it is used as a sauce that is a basic in their diet, and also for its commercial value, for peanuts are a product that she can sell at the market. With the increase in her production and her income, Djeneba plans to start livestock farming.

loans.use: to obtain a packet of OPV seeds and fertiliser to grow peanuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Yalam Tagni Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario YALAM TAGNI, es de origen miskito, significa Flor de Cedro Real, que una variedad de árbol predominante en la Región Autónoma de la Costa Caribe Norte (RACCN). Está conformado por 3 mujeres (DELIA, LUISA y URSULA), todas son indígenas  miskitas, viven en Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Son mujeres emprendedoras que  venden mariscos y ropa usada, con cuyos ingresos aportan para las necesidades básicas de sus hogares. Se organizaron hace aproximadamente cuatro años, para acceder a préstamos con garantía solidaria en Pana Pana.

DELIA: Es integrante del grupo solidario, es una señora luchadora de 50 años de edad, madre soltera de 5 hijos en edad escolar. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a sus hijos y apoyarlos en sus estudios, desde hace 3 años vende mariscos de manera ambulante. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar más productos: caracoles, camarones, punches, pulpos, pescados, entre otros mariscos, así incrementar sus ingresos y poco a poco mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Ella sueña con establecer una tienda y ofrecer ropa nueva.
texts.en:
The Yalam Tagni solidarity group is of Miskito origin. The name means Flower of the Spanish Cedar tree, a variety of tree predominant in the Autonomous Region of the Northern Caribbean Coast (RACCN). It is made up of 3 women (Delia, Luisa, and Ursula), all are Miskita indians, who live in Bilwi, a municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They are enterprising women who sell shellfish and used clothing, whose income support the basic needs of their households. They organized themselves approximately four years ago to access loans with a solidarity guarantee through Pana Pana. 

Delia is a member of the solidarity group. She is a determined woman, 50 years old, the single mother of 5 school-aged children. With the goal of getting her children ahead and supporting them in their schooling, she has been selling shellfish as a street vendor for the past 3 years. She is asking for a loan to purchase more products: conch, shrimp, crab, octopus, fish, and other shellfish, so to increase her income and little by little to improve her family's quality of life. She dreams of establishing a store and selling new clothing.

loans.use: to purchase more products: conch, shrimp, crab, octopus, fish, and other shellfish.

loans.name: 2 De Abril Group

texts.es:
Martha es una mujer de 42 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 3 hijos de 13, 15 y 20 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional. 
Ella es buena madre, generosa, comprensiva, buena oyente, solidaria, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ situada al sur de la ciudad, habitada por los damnificados de un turbión del río Piraí, en el año 1983. De clima de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 18-24 grados centígrados.
Martha es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello rojizo largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada, la segunda de la derecha, viste blusa rosada). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como constructor y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia y trabaja y los menores estudian en la escuela. Viven en una casa alquilada que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Sus ganas de superación la hicieron formar una banca de personas con negocios como; reparación de vehículos, venta de medicina natural, tejido de mantas de alpaca, producción de queso, reparación de calefones, venta de quinua y venta de hoja de coca, para solicita un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), locotos rellenos (locotos, carne picada, cebollas), arroz con queso (arroz, leche y queso), ají de panza (panza, cebollas, tomate acompañado con arroz), y otros. Labor que realiza todos los días de la semana en su puesto de venta fijo para la hora de almuerzo y la hora de cena, “tuve muchas actividades laborales, actualmente me dedico a la comida, es una labor sacrificada todos los días…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes fijos  y diarios, la desventaja es la falta de capital para invertir en su negocio. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante de comida típica, Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de mesas y sillas para atender a más clientes y de forma adecuada. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Martha solicita un préstamo para la compra de mesas y sillas para vender comida a más clientes y consolidarse en la zona.
texts.en:
Martha is a 42 year old woman. She lives with her spouse. She has 3 children, aged 13, 15 and 20. Her business is selling traditional food. She is a good mother, generous, understanding, a good listener, responsible and very hardworking. She runs her business in the ‘Plan 3000’ area, located in the southern part of the city. It is inhabited by the victims of the flood of the Piraí river in 1983. It has a warm, sub-tropical climate with a temperature that varies between 18-24 degrees centigrade.

Martha has dark skin, brown eyes, long, reddish hair that she wears tied back, short stature and a medium build. Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish in the general culture and for her business. In the photo, she is seated second from the right, wearing a pink blouse. She shares her life with her spouse, who works as a builder, and with her children. The oldest one goes to school and works and the younger ones are in school. They live in a rented house that has potable water, electricity, and plumbing. Her eagerness to get ahead led to her starting a bank of people with businesses such as vehicle repair, selling natural medicine, weaving alpaca blankets, making cheese, heater repair, selling quinoa and selling coca leaves. They started the bank in order to ask for a loan and improve their activities. Her business is selling traditional food, such as peanut soup (soup with a peanut base), stuffed locotos (locotos, ground meat and onions), rice with cheese (rice, milk and cheese), ají de panza (belly, onions, and tomatoes with rice), and more. She does this every day of the week from her permanent food stall at lunch and dinner time. “I had a lot of work activities, and now I sell food. It is hard work every day..." she remarks. the advantage of her business is that is has regular, daily customers. The disadvantage is the lack of capital  to invest in her business. Her dream is to open a restaurant that serves traditional food. She wants to expand the business by buying tables and chairs to serve more customers in a suitable way. This is her first loan cycle with the institution during the 2 years that she has been doing this activity.

It is for these reasons that Martha is asking for a loan to buy tables and chairs to sell food to more customers and consolidate in the area.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs to sell food to more customers and become consolidated in the area.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers so as to add nutrients to crops and thus to be able to educate her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase tyres for repair and maintenance of his vehicle so as to meet client needs in transportation and also educate his children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To use for servicing his motorcycle for efficient services to his customers for more attraction and earn more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and improvised farm implements, using profits to educate her children

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a single woman with two children. She describes herself as honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells handbags and shoes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are honest.

She identifies insufficient working capital as being her biggest business challenge. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of handbags. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of handbags

loans.name: Sandy

texts.en:
Sandy is thankful that he was granted an 15000 PHP loan which he used to buy fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in his sewing business. Through his earnings he is able to support his family's daily needs. 

He would like to apply for a Php 19000 which he will use to buy more fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in his business. He makes T-shirts, house and basketball shorts, men's long pants. He also makes school uniforms of a school nearby their house. He earns a minimum of 700 a day. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him for it will surely help meet their everyday needs and for his children's schooling.

Sandy aims to grow and expand his business. He hopes build to build a house for his family and send all his children to College. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials like thread, fabrics  needed in his tailoring business and to educate his children

loans.name: Komesha

texts.en:
Komesha is a divorced woman with one child, who does not attend school because he is grown up. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her monthly expenses are those of the household.

She has operated a retail shop for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, paraffin and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, paraffin and wheat flour.

loans.name: Usman

texts.en: Usman is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Yanoko Village. Usman joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Usman will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilizers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Usman now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields.

loans.name: Lamara

texts.en: Lamara is a 58-year-old married woman, living in the small village of Chokhatauri district with her husband. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 2 cows and 2 calves. Lamara milks the the cows every day and produces dairy products to sell. In addition, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow maize and nut trees. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,300 GEL. With the received credit, she will purchase a mini tractor and the family will be able to cultivate the agricultural land and decrease the cost of cultivation. In addition, they will be able to rent it out to villagers and they will get more income.

loans.use: to purchase a mini tractor in order to cultivate agricultural land.

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en:
Lawal is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Gidan Dogaji Village. Lawal joined Babban Gona to improve the life of his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Lawal will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income significantly.   

Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Lawal now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to buy a maize grinding machine.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase yields to enable purchase of a maize grinding machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a Solar Solution for her business and to support her family.

loans.name: Kusyomomo Marikiti Group

texts.en:
Anna is the name of the lady raising her hand in the photo. She is 69 years old, a widow and a mother of 3 children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from its training especially in enterprise development.  

She operates a grocery store where she sells assorted fruits and vegetables. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more fruits and vegetables to add stock to her grocery store. This will greatly increase her income to enable her to meet her family's basic needs with ease. 

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to add stock to her grocery store for increased income.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una mujer de 58 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 10 años y otro hijos independientes, y su negocio es el comercio de cerveza. 
Ella es buena madre, activa, optimista, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona de ‘chasquipampa’ caracterizada por ser la antigua parada de los chaskis (en el tiempo del imperio inca), donde se encontraron tumbas incaicas, cerámica y piezas de oro de esa época. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 3-17 grados centígrados.
Julia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte junto a su esposo que trabaja como constructor y con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, sus otros hijos son independientes, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de cerveza por mayor, de la variedades; Huari (agua de manantial), Negra (con características nutritivas), light (sin alcohol), Maltin (sin alcohol para niños), etc., actividad que realiza en su tienda ubicada en su domicilio, “compramos cerveza de todo tipo por mayor, la guardamos en el depósito y la entregamos a nuestros clientes para sus fiestas y eventos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes continuos como; restaurantes, discotecas, salones de fiestas y otros, la desventaja es la falta de capital para reponer su mercadería. Su sueño es vender mayores volúmenes de cerveza, ella desea realizar la compra de diferentes variedades de cervezas por mayor para almacenarlas y distribuirlas a sus clientes continuos. Esta es la 7 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 4 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Julia solicita un préstamo para la compra de diferentes tipos de cerveza por mayor para distribuirla a sus clientes continuos.
texts.en:
Julia is a 58-year-old woman. She is married and has a 10-year-old child, as well as other independent children. Her business is beer sales.

She is a good mother, active, optimistic, stable, responsible, and very hardworking. She carries out her business in the Chasquipampa zone, which is known for being the ancient stop of the Chaskis (in the times of the Inca Empire). This is where Inca tombs, ceramics, and pieces of gold from that era were found. It has a cold, dry climate with a temperature that varies throughout the day between 3-17 °C (37-63°F).

Julie has dark skin; brown eyes; a medium stature; and long, black hair that she wears braided. She is short and has a medium physique. She dresses in a traditional fashion (hat, shawl, and skirt). Her native language is Aymará and she speaks Spanish because of the general culture and the business she carries out. She shares her life with her husband, who works as a construction worker, and with her son, who is studying. Her other children are independent. They live in their own house, which is made of brick and cement, has a corrugated iron roof, and has potable water, electricity, and plumbing. 

Her business is wholesale beer sales. She sells the following varieties: Huari (made with natural spring water), Negra (with nutritional characteristics), light (non-alcoholic), Maltin (non-alcoholic for children), etc. She carries out this business in her store, which is located in her home. “We buy all types of beer on wholesale. We keep it in the store and we give it to our customers for their parties and events…” she comments. The advantage of her business is that she has regular customers such as restaurants, clubs, party halls, and others. The downside is the lack of capital to replace her merchandise. 

Her dream is to sell greater volumes of beer. She wants to buy different varieties of beers on wholesale to market them and distribute them to her regular customers. This is her seventh sequence of loans with the institution in the four years that she has been in this business. 

It is for these reasons that Julia is requesting a loan to buy different types of beer on wholesale, to distribute them to her regular customers.

loans.use: to buy different types of beer on wholesale, to distribute them to her regular customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and farm implements so as to improve her farming activity and educate her children to a higher level.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and farm tools so as to get a better harvest and meet client and family needs and to start her own shop

loans.name: Debi's Group

texts.fr: Debi qui se trouve sur la photo détenant le papier de myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 18 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Zamblebougou au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Debi, âgée de 60 ans, est la mère de 5 enfants âgés de 30 à 40 ans, dont aucun d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L'amour de l'agriculture a incité Debi à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 4 ans. Debi cultive l'arachide, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Debi entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Debi effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 4 ans que Debi cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation et aussi pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Debi planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage. Enfin Debi espère aussi pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille ainsi que financer le mariage de ses enfants.
texts.en: Debi, who is in the photo holding a myAgro paper, is a member of a group of 18 farmers who are members of myAgro and who live and work in Zamblebougou in the south east of Bamako in Mali. Djeneba, who is 60, has five children between the ages of 30 and 40, none of whom attends school at present. Her love of farming incited Debi to work in this profession that she has been doing for four years now. Debi grows peanuts and rice on her land, but as a farmer, she has to manage difficulties such as drought and lack of farming tools. Debi is starting her first year with myAgro, she registered with them in the hope of being able to increase her production through the services that they propose. This year, Debi will make payments for a packet of myAgro OPV seeds and fertiliser for the cultivation of peanuts in order to increase the production on her plot of 0.0625 hectares. Debi has now been growing peanuts for the food producing qualities of this crop, for four years. She explains that her family can consume it directly, it is used in a sauce that is a basic in their diet, and also for its commercial value, for peanuts are a product that she can sell at the market. With the increase in her production and her income, Debi plans to start livestock farming. Finally, Debi hopes to enable her family to become self-sufficient for their alimentary needs and also to pay for her children to get married.

loans.use: to purchase a packet of OPV seeds and fertiliser to grow peanuts, in order to increase production on her land.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 42-year-old married woman running a cattle purchase and sale business with the help of her husband (also shown in the photo). She has been doing this for the past four years. After raising small animals for a year or two, her husband sells them in the local market. 

Shahida is a mother of four children. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. 

For the growth of her business, she has availed a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR to purchase more cattle. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
Amadu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from  Tsoro Village. Amadu joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Amadu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/ hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. 

This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Amadu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase yields and enable post secondary education for his children

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milka is a wife, mother, and farmer with 20 years’ experience in mixed farming. She lives in Kitale, Kenya with her four children on a small piece of land that she inherited from her parents. Milka completed primary school thanks to the financial support and effort of her parents. She has the spirit to succeed in life and sells milk, eggs, and a variety of crops to the local market and neighbors. 

She passionately loves poultry farming and as she likes to say “poultry is close to my heart”. Although this humble and ever smiling mother makes a profit selling poultry, she lacks the funds to buy good quality breeds of poultry and expand her farm. She requests a loan to buy more poultry. She has identified good breeds of poultry that will increase productivity and produce quality meat. 

Milka has enough feed to give the poultry energy and green grams (beans) to give the poultry protein. This will assure increased productivity. She chose to join Juhudi Kilimo so that she can have access to quality loans at an affordable interest rate. This loan will be a turning point in Milka’s life since she will improve her living standards and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: To buy more poultry.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David, 53, is a dairy farmer in Mwihati location, in the Central province of Kenya. He is a husband and a father of 4 school-going children. 10 years ago, David made use of his wife's one acre land by keeping a dairy cow. Today, the business has grown to having 3 dairy cows, 15 heads of poultry, 15 goats and sheep all together, and over 400 trees. The original one acre is used for horticulture. 

With all these animals on his farm, David's mind is set on constructing a shelter for them. Due to constrained funds, he is seeking a Kiva loan via Juhudi Kilimo to construct a shelter for his animals.
