Animal housing will bring untold benefits to David and his farm animals. David anticipates an increase in productivity from the animals resulting from improved animal welfare and living conditions. Any increase in family income will go towards his children's school fees.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Yau

texts.en:
Yau is a Babban Gona farmer from Gidan Dogaji Vilage. Yau joined Babban Gona to become a better farmer. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Yau will have access to top-of-the-range farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds. 

This loan will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize per hectare, double the 14 bags per hectare earned by the average Nigerian smallholder maize farmer. With the opportunity to earn high yields and increase his net income, Yau would like to use his extra earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona programme

loans.use: To purchase improved farm inputs that will increase his yields, enabling him to buy more land for further increased yields

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago, Violet started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Sitatunga, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of eight children sells milk, eggs and a variety of crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Taking care of her poultry is an activity that she finds very enjoyable, and feeding her poultry is her hobby. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in the Kitale area. Violet has good knowledge of the market and has been taking advantage of the ready market - the demand is very high. 

Being a visionary woman, she has always wanted to increase her poultry flock, so now she is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Accessing financial services for women is very difficult, but through institutions such as Kiva, enterprising women like Violet can achieve their dreams and goals. Violet believes that the key to increased egg production is proper feeding and good care. By ensuring that the poultry are fed well, she is guaranteed to reap the benefits. In addition to selling eggs and poultry, she will also sell poultry feathers that are commonly used to make earrings. The increased income will be used to improve her living conditions and to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Patujucilla Group

texts.es:
Florinda es una mujer de 55 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos, y su negocio es la venta de zapatos de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, amable, paciente, de buen trato, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona sur de la ciudad, caracterizado por encontrarse a orillas del majestuoso curso del agua, paseo tradicional del fin de semana, construcciones rústicas con materiales regionales en donde se puede degustar la tradicional comida típica y realizar algunas actividades deportivas. De clima cálido, sub tropical y húmedo a una temperatura aproximada entre 21-35 grados centígrados durante todo el día.
Florinda es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos usa lentes de aumento, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás, estatura alta, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la cuarta contando de la derecha, viste blusa lila a rayas horizontales y pantalón lila). Su vida la realiza junto a su esposo que se dedica al comercio y en compañía de sus hijos que estudian en la universidad. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Debido a su impulso de superación formó una banca de personas con negocios como; panadería, confección de sábanas, venta de cosméticos, servicio de manicura, venta de lácteos, venta de empanadas y venta de refrescos hervidos típicos, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ropa y zapatos de segunda mano de forma ambulante; cada día ella junto a su esposo se dirigen a diferentes mercados y ferias de la zona sur de su ciudad, cargados de sacos llenos de su mercadería. Levantan un par de sombrillas y arman un puesto de venta, los clientes transitan por el lugar y compran sus prendas continuamente, “los precios que ofertamos son muy por debajo de las tiendas de moda o la ropa nueva de marca…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que los precios de sus prendas son muy competitivos, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión y la competencia. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa y zapatos, ella desea aumentar su capital de trabajo y realizar la compra de zapatos de temporada por mayor para ofertar mayor variedad a sus clientes. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 12 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Florinda solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa y zapatos de segunda mano por mayor y con los beneficios ayudar a sus hijos a terminar la universidad.
texts.en:
Florinda is a 55 year old woman. She is married and has 2 children. Her business is selling second hand shoes. 

She is a good mother, enterprising, friendly, patient, kind, responsible and very hardworking. She runs her business in the southern part of the city. It is characterized by being on the banks of a majestic river and for the traditional outings on the weekends and rustic buildings made from regional materials where one can eat traditional food and play sports. It has a warm, sub-tropical climate and a temperature that varied between approximately 21-35 degrees centigrade during the day.

Florinda has olive skin and brown eyes. She uses glasses and has long, black hair that she wears tied back. She is tall and has a medium build. Her mother tongue is Guarani, which she speaks in her family, and she speaks Spanish in the general culture and for her business. In the picture, she is the fourth from the right, wearing a lilac blouse with horizontal stripes and lilac pants. She lives with her husband, who is a merchant, and with her two children, who are in college. They live in their own home, built from brick with a sheet metal roof. It has potable water, electricity and plumbing. Due to her drive to get ahead, she formed a bank of people with businesses such as a bread bakery, making sheets, selling cosmetics, manicures, selling dairy products, selling empanadas, and selling traditional boiled drinks. They formed the bank to ask ask for a loan and improve their activities. Her business is selling second hand clothes and shoes as a street vendor. Every day, she and her husband go to different markets and fairs in the southern part of the city, carrying sacks full of their merchandise. They put up a couple of umbrellas and set up their sales spots. The customers pass buy and buy their clothing constantly. “The prices we offer are much lower than for new brand name clothes...", she remarks. The advantage of her business is that the prices are competitive. The disadvantage is the lack of investment capital and the competition. Her dream is to open a clothing and shoes store. She wants to increase her working capital and buy some seasonal shoes wholesale to offer a wider variety to her customers. This is her third loan cycle with the institution in the 12 years that she has been doing this activity.

For these reasons, Florinda is asking for a loan to buy second hand clothing and shoes wholesale and with the profits help her children to finish college.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing and shoes wholesale so that with the profits she can pay for her children's college expenses.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una mujer de 57 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos independientes, y su negocio es la pesca.
Ella es independiente, constante, fuerte, paciente, solidaria, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en ‘Huatajata’ que es una de las regiones turísticas más importantes del país, ubicado a orillas del Lago sagrado Titicaca. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Juana es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte junto a sus hijos que trabajan en agricultura, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraida mediante bomba eléctrica. Su trabajo es la pesca de especies nativas y otras introducidas, como; el suche,  mauri, Karachi, pejerrey,  trucha y el ispi. Cada día al salir el sol; ella junto a uno de sus hijos se adentran al lago Titicaca y realizan la pesca, Su labor es bastante sacrificada porque el clima del lugar es frio y los rayos solares bastante fuertes. “la pesca que realizamos es por temporada, para después dedicarnos al cuidado de la tierra y del ganado…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende toda su pesca, la desventaja es el clima del lugar. Su sueño es construir una casa de ladrillo, ella desea realizar la compra de redes de pescar y la refacción de su bote. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Juana solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes de pescar y la refacción de su bote para trabajar en la época de pesca.
texts.en:
Juana is a 57-year-old woman, single, who has 2 independent children, and her business is fishing. 

She is independent, dependable, strong, patient, supportive, responsible, and very hard-working. Her business is located in "Huatajata" which is one of the most important tourist regions of the country, located on the bank of the sacred Lake Titicaca. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0-12 degrees centigrade. 

Juana has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair she keeps braided, is short, has a think physique, dressed traditionally (had, shawl and pollera [traditional Andean skirt]), her native language is Aymará which she speaks in this place and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the work she does. She shares her life with her children who work in agriculture. They live in their own house made of adobe with a roof of metal sheeting which has electricity and well water extracted with an electric pump. Her work is fishing native species and other introduced species such as suche catfish, mauri, carachi, pejerrey pupfish, trout and ispi pupfish.  Each day, when the sun comes out she, along with one of her children, goes onto Lake Titicaca and fishes. Their work is rather self-sacrificing because the climate in the area is cold and the sun's rays strong. "The fishing that we do is seasonal, so after that we work caring for the land and the livestock..." she says. The advantage of her business is that she sells all her fish, the disadvantage is the climate in the place. Her dream is to build a brick house. She wants to purchase fishing nets and repair her boat. This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the 15 years that she has done this work. 

For these reasons Juana asks for a loan to purchase fishing nets and repairs on her boat to work in the fishing season.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets and repairs on her boat to work in the fishing season.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a persistent and hardworking woman who takes advantage of her farming skills to generate an income. She is a hardworking mom and aggressive with the principle of truth on her lips. She is honest and faithful to what she does and what she says. 

Caroline has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. She is seeking a loan to buy land to expand her mixed farming. She is very hardworking and determined to increase her farm's output. 

Loans for smallholder farmers with little, irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. A few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo support farmers like Caroline. Through a group of 15 members called Tumaini progressive self-help group, Caroline has access to income-generating asset loans from Juhudi, which uses the group-based savings as collateral. 

According to Juhudi Kilimo, farming represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders, whether unskilled or semi-skilled. In the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household. Juhudi Kilimo facilitates loans that empower smallholder farmers like Caroline, because the institution believes that women, too, are actively involved in various segments of the farming industry.

loans.use: To buy land to expand her farming.

loans.name: Jerida

texts.en:
Thanks to Jerida's perseverance and courage, her household can now lead a dignified life. Jerida is a brilliant 40 year old farmer from Nyamira, Kenya, with a fierce entrepreneurial spirit. She practices diversified farming. Her main source of income is milk and poultry. 

Besides being a wife and a mother, she is also a long-time loyal client of Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization dedicated to elevating the quality of life for rural smallholder farmers. Jerida has a great credit history with the company. 

Jerida is seeking a KES 75,000 loan investment from Kiva lenders into her business. With your money, Jerida will buy a grain milling machine and set up shop where locals of Owalo village, where she lives, can have their cereal produce processed into flour. Flour is a key ingredient for most staple foods in Kenya such as Ugali (hard porridge) and chapati. Your investment will not only have a big financial and social impact on Jerida's family, but it will also make grain milling easier and more convenient than ever for occupants of Owalo village.

loans.use: To buy a grain mill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert, a newly married 24-year-old go-getter, comes from the remote Mweru village, located near Mt. Kenya, which is the highest mountain in Kenya. Up there, Gilbert practices dairy, poultry and crop farming. Not long ago, his major challenge was difficulty in transporting his produce to and from the market on time. This challenge was caused by poor a road network, impenetrable by motor vehicles, thus forcing farmers to rely on their backs, animal transportation and bicycles - all which were tiring and had limited load capacity. 

Gilbert bought an Indian motorcycle and it was the perfect solution to this problem. The motorcycles are cheap to buy and maintain, they are agile, easy to ride and very economical. This made his biggest challenge go away, but the same challenge is still a reality to his neighbors. 

Gilbert is seeking a loan of 90,000 KES to buy another motorcycle. With your loan, the newly acquired motorcycle will be made available for transportation services to other farmers in Mweru village. Gilbert will offer his services to farmers at an economical rate that will not hurt the farmers, and, at the same time, will be sustainable for his business. 

Income generated from this venture will be used to repay the loan to Kiva lenders, and, after servicing the loan, it will help Gilbert meet the basic needs of the family he is starting with Doreen, his wife.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle so that he can make available transportation services to other farmers to transport their goods.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
With three good-looking children to take care of, water to fetch, and food to cook, Susan has little time to make money to provide financial support for her family. Though her responsibilities are important to her family, it’s a job that is normally not given enough attention and gets little appreciation. 

With the little time Susan has, she sells vegetables from their small farm and also keeps dairy cows, sheep, goats and poultry. From Kiva lenders, Susan is seeking a loan worth 65,000 KES to grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government of Kenya takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector. 

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Susan access to a loan facility that will aid her to grow her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Susan’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability. Through this loan she will be able to sell more vegetables to both the local market and the neighboring market. 

Kindly help out this enterprising woman with a loan!

loans.use: To grow her horticulture business.

loans.name: Finess Ii Group

texts.fr:
Kadiatou est la femme tenant dans ses mains le drap et glaceur sur la photo.. 
Kadiatou est malienne âgée de 58 ans alphabétisé en langue national bambara, mariée mère de 05 enfants dont  03 scolarises et 02 non scolarises  dont l’aine a 18 ans.
Son marie est à l’exode, elle a une expérience de 03 ans dans la vente des draps , glaceurs , tissus brodés et autre. Elle est dévouée pour ce commerce.   Son   rêve est de vendre beaucoup pour gagner un grand profit qui la  permettra d’être libre  et subvenir aux besoins de la famille dans le domaine de la santé, l’éducation, alimentation. Elle  fait recours à L’IMF pour avoir plus de fond crédit  qui la  aide à acheter plus de : draps, glaceurs, et tissus brodé.
Elle s’approvisionne dans les milieux locaux et dans les pays voisins telque le Burkina Faso en marchandises et après elles les rêvent aux comptants a un prix abordable et bénéfique. Elle réalisant un bénéfice prévisionnel   80000f par mois, elle est souvent confronte à quelques obstacles telque : la mévente, la chute des prix sur le marche.
texts.en:
Kadiatou is the woman who is holding sheets and a cooler in the photo. She comes from Mali, is 58, and can read and write the national language, Bambara. She is married and the mother of five children, of whom three are enrolled in school and two are not. The oldest is 18. 

Kadiatou's husband is outside the country. She has three years' experience in selling sheets, coolers, embroidered cloth, and other items. She is enthusiastic about this trade. Her dream is to sell a lot so as to make a big profit which will permit her to be free to support her family in terms of healthcare, education and nutrition. Kadiatou has come to the microfinance institution to have more credit which will help her to buy more sheets, coolers, and embroidered cloth. 

Kadiatou buys her wares locally and in neighboring countries like Burkina Faso and then she sells the goods for cash at an affordable and advantageous price. She expects to make a monthly profit of 80,000 francs but she is often faced with difficulties such as sales slumps and falling prices on the market.

loans.use: to buy sheets, coolers, and cloth for resale

loans.name: El Sol Group

texts.es:
Daniela es una joven mujer de 24 años de edad, vive con su pareja tiene 2 hijos de 1 y 4 años, y su negocio es la venta de ropa interior femenina.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, optimista, amigable, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona Sur de la ciudad; caracterizada por recibir la migración interdepartamental y campo-ciudad, que forma parte de una intensa actividad económica conformada en su mayoría por el comercio minorista e informal, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Daniela es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado por detrás estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la segunda ontando de la derecha, viste solera verde, y pantalón corto naranja, sostiene su bebé en brazos). Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijos que aún no se encuentran  en edad escolar. Viven en un cuarto alquilado construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Debido a sus deseos de superación formó una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de comida tradicional, venta de flores, venta de artículos de librería, venta de lácteos, venta de artesanía, elaboración de sombreros de Sao y venta de helados, para solicita run préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ropa interior femenina, como; Panties, Brassier, Vestidos de Baño, fajas, y otros, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante visitando diariamente las diferentes ferias y zonas comerciales del lugar, “A pesar de tener en el mercado una gran variedad de lencería, existen clientes que buscan ciertas prendas con detalles que no existen o que aún no han salido a la venta en el mercado, después de todo cada persona tiene su gusto y estilo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con ventas constantes, la desventaja es la competencia. Su sueño es abrir una tienda para vender por mayor y contratar ayudantes, ella desea ampliar su oferta realizando la compra de prendas interiores femeninas por mayor, para mejorar su cartera de clientes. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Daniela solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa interior femenina por mayor para abrir una tienda y contratar ayudantes.
texts.en:
Daniela is 24 years old. She lives with her partner and has two children, who are 1 and 4. She sells women's underwear.

She is a good mother and is enterprising, optimistic, friendly, responsible, and hardworking. Her business takes place in the south part of the city, which is characterized by receiving interdepartmental and rural-urban migration. This contributes to intense economic activity consisting mainly of retail and informal trade. The climate is warm and sub tropical with a temperature varying during the day between 21-35 degrees Celsius.

Daniela is dark-complected with brown eyes and long brown hair she ties in a ponytail. She is of short stature and thin physique. Her mother tongue is Guaraní which she speaks with her family. She speaks Spanish with the general public and for business purposes. She is the second on the right in the photo, dressed in a green top and orange shorts and holding her baby in her arms. She lives with her partner, who works in construction, and with their children who are not yet of school age. They live in a rented room built of brick and cement with a tin roof; it has running water, electricity and sewerage.

Because of her desire to excel, she formed a communal bank of people with businesses such as: selling traditional food, selling flowers, selling stationery, selling milk, selling crafts, preparing Sao hats and selling ice cream. The bank facilitates loan requests to support their business activities.

Her business is selling lingerie, including: panties, bras, swimwear, belts and more, which she does on daily rounds through the various area bazaars and shopping centers. "Despite there being a variety of lingerie in the market, there are certain customers looking for garments with details that do not exist or have not yet gone on sale in the market. After all, everyone has their own taste and style ... ," says Daniela. The advantage of her business is that she can rely on steady business. The disadvantage is the competition. She wants to expand her inventory to include women's underwear to sell at wholesale in order to improve her customer base. This is the 2nd loan with the institution in the 2 years she has been engaged in this activity.

Daniela is requesting a loan to buy women's underwear at wholesale and to hire assistants.

loans.use: to buy women's underwear wholesale in order to open a store and to hire assistants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Meet Eunice, a 43-year-old jovial mother of four lovely children, whom she refers to as her “heartbeat.” 

Eunice hails from the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, a place that has produced some top elite athletes for the world. Nandi Hills has good weather patterns that favor crop and dairy farming. Eunice is a very hardworking woman who enjoys farming, which she has been doing on her small piece of land for the past 15 years. Through all those years, she has gained much experience and is one of the most respected farmers in her village. Because of the immense knowledge that she has of farming, Eunice offers extension services to other farmers who are new in the business. 

Being a caring and loving mother, Eunice has been able to take care of her family and support them with the profits she has earned from farming. Although Eunice reaps much profit from farming, one challenge that she is facing that is dragging her down and preventing her from reaching the top of the skies is lack of enough land for farming. For this reason, Eunice is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES to be able to buy a piece of land and expand her farming activities. 

Having so much experience in farming, Eunice is sure that she will make good use of the land and double her profits. With the profits, she would be able to repay the loan and improve her living conditions. Eunice is sure that if you invest in her, she will be able to realize her dream of having a good quality life and securing her children's future. Eunice has gone through the repayment schedule and amount and is comfortable with the plan. Support the project of an enterprising Kenyan woman!

loans.use: to buy land.

loans.name: Ever Ruben

texts.es:
Ever es un joven hombre de 20 años de edad, soltero, tiene un hijo de 1 año, y su negocio es la pesca. 
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, decidido, constante, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Isla Suriqui’ que es un pedazo de tierra ubicado en el lago menor del sagrado Titicaca, Es un lugar notable por la fabricación de las balsas de totora, que permitieron al hombre andino navegar en el lago desde épocas remotas. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Ever es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que es un bebé, viven en una casa propiedad de la familia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante una bomba eléctrica. Su negocio es la pesca, las variedades que se encuentran en el lugar son; carachi, mauri, ispi, trucha y otros. Su día laboral comienza por la madrugada cuando entra en su bote al lago a dejar las redes para después de varias horas recogerlas. Labor que realiza durante todos los días de la semana en temporada de pesca, finalizada la temporada se dedica a su actividad de ganadería, “la pesca es un arte que demanda mucha paciencia y sacrificio, y la carne pescada es muy demandada…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que al cabo de su jornada vende toda su pesca, la desventaja es la pesca por temporadas. Su sueño es ampliar sus actividades mejorando sus equipos y maquinaria, él desea realizar la compra de redes de pesca y refacción de bote para mayor seguridad. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que viene realizando esta actividad de manera independiente.
Es por esos motivos que Ever solicita un préstamo para la compra de redes de pescar para trabajar en la temporada de pesca y pagar los gastos médicos de su bebé.
texts.en:
Ever is a 20-year-old young man, single, has a 1-year-old son, and his business is fishing. 

He is a good father, enterprising, determined, dependable, responsible, and very hard-working. His business is located in the Isla Suriqui community which is a piece of land located in the small lake of the sacred Titicaca. It is a notable place for its production of totora reed rafts which have permitted the Andean man to navigate the lake since long-ago times. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day from 0-12 degrees centigrade.

Ever has dark skin, dark eyes, short black hair, is short, has a thin physique, his native language is Aymará which he speaks with his family and he speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the work he does. He shares his life with his son who is a baby; they live in the family house made of adobe with a roof of metal sheeting which has electricity and well water extracted with an electric pump. His business is fishing. The varieties that are found in the place are carachi, mauri, ipsi pupfish, trout and more. His work day begins in the early morning when he goes onto the lake in his boat to leave the nets so that after a few hours he can collect them. He does this work every day of the week during the fishing season, and when the season is done, he works with livestock. "Fishing is an art that requires a lot of patience and sacrifice, fish meat is in high demand..." he says. The advantage of his business is that at the end of his day he sells all his fish. The disadvantage is that fishing is seasonal. His dream is to expand his work, improving his tools and machinery. He wants to purchase fishing nets and make repairs to his boat for better safety.  This is his first loan sequence with the institution in the 2 years that he has been doing this work independently.

For these reasons, Ever asks for a loan to purchase fishing nets to work in the fishing season and to pay his baby's medical expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fishing nets to work in the fishing season and pay his baby's medical expenses.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
In 1994, Elizabeth started a business that changed her life: poultry and dairy farming. Poultry farming is something that is more of a passion for Elizabeth than a business. She is a hardworking and honest farmer who is based in Kaisagat, a remote village in the Kitale area of Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with an adorable family. 

To afford a decent and comfortable life for her six children, she has been selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and to make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Kitale area is highly populated, and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she says the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is very high. 

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 40,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. As a woman, accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, Elizabeth feels relief knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. 

With the loan, she will be able to sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry business to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. 

The extra income she gains will be used in fully repaying the loan, changing her living conditions and securing her family's future.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, 46, is a smallholder farmer residing in Kitale, an agricultural town in the North Rift region of Kenya. She is arguably among the most successful clients of Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that deals only with smallholder farmers in rural parts of Kenya. 

Vegetables, tomatoes, dairy animals and poultry are Lydia's major sources of income. Back in 2000, Lydia practiced traditional farming with little knowledge and no financing at all. She was not optimally using her farm. The returns were so meager that she could barely fend for survival. Today, Lydia is a fully-fledged entrepreneur. She has been provided with technical guidance, training programs and exposure visits. She has already fully serviced  a loan from Juhudi Kilimo. 

To capitalize more on returns from the booming horticulture business in the Kitale area, Lydia is seeking a loan of KES 120,000 to build a greenhouse. Unlike her competition, Lydia conducts proper soil preparation and uses modern farming techniques to ensure high quality produce. By doing this, she has created a name for herself and a demand for her produce. Your lending will contribute greatly to the actualization of Lydia’s goal, which is to own a greenhouse. In the future, she is also planning to intensify her farming, and start value addition. Kindly give her a helping hand!

loans.use: To construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Hyline

texts.en:
Hyline, a youthful 32-year-old, is a wise farmer whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Hyline is happily married and blessed with a lovely family. For the past 10 years she has been involved in mixed farming and her main source of income has been growing maize, vegetables, and tomatoes. She also keeps dairy cows. 

Hyline has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. Although she has made profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with the challenge of timely delivery of her produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. 

Hyline mobilized other woman in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that helps aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Hyline is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to market has been a nightmare, which is why she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price, and through this loan, Hyline is going to achieve her dream and goals. 

Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Hyline feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women so that they can gain respect and equality. The benefits of this loan are many because Hyline will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market and also, she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. She is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in the community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, she will improve her living conditions and assure her children and grandchildren to come of a secure future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to use to transport farm produce to the market

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a hard-working 26-year-old dairy farmer. She comes from Chepngaina village in South Rift Valley area of Kenya. Due to dairy farming requiring less involvement, Gladys comfortably keeps her day job. 

3 years ago, Gladys started farming from scratch on her family's one acre piece of land. Today, the land has 3 dairy cows, 20 heads of poultry and 20 trees. In a bid to increase returns, Gladys is making a move to grow the number of dairy animals on the farm. She is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. Having an additional cow will significantly increase the milk output and income as well. 

Income from this investment will help Gladys to meet her basic needs and expand her agri-business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
58-year-old Paul is a youthful farmer from the Molo area of Kenya. He was born and raised in the countryside where he learned about farming alongside his father. Thanks to this, nowadays he has dairy cows and a maize plantation, whose harvest is sold, and this is how he obtains the resources to bring food into his home. 

The borrower is a man who is thriving; he is a fighter and is devoted to his family and his work, which motivates him to work long days and try to get ahead. Every day he fights to overcome the obstacles that are in his way; he has been through difficult financial situations due to the low price of maize on the market, which affects the price of his product. 

Paul is kindly asking Kiva lenders for a loan to invest in the purchase of farming supplies (manure, fertilizers and pesticides) in order to keep his business going and prepare his crops so he can harvest a high-quality product. Paul dreams of improving his crops and expanding them to obtain a good monthly income. 

Help this hero who always strives to provide the best for his family and children.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of farming supplies (manure, fertilizers, pesticides).

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Almost the entire young generation of Kenyans struggle to make their way in the world because of unemployment, lack of opportunities and lack of capital. This is true for Eunice, who is based in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past 14 years. She has managed to earn a decent income. Her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, crops, and some personal business she engages in to make ends meet. 

She passionately loves dairy farming, and when asked what is most enjoyable about dairy farming, she stated, “feeding my cows.” 

Eunice sells milk to her neighbors and to the local market, but the demand has been overwhelming, and she cannot meet the demand. For this reason, she is seeking a loan to buy an extra dairy cow, which will assist in increasing milk productivity. The dairy cow that she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow; it’s a quality breed of dairy cow that will be producing between 10-20 liters of milk a day. This will immediately translate to higher profit margins and increased income levels. 

Profits from selling milk will be used in repaying the loan in full, and the extra income will be used to increase her business enterprise. Eunice is very visionary, and she intends in the near future to start adding value to her milk business through packaging the milk before selling, and also to start selling dairy products such as yogurt. 

An improved income level will assure her family of a secure future. By joining Juhudi Kilimo, which assists smallholder farmers, she will also benefit from free extension services and links to markets. Support Eunice so that she can continue with her dairy farming!

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a 44-year-old woman who is very hard-working, ambitious, and persevering in her dreams. She has the character to run her farming business, which is a small farm, where she has a principle and that is to be very proper with her customers. 

Zipporah is based in Kitale, which is a small rural town in the North Rift of Kenya. Zipporah has been a mixed-farmer for more than 20 years. In her farm, she keeps cows for milk and poultry for eggs. She also grows cash crops such as maize and vegetables. Besides farming, Zipporah is also engaged in small side-businesses. 

Zipporah is seeking a loan to grow her horticultural supply. She plans to use the money to pay for inputs and labour required to plant more crops. She is optimistic that this business move will make her successful in meeting the growing demand for greens in the local market. Income from the expansion will help her settle her business and personal financial obligations.

loans.use: To expand her horticulture business, paying for inputs and labour required to plant more crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro es un hombre de 58 años de edad, soltero, tiene un hijo de 15 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, independiente, optimista, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘plan 3000’ caracterizado por agrupar a pobladores quienes generan fuentes de ingreso autónomas y de mayor precariedad en relación a prácticas de seguridad laboral. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Pedro es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que. Su vida la disfruta en compañía de su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de madera con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; Sopa de Remojado (sopa de huesos), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno puede ser de papa y churiqui), sopa de maní (sopa a base de maní), locotos rellenos (locotos, carne picada, cebollas), arroz con queso (arroz, leche y queso), ají de panza (panza, cebollas, tomate acompañado con arroz), y otros. Actividad que realiza en su domicilio, bajo un par de sombrillas se acomodan las mesas y sillas que rellenan el espacio al aire libre de su puesto de comida, el clima es cálido y los clientes solicitan hielo y bebidas frías, las cuales no existen porque no hay refrigerador, “voy ampliando mi negocio según las necesidades de mis clientes, siempre necesité hielo y ahora quiero satisfacer esa necesidad…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes diarios y continuos, la desventaja es la falta de electrodomésticos línea blanca para satisfacer la demanda de hielo. Su sueño es tener un negocio que cybra las necesidades de sus clientes, él desea realizar la compra de un refrigerador para almacenar hielo y gaseosas. Esta es la 4 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 13 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Pedro solicita un préstamo para la compra de un refrigerador para almacenar hielo y gaseosas para aliviar la sed de sus clientes y con los beneficios ayudar a su hijo a terminar la escuela.
texts.en: Pedro is a 58 year old man, single, with a 15 year old son. He works selling traditional foods. He is a good father, entrepreneurial, independent, optimistic, responsible, and a hard worker. He has his business in the "plan 3000"  zone, characterized for gathering people who work independently under greater risk and lack of work safety. The area has a warm climate, sub tropical, with a temperature which varies between 21-35 degrees Celsius. Pedro is dark skinned, brown eyes, short black hair, short stature, thin physical built, his native tongue is Guarani which he speaks at home, and he speaks Spanish as general knowledge and for business. He spends his life with his son who studies in school.  They live in their own room made of wood,  with a corrugated metal roof, drinking water, electricity, and sewage. He sells traditional foods such as: Sopa de Remojado (Bone soup), Stuffed cogote (Creole chicken neck stuffed with potatoes or "churiqui" (meat),) peanut soup, stuffed "locoto" peppers (red locotos, ground beef, onions,) rice with cheese (rice, milk, cheese), aji de panza (belly meat, onion, tomatoes, served with rice,) and others. He sells this foods at home, under two umbrellas, placing tables and chairs which fill the space. The climate is warm, and his clients ask for ice and cold drinks, which he doesn't have because there is no refrigerator. "... I am expanding my business according to my clients' needs, I always needed ice and now I want to satisfy this need..." he states. The advantage of his business is that he has steady and daily clients, the disadvantage is the lack of electric appliances to fill the demand for ice. His dream is to have a business to fill his clients' needs. He wants to buy a refrigerator to store ice and soda pops. This is the 4th loan with the institution in 13 years working in this business. This is why he is requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator to store ice and soda pops to quench his clients thirst and help his son finish school with the profits.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator to store ice and soda pops to quench his clients thirst and help his son finish school with the profits.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.es:
Inocencia es una mujer de 61 años de edad, viuda, con hijos independientes, y su negocio es la venta de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio. 
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, amable, generosa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Calama’ donde se encuentra una edificación de película porque tiene la forma de Optimus Prime, personaje de la serie Transformes, en una versión de ladrillo y cemento. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Inocencia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, viste de forma tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la comparte junto a su hermano que trabaja y con uno de sus hijos que también trabaja, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad, como; pan, azúcar, arroz, fideo, agua, papel, gaseosas, galletas, golosinas, helados, llamadas telefónicas, etc., actividad que realiza en un cuarto en su domicilio durante todos los días de la semana durante horas del día, “inicié mi negocio porque vi la necesidad de los vecinos de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que todos los vecinos la conocen y compran a diario, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer el negocio. Su sueño es abrir un mini supermercado, ella desea abastecer su tienda con alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 18 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Inocencia solicita un préstamo para abastecer su tienda de barrio con alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad para abrir un mini supermercado.
texts.en:
Inocencia is a 61-year-old woman, a widow, with independent children, and her business is selling basic items and food in her neighborhood store. 

She is enterprising, independent, friendly, generous, responsible, and very hard-working. Her business is located in the Calama zone where a movie building is located because it has the form of Optimus Prime, a character in the Transformers series, in a version made of brick and cement. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0-12 degrees centigrade. 

Inocencia has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair she keeps braided, is short, has a robust physique, dressed traditionally (hat, shawl and pollera [traditional Andean skirt]), her native language is Aymará which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the work she does. She shares her life with her brother who works and with one of her children who also works. They live in their own house made of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting which has drinking water, electricity, and sewer service. Her business is selling basic items and food such as bread, sugar, rice, noodles, water, paper, soft drinks, cookies, candies, ice cream, telephone calls, etc., work that she does in a room in her house every day of the week during the daytime. "I began my business because I saw the neighbors' need for the basic products and food..." she says. The advantage of her business is that all the neighbors know her and purchase daily. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to stock the business. Her dream is to open a mini supermarket. She wants to stock her store with food and basic items to satisfy her customers' demand. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 18 years she has been doing this work. 

For these reasons, Inocencia asks for a loan to stock her neighborhood store with food and basic products to open a mini supermarket.

loans.use: to stock her neighborhood food with food and basic products to open a mini supermarket.

loans.name: Nyasia

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Nyasia, a hardworking, dedicated and honest 36-year-old dairy farmer. As the key breadwinner of her family and four children, she farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Nkubu, in the central region of Kenya. For the past 19 years, she has been practicing mixed farming and her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs and maize. She also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income she earns through farming. 

Nyasia passionately loves dairy farming but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of a proper dairy unit. She is kindly requesting for a loan to build a modern dairy shed. Through the loan, she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding it. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and it also protects them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Before Nyasia joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organisaiton that supports smallholder farmers with technical and financial solutions, she considered dairy farming not to be profitable. After training, Nyasia now believes that dairy farming is the business to go into if you want to improve your living standards. 

An increase in income will allow Nyasia to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. Her dream is to continue improving her dairy breeds and increase milk productivity to achieve better living standards. Nyasia fears that her dreams might not be realized if Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva lenders cease to provide its reliable market channel, credit facility and services that she requires to grow her dairy enterprise.

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Industrious, resourceful, curious, and talented are a few of the qualities of Mary, a 47-year-old woman. Mary started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Nyaki, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Today, she sells milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of her immense knowledge of farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow. Although she earns profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit. She requests a loan, which she will use to build a modern dairy unit. With the loan, she will have an easier time milking and feeding her cow. A good dairy unit provides a place where cows can relax. It can also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions. 

Mary believes that with this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit.

loans.name: Philister

texts.en:
Humble and hardworking – that’s Philister. She is a real fighter of a woman who has dedicated a large part of her life to caring for her 11 children. Taking care of this big family is not a joke and she has to work extra hard. Her primary sources of income are milk, vegetables and farming. Philister hails from Kitale, Kenya, an area that enjoys favorable weather patterns that boost crop production in the area. 

Philister, being someone who is very ambitious and someone who always takes advantage of positive things, would like to capitalize on the good weather patterns experienced in the region and boost her farming. She is kindly requesting for a loan to buy seedlings and start horticulture farming. This loan will help her sell horticulture products to both the local and international market and this will improve her standards of living. Kitale area has a ready market for horticulture products but the big problem is the supply is low. Philister wants to capitalize on this. 

The improved cash flow means that profits will be higher, and she can comfortably take care of her family and take her children. Through your loan, Philister will be empowered economically and will be able to improve her standards of living and those of people living within the area. Philister is very comfortable with the repayment plan and the monthly installments. 

Help her out!

loans.use: To buy seedlings and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Kusyomomo Marikiti Group

texts.en:
The person with his hand raised is Lawrence. He is 60 years old, married and the father of four children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014 to benefit from its training, especially in enterprise development and financial management.

Lawrence practices mixed farming. He grows crops like tomatoes and also has a dairy cow. He is borrowing this Kiva loan to buy a greenhouse to grow fruits, hence diversify his crops. This will enable him to earn more income to pay for his family's basic needs.

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy a greenhouse for fruit farming, hence diversify his crops for increased income to pay for his family's basic needs.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a dairy and poultry farmer dying to get her hands on the horticultural market. She is a proud mother of 3 and has been doing crop farming too for subsistence purposes. She also grows vegetables, a bit of maize and grass for her cow. 

She is seeking a loan to grow vegetables on a bigger scale for commercial gains. The demand for horticultural products such as fruits and vegetables has grown steadily in Kenya in recent years. They have become one of the top traded agricultural products, but there is still plenty of room to expand. Lydia is very excited to start commercialization of her crops. 

With your $25 loan, this can be easily achieved. She will rely on other sources of income to pay the initial installments on the loan, but in no time the horticultural farm will start pumping in income. The profits will be plowed back into the business to fuel growth. Her increased income will raise the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To grow her horticulture business.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Lenders! The above picture presents to you Eric, a very hardworking father and ambitious go-getter who is 30 years of age and hails from the Chuka area of Kenya, a rural town near the famous Mouth Kenya. Together with his beautiful wife, they support each other as a team and have been doing mixed farming for the past 12 years. Through all those years, he has been able to take care of his family and pay school fees for his children.

Although this humble dad has been making profits, not everything has been good. He has been facing financial challenges and, because the Chuka area has a ready market for cereals, he is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals to be able to improve his income level. He believes that through your loan, he will be able to realize his goal of improving his living conditions and transforming his life.

Erick is very visionary and hopes that through accumulated profits he will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost his income and completely turn his life around. Lenders, kindly don't clip his wings; allow him to fly towards a better future and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Lenders, the above picture presents to you Susan, a very hardworking mum, very ambitious and a go-getter who is 33 years of age and hails from Nkubu area of Kenya, a rural town near the famous Mount Kenya (second highest in Africa). She is married and together with her husband they support each other as a team and have been doing mixed farming for the past 15 years. Through all those years she has been able to take care of her family. 

Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses" - she has been facing financial challenges and because Nkubu area has a ready market for cereals she is seeking kindly for a loan to buy cereals to be able to improve her income level. Susan’s upbringing was challenging and she has been facing many economic problems but this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo Susan has gone through training and is very honest and disciplined with finances and she hopes that through profits from her business she will fully pay back the loan. Susan is very visionary and hopes through accumulated profits she will be able to open a large cereal selling shop that will boast her income and completely turn her life around.

loans.use: to buy cereals for resale.

loans.name: Nyamai

texts.en:
Nyamai is married and the father of four children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from its training, especially in financial management. 

He operates a kiosk and is borrowing to buy stationery to expand his kiosk business. This investment will enable him meet customer demands as well as increase his income.

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy stationery to expand his kiosk business to meet customer demands and earn more income.

loans.name: Los Amigos X Siempre Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 39 años de edad, soltera, tiene 3 hijos de 14, 16 y 19 años, y su negocio es la sastrería.
Ella es buena madre, independiente, emprendedora, optimista, responsable y muy trabajadora, su negocio lo desarrolla en el municipio de ‘Cotoca’ que es conocido por su artesanía en cerámica y sus comidas tradicionales. También es donde se elabora la jalea y tiene un amplio menú en horneados típicos. De clima cálido sub tropical muy húmedo con una temperatura que varía entre 21-35 grados centígrados. 
Maria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (la segunda de la derecha, viste blusa roja y pantalón blanco). Su vida la disfruta junto a sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Debido a sus sueños de superación formó una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de zapatos de segunda mano, venta de huevos, venta de comida, confección de cortinas, librería, reparación de calefones, venta de refrescos y venta de ropa de segunda mano, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la sastrería, ella se especializa en el arreglo de todo tipo de prenda de vestir, como largo de pantalón, ancho de cintura, rasgaduras, etc., actividad que realiza en un cuarto en su domicilio durante las horas del día. Por las noches cuenta con una segunda actividad, trabaja como enfermera de turno en un hospital público, recibe a pacientes de emergencia, realiza curaciones, aplica inyecciones, etc., ambas actividades ocupan todo su tiempo durante la semana, “mi familia es grande y con 2 ocupaciones me alcanza para pagar los gastos del hogar…” comenta. La ventaja de sus actividades es que una cuenta con horario fijo y la otra es libre, la desventaja es la falta de capital para invertir en la actividad de sastrería. Su sueño es abrir una sala de costura para la confección de ropa de hospital, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina de coser industrial y cortes de tela para confeccionar ropa de cama de hospital. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que se dedica a ambas actividades.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial y cortes de tela para la confección de ropa de cama de hospital.
texts.en:
Maria is a 39-year-old woman, single, who has 3 children ages 14, 16, and 19, and her business is tailoring. 

She is a good mother, independent, enterprising, optimistic, responsible and very hard-working. Her business is located in the municipality of Cotoca which is known for its ceramic crafts and its traditional foods. It is also where they make jelly and it has a wide menu of traditional baked dishes. It has a warm sub-tropical climate, which is very humid with a temperature that varies between 21-35 degrees centigrade. 

Maria has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair that she keeps tied back in a ponytail, is short, has a robust physique, her native language is Guaraní which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business she does (she is the second from the right, wearing a red blouse and white pants). She enjoys her life alongside her children who are students. They live in a rented room built of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting which has electricity and well water extracted with an electric pump and doesn't have sewer service. Due to her dreams of improvement, she established a bank of people with businesses like selling second-hand shoes, selling eggs, selling food, making curtains, a book store, repairing water heaters, selling soft drinks and selling second-hand clothing, to ask for a loan and to improve their businesses. Her business is tailoring, she specializes in alterations of all sorts of clothing such as the length of pants, the width of the waist, fixing tears, etc., work that she does in a room in her house during the daytime. At night, she has a second job. She works as a shift nurse at a public hospital. She receives emergency patients, does treatments, gives shots, etc., both jobs occupy all her time during the week. "My family is large and with two jobs I manage to pay the household expenses..." she says. The advantage of her jobs is that one has a fixed schedule and the other is free. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to invest in the tailoring business. Her dream is to open a sewing room to make hospital clothing. She wants to expand her business through the purchase of an industrial sewing machine and cuts of fabric to make hospital gowns. This is her second loan cycle with the institution in the 15 years that she has been doing both jobs. 

For these reasons Maria asks for a loan to purchase an industrial sewing machine and cuts of fabric to make hospital gowns.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine and cuts of fabric to make hospital gowns.

loans.name: Las Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Pura es una mujer de 50 años de edad, casada, tiene 3 hijos independiente y mayores de edad, y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano. 
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘mutualista’ un área céntrica comercial, edificios de oficinas públicas y privadas conviven lado a lado. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Pura es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello crespo negro lo usa corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que desarrolla (la tercera de la izquierda, fila de atrás, viste blusa a rayas verticales). Su vida la disfruta con su esposo que trabaja como transportista, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. La necesidad de mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; servicio de peluquería, venta de productos naturales para la salud, venta de artículos de limpieza, venta de comida, servicio de té, venta de verduras, limpieza de ropa y venta de empanadas, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, como; pantalones, poleras, camisetas, camisas, blusas, chompas, chamarras, etc., actividad que genera una rotación constante de mercadería y que necesita abastecer continuamente con mayor variedad y cantidad de ropa para competir en el mercado, también desea abrir otra tienda en el mismo rubro en su barrio, “ya llevo buen tiempo en esta actividad y ya es hora de ampliar y mejorar mis ventas…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa es de un precio accesible y se vende constantemente, la desventaja es la falta de capital para poder invertir y hacer crecer su negocio. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de ropa en su barrio, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Pura solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para abrir un puesto de venta en su barrio.
texts.en:
Pura is a 50-year-old woman who is married, has three independent and older children, and her business is the sale of secondhand clothing.  She is a good mother, enterprising, patient, persevering, responsible, and very hardworking.  She carries out her business in the "Mutualista" area, a downtown area with public and private office buildings side by side.  It has a warm sub-tropical climate, with a daily temperature that varies between 21-35 degrees centigrade.

Pura has dark skin, brownish-gray eyes, and black frizzy hair that she wears short.  She is short, of medium physical stature, and her native language is the Guaraní that she speaks with her family, but she speaks Spanish with the general public and for the work she does.  (She is the third person on the left, in the back row, wearing a shirt with vertical stripes.)  She enjoys her life with her husband who works in transportation.  They live in their own room made of brick and cement.  It has potable water, electricity, and sewage.  

The need to improve her business drove her to lead a communal bank of people in order to ask for a loan and improve their jobs.  The other members have business like a hair salon, the sale of natural health products, the sale of cleaning products, the sale of food, tea service, the sale of vegetables, cleaning clothing, and the sale of empanadas.  Pura's business is the sale of secondhand clothing like pants, t-shirts, a variety of shirts, blouses, sweaters, jackets, etc…a job that generates a constant rotation of merchandise and that needs to be stocked up continuously with a large variety and quantity of clothing in order to compete in the market.  She also wishes to open another shop of the same type in her neighborhood.  

"I have spent a lot of time with this job and it is already time to increase and grow my sales…" she says.  An advantage of her business is that the clothing is a good price and she sells it constantly.  A disadvantage is her lack of capital to be able to invest and make her business grow.  Her dream is to open a clothing shop in her neighborhood.  She wants to invest in her business through the purchase of wholesale secondhand clothing. This is her first cycle of loans with the institution in the 10 years that she has carried out this activity.

It is for these reasons that Pura asks for a loan to buy wholesale secondhand clothing in order to open a sales stall in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy wholesale secondhand clothing in order to open a sales stall in her neighborhood.

loans.name: Alegrijes Group

texts.es:
Laura es una mujer de 40 años, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 19 y 22 años, y su negocio es la venta de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, optimista, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en el ‘plan 3000’ que es uno de los sectores más poblados de la ciudad, Allí radican pobladores nacidos en esta ciudad y residentes migrantes de otras ciudades. Ubicado en las afueras de la ciudad, es un área que carece de servicios básicos. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Laura es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada la segunda de la izquierda, viste blusa lila cuello v). Su vida la disfruta junto a su pareja que trabaja en construcción y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia y trabaja y el menor esta terminando la escuela. Viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo extraída mediante bomba y no cuenta con alcantarillado. Debido a sus deseos de superación formó una banca de personas con negocios como; comercio de derivados lácteos, venta de comida, venta de flores, venta de carne de pollo, venta de empanadas, venta de bisutería y venta de juguetes, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio. Pan, azúcar, leche, huevos, galletas, refrescos, fideo, arroz, etc., actividad que realiza en horas del día durante toda la semana, “desde que abrí mi negocio he conocido muchos vecinos que me hacen pedidos y son clientes constantes…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que la atención es continua durante toda la semana por eso los clientes compran a toda hora, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para mantener el negocio abastecido. Su sueño es abrir un mini supermercado, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de artículos y alimentos de primera necesidad para abastecer su tienda y abrir un mini supermercado. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Laura solicita un préstamo para abastecer su tienda de barrio y abrir un mini supermercado y con los beneficios pagar los gastos de graduación de la escuela de su hijo menor.
texts.en:
Laura, age 40, lives with her life partner.  She has two children, ages 19 and 22.  Her business is selling items and basic needs food in her neighborhood store.  She is an enterprising, optimistic, patient, responsible, and very hard-working, good mother.  She conducts her business in the Plan 3000.  It is one of the most heavily populated areas in the city.  People who were born in the city live there as well as migrant residents from other cities.  It is located on the outskirts of the city, and it is an area that lacks basic services.  The climate is hot, sub-tropical with a temperature that varies during the day between 21-35 degrees centigrade.

Laura has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long black hair that she ties back in a ponytail.  She is short and sturdy.  Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which she speaks with her family.  She speaks Spanish with the general public and in the business that she conducts.  (She is seated, second from the left.  She has on a lilac blouse with a V-neck.) 

She enjoys her life together with her life partner, who works in construction, and her children.  Her oldest child goes to school and works.  The youngest is finishing school.  They live in a rented room built of bricks and cement with a corrugated metal roof.  They have electricity and water that is pumped from a well.  They do not have indoor plumbing.

Due to her wish to improve, she set up a bank of people with businesses like selling dairy products, selling food, selling flowers, selling chicken, selling empanadas, selling costume jewelry, and selling toys.  The bank was established in order to request a loan and improve their businesses.  

Her business is selling food and basic needs items in her neighborhood store.  She sells things like bread, sugar, milk, eggs, cookies, soft drinks, noodles, and rice, etc.  She conducts this business activity during the day throughout the week.  “Since I opened my business I have met many neighbors that place orders with me and are loyal customers,” she says.  The advantage of her business is that her service is constant throughout the week.  Therefore, the customers buy at any time.  The disadvantage is the lack of investment capital to keep the business stocked.

Her dream is to open a mini supermarket.  She wishes to expand her business by purchasing items and basic needs foods in order to stock her store and open a mini supermarket.  This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the year that she has been engaged in this business activity.

It is for these reasons that Laura is requesting a loan to stock her neighborhood store and to open a mini supermarket.  With the profits she will pay the expenses for her youngest son’s school graduation.

loans.use: to stock her neighborhood store and to open a mini supermarket.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 52-year-old woman who puts her heart and soul into her mixed farm and her family. She hails from the Thika area of Kenya. To earn a living, she works as a poultry farmer. She has been a poultry farmer for twenty-five years now. Her primary source of income is eggs, maize and veggies. 

Lucy is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to pay for poultry. This new venture will enable her to diversify her product portfolio and to help her manage the risks resulting from only practicing crop farming. With poultry, she will be able to sell eggs and other poultry products in the market to boost her income. The income will help her pay the high costs of inputs that have given her sleepless nights in the past. 

She loves farming and she aspires to keep growing her business. She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo and its partners for being supportive to small farmers like her and for making financial loans to farmers affordable. She plans to keep leveraging her business to grow her farm and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional poultry.

loans.name: Maritimo Group

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 43 años de edad, vive con su pareja, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, optimista, paciente, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la comunidad ‘Tundy’ ubicada en un territorio que guarda en su seno pueblos antiguos que superan los 300 años, y tiene 34 comunidades donde conviven; cambas, guaraníes, chiquitanos,  collas y también menonitas, de clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Maria es de tez trigueña, ojos pardos, cabello castaño largo lo usa amarrado por detrás estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada al centro, viste blusa verde). Su vida la disfruta junto a su pareja que se dedica al transporte como chofer. Viven en un cuarto alquilado construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo no cuenta con alcantarillado. Debido a sus ganas de superación lidera una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de carteras, tejidos de sombreros de sao, agricultura, artesanía en madera, tejido de adornos de pared con hojas de palmera, comercio de cerdos, carpintería, venta de fruta, venta de leche, comercio de semillas y venta de ropa de segunda mano, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional, como; majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito), Cogote relleno (cuello de gallina criolla, relleno puede ser de papa y churiqui),  majao encapao (charque molido, plátanos hervidos y arroz), y otros, actividad que realiza durante la semana en su puesto de venta fijo, “levanto 2 sombrillas, armo unas banquetas para sentarse y sirvo la comida…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus clientes son continuos, la desventaja es la falta de muebles para atenderlos. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante, ella desea invertir en su negocio mediante la compra de sombrillas, mesas y sillas para atender a más clientes. Esta es 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de muebles para vender comida y abrir un restaurante.
texts.en: Maria is a 43 year old woman. She lives with her partner, doesn't have children, and works selling food. She is entrepreneurial, independent, optimistic, patient, constant, responsible, and very hard working. She works in the "Tundy" community located in an area which holds ancient communities for over 300 years.  34 communities reside in this area including  cambas, guarani, chuiquitanos, collas, and menonites. The area has a warm climate, sub tropical, with a temperature which fluctuates between 21-35 degrees Celsius. Maria is dark skinned, brown eyes, with long dark hair tied in a ponytail, short stature, medium built. Her native tongue is Guarani which she speaks at home and she speaks Spanish for general knowledge and for business. (She is seated in the middle, wears a green blouse.) She shares her life with her partner who works as a driver. They live in a rented room built of brick and cement, with a corrugated metal roof, electricity, and well water. They don't have sewage.
