Because of her desire to get ahead, she organized a group of people with businesses such as: purse sales, sao hat manufacturers, agriculture, wood handicraft, palm leave adornments for decoration, pig growers, carpentry, fruit sales, milk sales, seed sales, and used clothing sales, to be able to get loans and improve their businesses. She works selling traditional foods such as charque majadito (beef jerky, rice, fried egg, and fried banana,) stuffed cogote (Creole chicken neck, stuffed with potatoes and churiqui (meat),) majao encapao (beef jerky, boiled plantains, and rice) and others. She works during the week in her fixed food stand. "...I put up two umbrellas, put together some benches to sit down, and I serve food..." she states. The advantage of her business is that she has steady clients, the disadvantage is the lack of furniture to serve them. Her dream is to open a restaurant. She wants to invest in her business by buying umbrellas, tables and chairs to serve more clients. This is the first loan with the institution in one year of working in this activity. Thus, Maria is asking for a loan to buy furniture for food sales and to open a restaurant.

loans.use: To buy furniture for food sales and to open a restaurant.

loans.name: Alegres Group

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 39 años de edad, casada, tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 16 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, decidida, amable, atenta, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la ciudadela ‘plan 3000’ caracterizada por ser la zona de mayor crecimiento de la ciudad, con el apoyo de sus pobladores que en la mayoría son residentes del interior del país. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Rosa es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado por detrás estilo cola de caballo, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el Guaraní que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza (sentada la primera de la derecha, viste polera negra con flores rosadas). Su vida la disfruta junto a su esposo que se dedica a la construcción y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela. Viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo no cuenta con alcantarillado. Debido a sus ganas de superación formó una banca de personas con negocios como; cría de cerdos, venta de frutas, venta de desayunos, venta de empanadas, venta de blusas de mujer, venta de accesorios de teléfono y peluquería, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de comida tradicional como; majadito de charque (carne deshidratada, arroz, huevo frito y plátano frito), locro carretero cruceño (sopa de: carne deshidratada, carne cortada en pedacitos, yuca y huevo), Chicharrón de Taitetu (Chanchitos de monte “taitetú” frito), majao encapao (charque molido, plátanos hervidos y arroz), y otros. Actividad que realiza de lunes a sábado en las afueras de su domicilio, bajo unas sombrillas y unas bancas improvisadas, “inicié mi negocio con la fé de ayudar a mi familia, tengo necesidades constantes que poco a poco voy satisfaciendo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con clientes diarios y continuos, la desventaja es la falta de muebles e utensilios de cocina para atender a más clientes. Su sueño es tener su propio local donde poder abrir un restaurante bajo techo, ella desea comprar juegos de sombrillas, mesas y sillas para vender comida a mayor número de clientes. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Rosa solicita un préstamo para la compra de muebles para vender comida a más clientes y pagar los gastos escolares de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 39-year-old woman, married, who has 2 children, ages 11 and 16, and her business is selling traditional food. 

She is a good mother, enterprising, dedicated, friendly, attentive, responsible, and very hard-working. Her business is located in the "Plan 3000" fortress characterized by being the zone with the largest growth in the city, with the support of its population which is largely residents of the interior of the country. It has a warm sub-tropical climate with a temperature which varies during the day between 21-35 degrees centigrade. 

Rosa has dark skin, dark eyes, long black hair she keeps tied back in a ponytail, is short, has a robust physique, her native language is Guaraní which she speaks with her family and she speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the business that she does (she is seated the first on the right, wearing a black t-shirt with pink flowers). She enjoys her life with her husband who works in construction and with her children who are students. They live in a rented room built of brick and cement with a roof of metal sheeting which has electricity and well water and doesn't have sewer service. Due to her desire to improve herself, she formed a bank of people with businesses such as raising pigs, selling fruit, selling breakfasts, selling empanadas, selling women's blouses, selling telephone accessories, and a beauty salon, to ask for a loan and improve their businesses. Her business is the sale of traditional foods such as majadito de charque (dried meat, rice, fried egg and fried plantain), locro carretero cruceño (a soup of dried meat, chopped meat, yucca and egg), chicharrón de taitetu (fried "taitetu" mountain pigs), majao encapao (ground beef jerky, boiled plantain, and rice), and more. She does this work Monday to Saturday outside her house, under some umbrellas and with some improvised benches. "I began my business with faith to help my family. I have constant needs that little by little I am meeting..." she says. The advantage of her business is that she has daily and regular customers, the disadvantage is the lack of furniture and silverware to serve more customers. Her dream is to have her own retail space where she can open an indoor restaurant. She wants to purchase sets of umbrellas, tables and chairs to sell food to a larger number of customers. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 5 years she has been doing this work. 

For these reasons Rosa asks for a loan to purchase furniture to sell food to more customers and to pay her children's school expenses.

loans.use: to purchase furniture to sell food to more customers and to pay her children's school expenses.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan practices poultry and dairy farming in Ndarawetta village in the South Rift Valley region of Kenya. She owns only one cow whose milk is sold and the money consumed by her family. Her family is composed of her and her three year old child. The acreage of the land she inherited from her father is one. 

This year, as Joan turns 26, she would like to shift her poultry farm from being subsistence to commercial. To achieve this feat, she needs to increase the number of hens on her farm from seven to at least over 40 in order to get a significant return on her investment. 

With your loan, Joan's livelihood will be much improved, and she will be able to make more income to take care of her child's basic needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion is an ambitious 21 year old dairy farmer from Cheplanget village in the South Rift Valley area of Kenya. His full of enthusiasm and youthful energy as he goes about his dairying business. To make income, he sells his milk produce at a local market called Sotik. The major challenge he faces is in the dismal quantity of milk he supplies to the market. 

To boost the quantity of milk production, Simion is seeking loan to buy another dairy cow. Having more cows almost automatically translates to producing more milk. Your loan will help Simion's dairy farm become bigger, more productive and, consequently, more profitable. 
Increase in fortunes arising from this investment will help Simion scale his business and uplift his family's livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a cow to increase milk production and also uplift his family's living conditions

loans.name: Kanymbubu

texts.ru: Канымбубу, 52 года, замужем, есть сын. Образование у нее высшее. Канымбубу занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть лошадь, корова, 20 овец. На 2,10 Га земли выращивает фасоль и картофель, продает молоко. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 27,000 сом (KGS). Канымбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Канымбубу является участником группы "Ак-Тилек 2013", всего в группе 3 человека. Свои доходы она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее улучшение ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Kanymbubu is 52 and married with one son. She has a higher education and works in farming. She has a horse, a cow and 20 sheep on her farm as well as 2.1 hectares of land where she grows beans and potatoes. She also sells milk. Her monthly income is 27,000 KGS.

Kanymbubu has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase livestock. She is a member of the Ak-Tilek 2013 group along with two other people. She plans to put her profits toward further improving her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva Lenders, meet Dorcas. Dorcas is a smallholder mixed farmer from Kiriogo, a remote village in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya. She has been blessed with a lovely family. 

Dorcas has been a farmer for eight years, producing  milk, eggs and maize for both consumption and sale. Dorcas' entrepreneurial spirit extends outside agriculture:  she is involved in other personal businesses for extra income. 

Dorcas is very ambitious. She enjoys making more and more returns but a lack of adequate capital puts her on a leash. It is for this reason that she is turning to Kiva lenders for a loan. Dorcas is seeking KES 30,000 to purchase a cow. With more cows, she will be able to utilize the pasture on her farm and increase milk production. 

Your loan will help Dorcas to pull herself out of poverty through constantly growing her asset base. The cow you finance will reproduce, and with time Dorcas will produce many litres of milk and other dairy products. This improvement in her business will enable her to realize profits that are currently cut due to the high cost of inputs. It will impact the rest of her family in a very meaningful way. 

Support a Kenyan farmer with a loan today!

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Terer

texts.en:
Terer is a smallholder farmer based in the Litein region of Kenya. He passion for dairy farming runs deep. His main income source is milk. 
Despite his attachment to dairy farming, Terer also recognizes the important role that crop cultivation plays in relation to food and feed production. 

Therefore, he is seeking a KES 40,000 loan to cultivate his land. He is planning to grow vegetables, cash crops and fodder for his animals. 
With this loan investment, Terer hopes to increase food supply, feed stock and income. This loan will directly and indirectly impact his family's livelihood in a very big way.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs to increase local food supply and also impact favorably on his family's livelihood in a very big way

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Besides being a progressive mixed farmer, Evans is a husband and a father of seven children. He lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya where he owns a 1.5 acre land. On his farm, he has two dairy cows, two head of poultry, 40 trees and a garden with coffee, tomato and banana plants. The only section that seems not to be doing very well is poultry. 

Evans is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to buy poultry. By buying a brood of hens, the poultry business will have a jump-start to grow into something big enough to start generating significant returns. 

Your loan will facilitate a transition of Evans' poultry farm from being subsistent to becoming commercial and profitable. Increased income from this investment will be used by Evans to meet his family's basic needs and elevate their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Many people have chicken farms in Kenya, but few start a business out of it. Lucy is a small landholder and mixed farmer based in Kibugwa village. She is the mother of one and has practiced mixed farming for eighteen years. To earn a decent living, she sells milk, poultry, and maize and engages in numerous small personal businesses. 

Recently, she started seeing how she could make money out of poultry farming. Raising hens to Lucy is something close to a hobby. She wants to sell eggs but figures it won't make economic sense unless she buys more poultry. However, her biggest challenge today is limited funds to expand. 

Lucy is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to buy hens. Future proceeds from the commercialization of her farm are already committed to pay for her child's education. In the long run, she is confident her efforts will translate into her family having a better quality of life.
Help her out!

loans.use: to buy poultry. This will help her children's education and translate into a better life for her family in the future

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To construct a strong cowshed for an enlarged herd, which will mean more milk production and a better living for her family in the future

loans.name: Zeddy

texts.en:
Hello world! This is Zeddy, a woman with grand aspirations who is humble and grateful. She lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, renowned for its rolling hills carpeted in manicured tea plantations. Zeddy is a loving mother and she has been in the agriculture business for more than a decade. Her primary income sources are eggs, and vegetables. Zeddy has been relying on agriculture to provide all her income. However, the rising costs of farming inputs (such as for fertilizers) and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly. Despite these tough conditions, Zeddy remains positive and passionate about her economic activity. 

Zeddy is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will enable her to expand the section of business least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheaper to run and the demand for chicken products is always high. With this loan, Zeddy will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and make more profits. 

An increase in income for her will be timely since it will enable her to tackle high farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of her work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will realize better quality produce and more yields. This loan will support Zeddy’s economic activity, and will improve her family’s living standards as well.

loans.use: To buy poultry, to tackle high farm-related costs next season and also improve her family's living standards

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a brilliant, hardworking 25-year-old Kenyan farmer whose home is on a small farmland in Nkubu. He gets a lot of help and support running the business with his wife . In a bid to expand his farm, Andrew is seeking a KES 20,000 loan to purchase farm inputs, farm implements and animal feed. 

Currently, he sells crops at Nkubu Town. To boost the quantity of produce he sells, he needs a loan investment from Kiva lenders to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer. He also needs to purchase tools and implements that will be used to work on the increased acreage. Andrew also grows fodder for his cattle. With the loan, he will buy a wider range of feed from that available in the locality. 

Andrew will use any money made from this investment to help his wife meet the family's basic needs. He will also save for future investments in the business.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs, farm implements and animal feed. The results will be re-invested in his farm for future success

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a smallholder farmer from a very remote village in the Kericho area of Kenya called Lemotit. She owns a small piece of land where she lives with her husband and children. Caroline has a dairy cow, poultry, and  trees on her farmland. With all these activities, she still has room left to plant crops. 

The main problem that she is facing is lack of enough capital to venture into horticultural farming. Caroline is counting on Kiva lenders to invest in her agri-business expansion in the form of a loan. She will spend the money to pay for farm inputs and implements. Income dairy will be used to make initial loan repayments until crops are mature for yielding. The harvest at the end of the season will provide her with food for her family and money for reinvesting into the business.

loans.use: to buy inputs for her venture into horticultural farming.  This will co-exist with her current farming to provide food for her family and money for re-investment in the farm

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Meet Gilbert, a very industrious, honest and hardworking man from the Kericho area of Kenya, near the famous Rift valley escarpment. Gilbert, 30, has been farming for the past 10 years. Through these years, he has gained much experience and is considered among the best farmers in his village. He  practices mixed farming. His primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops, and some small business ventures that help him make ends meet.

Gilbert is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating his farm. That is why, every day, he wakes up very early to go to his farm to plow. Although he makes profits from farming, he is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase his income by selling cereals. 

That is why he is seeking this loan to buy cereals. Kenya's Kericho area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereal. This means that Gilbert could increase his profits and satisfy the demand that is there. Accessing funds has been a challenge for Gilbert, but he now feels relieved because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring men farmers like him turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. 

Gilbert believes that this loan will be of much help, and that he will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. He also believes that the extra income he earns will enable a permanent change in his life and increase his business. Increased profits will allow Gilbert to repay this loan and secure the future of his school-going children.

loans.use: To plant cereals for the continued well being of his farm and his family, especially his school-going children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorbike, to be used to transport both people and his farm produce speedily to market. This will improve his family's lifestyle

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Regardless of the great impact that agriculture has on the Kenyan economy, Micro finance institutions (M.F.Is) view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers. 

Meet John, an ever-smiling, hardworking and honest father who is 44 years of age. He hails from the Molo area of Kenya. He is the proud father of a lovely family. He loves and treasures his family and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. John's primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures he has been able to earn a decent income. He is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 15 years, and throughout, he has never regretted going into farming. Although this humble dad has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses". 

He faces financial challenges, and because the Molo area has proven a ready market for cereals, he is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for re-sale and thus improve his income. John's upbringing was challenging, and he has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling dad has been making great improvements, and he believes that through your loan he will be able to realize his goal of improving his living conditions and transforming his life. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo, John has received training and he has proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. He intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from his business. John is quite visionary and - with his accumulated profits - hopes he will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost his income and turn his life around.

loans.use: To buy cereals for re-sale,to improve his family's living conditions and transform their lives

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a very enterprising man. He has a great desire to get ahead and advance. He is a small-scale farmer residing in a small village in Kiptere, which is found in the Kericho region of Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years to fend for his family. Samwel sells maize from his farm to buyers at a local market. He is also involved in other personal businesses. 

Samwel is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders through Juhudi Kilimo to venture into poultry farming. Poultry farming is economical and feasible since it doesn’t require much land space. Samwel is projecting returns that are sustainable over a long period of time. With the success of the first phase of his plan, he will secure a second loan to purchase more chickens to increase his sales volume. 

Samwel takes pride in belonging to his tribe. People from the Kericho region are well known to like chicken products, especially meat. Many homesteads keep poultry for subsistence. With the extra income from poultry farming, Samwel will comfortably meet the high farming expenses that cripple small-scale farmers across the country. His overall goal with the poultry project is to improve his family's food security.

loans.use: To purchase poultry to expand his farm into a new market for local sales, which will support his family with food and income for the future

loans.name: Joseah

texts.en:
Joseah is a man with great drive and entrepreneurship. A while ago, he set out determined to find work that would allow him to earn a good income and be independent. Therefore, five years ago he started practising mixed farming on his small  piece of land. For five years now, he has been practising dairy and poultry farming for a living with the help of family members. 

Joseah is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. This cow produces more than 15 litres of milk daily. Income from milk sales is enough to repay the loan and save some money comfortably. Joseah believes hard work and determination will bear him fruit. He projects that, eventually, dairy farming will outperform all his other activities. 

By virtue of his background, he has an upper hand in running the livestock business. “To become a successful dairy farmer, one does not need just to be a livestock expert. All one needs is passion, information, and keenness to learn from the successful farmers,” he says. Make Joseah’s dream come true.

He enjoys physical work and handling dairy animals. He is very realistic about the scale of his operation. His dream is to produce farm fresh milk and dairy products for friends and neighbours. His family will benefit from the modest profits he will generate.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow, to produce farm fresh milk and dairy products for friends and neighbours. His family will benefit from the modest profits he will generate.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and good quality seeds, increasing his crop production and to improve his income. This loan will permanently change the living standards of James

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard is a smallholder farmer based in Gitareni village in Chuka, Kenya. He owns a piece of land that he uses to grow a different variety of food crops. He also keeps goats. He has also planted 350 trees on it for aesthetic appearance and environmental health. Not only does the land provide him with capital for his business, but also a home for his family. He is blessed to have five children with a wife to whom he has stayed married for 20 years! 

Leonard is seeking a loan to purchase cereals. The cereals he is seeking serve to replenish stock for food and business. The demand for cereals in the Chuka market is up. Farmers in the area are rushing to grow more cereal crops. By placing himself in a position of supplying cereal seeds and still being a cereal farmer, he gets to enjoy profits from selling inputs and crop harvests. 

He is very pragmatic and considers himself more hardworking than others. Your loan will directly elevate Leonard’s livelihood. He strives to give his children a better life than the tough upbringing he had.

loans.use: To buy cereal seed for re-selling and also growing himself, to provide an income for his family

loans.name: Geofrey

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Geofrey. 

He is a hardworking smallholder farmer based in the Kericho area of Kenya. He has been farming on his land for more than five years. He keeps a dairy cow and chickens for eggs. The trees planted on his land show how Geofrey is environmentally responsible. This 30-year-old farmer is also a father. He also has a side hustle business of motorbikes. 

Geofrey is seeking a loan to purchase grains. For extra income, he buys and sells cereals. The only way he can expand this business is by getting his hands on more grains from the farmers. To do this, he has to leverage his business and pay the debt using the returns he will get from selling the cereals. 

Geofrey describes his childhood as difficult. It took hard work and street smarts to get where he is today. The environment he has been exposed to has made him very cautious when approaching new business opportunities. The fact that he is somewhat risk-averse makes him a favorable borrower with a sober approach on how he is going to spend and regain money. 

He stated that he will use the increased income to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy cereals to resell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Kiva lenders! Meet John, one of the most hardworking men on earth. He is 36 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. He is the proud father of two lovely children. He hails from Sipili, a remote village in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions, and to survive you must have tough skin.  John has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past four years. His biggest challenge in farming is irrigating his farm. John also has a side hustle "computer shop" business that he uses to supplement the meager income he earns from farming.

He is requesting a loan to purchase a water tank and water pipes that he will use to pump water from the river to his farm. Irrigation is used to assist in growing agricultural crops, maintaining landscapes, and re-vegetating disturbed soils in dry areas as well as during periods of inadequate rainfall. Through this loan, he will be able to double his crop production, and this will translate to more income. 

Through the extra income from farming, he will be able to support his family and keep up with his rising family expenses. John patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank and water pipes.

loans.name: Rawlings

texts.en:
Smallholder farmers in Kenya, like Rawlings (pictured), continue to languish in poverty due to the unwilling nature of formal financial institutions to set up shops in remote areas. They say the rural population is unevenly dispersed. The farmers make irregularly low incomes. Supported by Kiva, Juhudi Kilimo penetrates remote regions to finance agricultural assets and farm inputs to improve productivity and profitability of rural enterprises. 

In this case, Rawlings is seeking a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase potatoes and maize to grow and harvest on his horticultural farm. He will also use the money to buy fertilizers to ensure maximum productivity. Income from this venture will help Rawlings repay the loan, take care of his wife, and take his children to school. 

Rawling's family will be very grateful to Kiva lenders for their kind hearts, to spare their needs and help Rawlings raise money to move his family forward.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes, maize, and fertilizer for his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander has been a farmer for a long time and knows what it takes to succeed. He is a hard worker who always says, “I eat from my sweat.” He lives in Kilibwoni, a rural village in the rich lush hills of Nandihills. He is happily married and has been blessed with five angelic looking children. He has farmed for twenty years, and has never regretted it. His primary source of income has been milk, eggs, and crops. 

Most of the small-holder farmers in Kilibwoni village own approximately ¼ acre of land per household, and this has made them work extra hard to fully utilize their farms. He has been able to earn a decent and honest living by selling milk and eggs. These ventures have enabled him to send his children to school and feed his family. Alexander has planted many trees on his compound and also has Napier grass, which has high protein and is used to feed his dairy cow. This enhances his milk-selling profits. 

Because of increased demand, Alexander requests a loan to buy a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is a very profitable venture, and he wants to take full advantage of the ready market for dairy products. Through the loan, Alexander is sure of satisfying the demand for milk in his area. Through increased profits, Alexander is sure that he will repay the loan on time and also be in a position to comfortably take care of his family. 

Alexander, with his entrepreneurial spirit, strength and tenacity, would like to continue fighting so that he can achieve his dream of owning his own business and empowering society by being a source of employment. Juhudi Kilimo, through its training, has helped Alexander save more effectively. He plans to add value to his milk through packaging. He also hopes to one day start manufacturing milk products such as yoghurt and cream. Alexander will be able to continue farming and succeed with your help!

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow, for expanded milk production and in the future to produce cream and yoghurt for a new market, to help support the family

loans.name: Jhenely

texts.es: JHENELY: Es una joven miskita sonriente y emprendedora de 26 años, originaria del municipio de Waspam-Rio Coco. Casada con 3 hijos: 2 pequeños que estudian su primaria y una bebe de 2 años de edad. Con el propósito de contar con su propia fuente de ingresos y apoyar con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hijos, desde hace 9 años estableció una pequeña pulpería, en un tramo del mercado municipal. Esta solicitando financiamiento para comprar: papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, granos básicos, chiverías, sopas instantáneas, detergentes, entre otros productos. Ella sueña con tener un negocio prospero.
texts.en:
Jhenely is a Miskita youth who is cheerful and enterprising. She is 26 years old, and is a native of Waspam-Rio Coco.  She is married and has 3 children. Two of her children are in elementary school, and she also has a 2 year-old baby.  

With the goal of having her own source of income to support the household expenses and her children's education, Jhenely started up a small grocery store 9 years ago.  It is located in a section of the municipal market.  Jhenely is requesting a loan to buy toilet paper, sanitary napkins, staple grains, snacks, instant soups, detergents, and other products. She dreams of having a prosperous business.

loans.use: to buy products for her grocery store

loans.name: James

texts.es: JAMES: Es un joven emprendedor de 22 años de edad, pertenece a la etnia miskita del municipio de Waspam-Rio Coco. Debido a la falta de empleo formal y con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace un año estableció su pequeña pulpería, para apoyar a su mama con los gastos del hogar y estudios de sus hermanos. Esta solicitando su primer financiamiento para comprar: papel higiénico, toallas sanitarias, pasta dental, granos básicos, chiverías, sopas instantáneas, detergentes, entre otros productos. Sueña con vender embutidos, pollo y productos lácteos.
texts.en:
James is a 22 year old resourceful young man who belongs to the Miskita ethnic group. He is from the town of Waspam-Rio Coco. 

Due to a lack of formal employment, and with the motivation of wanting his own source of income, he set up a small grocery store a year ago to support his mother with the household costs and his siblings' educations. He is requesting his first loan to buy toilet roll, sanitary towels, toothpaste, bulk grains, snacks, instant soups, detergents, and other products. 

He dreams of selling sausages, chicken and dairy products.

loans.use: to buy toilet roll, sanitary towels, toothpaste, bulk grains, snacks, instant soups, detergents, and other products

loans.name: Justice

texts.en:
Justice is a farmer from Kaplong village, in the Litein area of Kenya. Justice is able to provide for his family by engaging in mixed farming. He owns a  piece of land where he keeps dairy animals and grows maize, among other crops. He is also involved in other personal businesses that earn him extra shillings. 

For the last five years that he has been in business, dairy farming has become deeply ingrained into his system. Justice is constantly looking for ways to grow a business he is so passionate about. Justice is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. He already has a name in mind that he is going to name the cow. 

Justice is going to make use of the additional money from the new acquisition to repay the loan and to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a quality breed dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm implements like seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es:
María, cuenta que ha tenido el negocio de tienda y venta de comida surtido con la ayuda de créditos, pero como los ingresos que este le genera son de subsistencia los ha utilizados para cubrir los gastos familiares y el pago de la deuda, además ha reparado su vivienda.
Por no contar con recursos necesarios para resurtir su negocio está solicitando un nuevo crédito para invertirlo en prendas de vestir, bebidas refrescantes, agua, calzado, etc., y así seguir trabajando para cumplir con sus obligaciones.
texts.en: María says that she has her business which is a store and the sales of a variety of food with the help of loans. But she has used the income that this has generated as subsistence to cover the family's expenses and to pay her debt, plus to repair her house. Not having the resources needed to restock her business she is requesting a new loan  to invest in clothing, drinks, water, footwear. etc. and continue working to meet her obligations.

loans.use: to invest in clothing, drinks, water, footwear. etc. and continue working to meet her obligations.

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es:
José, invirtió el crédito anterior únicamente en insumos agrícolas para que los cultivos de maíz y ayote tuvieran un buen desarrollo, el negocio está siendo más rentable y su familia se mantiene igual.
Hace una nueva solicitud de crédito a Padecomsmcredito y a los inversionistas kiva para comprar abono, herbicidas e insecticidas para llevar a cabo la siembra de maíz, espera tener buenos resultados.
texts.en:
Jose invested his previous loan solely in agricultural supplies, so that his corn and pumpkin crops could develop well. The business is becoming more viable and his family remains the same. 

He is making a new loan request to PADECOMSM and Kiva investors to purchase manure, herbicides, and insecticides to carry out corn planting. He hopes to have good results.

loans.use: to purchase manure, herbicides, and insecticides to carry out corn planting

loans.name: Nhóm 43 - Bình Xuyên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Van, 64, is working in the agricultural production and earns about US$ 22 monthly. She is married and has four grown children who also have their own families and live separately. Her household is in economic hardship situation because both she and her husband are old and sick for the whole year. 

They does not have a hygienic latrine yet. However, as a member of the local Women's Union since 1970, she recently joined a campaign to improve the community's sanitation and hygiene. With this loan, she will be able to build a septic tank toilet, which will improve her family's living conditions and contribute to sanitary improvement in her community. In the photo, she is pictured first from the left.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a hygienic toilet and a hand-washing device with soap

loans.name: Aron

texts.en:
Litein, located in the Rift valley region of Kenya, is a famous rain fed area. Despite the area having no drought, crop failure is a common occurrence. Poverty is a permanent companion of the farmers. Rocky soils, underfed cattle, poor farming techniques and a poor road network are the natural scenes of the area. 

However, Mr. Aron is determined to make a fortune in such a situation. Aron is seeking a loan to purchase a hybrid dairy cow. For the past 10 years, Aron has been keeping traditional breed dairy cattle on his farm like most of the farmers in the region. He has also been growing different varieties of food crops. But still, he was not making enough money to meet his needs. He was pushed to engage in other personal businesses to make a decent income. 

With your loan, Aron will acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce adequate litres of milk a day.  This will enable him to generate enough income to repay the loan and save some extra money. Investing in Aron will enable him to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Paul. He is a hardworking mixed farmer based in Litein, which is a small rural town in Kenya. He has a lovely family. 

He has been practising farming for 10 years. His primary income sources are milk, maize and vegetation produced on his farm. He also engages in personal businesses to make extra money. 

Paul is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. He enjoys taking care of animals very much. His hobby is milking early in the morning and late in the evening. He chops fodder in between during the day and fills water in troughs for the cows to drink. He regularly inspects his animals to ensure they are healthy and the milk quality is great. Paul finds farming enjoyable, lucrative and full of growth opportunities. 

His biggest challenge is the poor roads leading to the market. This makes it expensive and time-consuming to ferry farm produce. 

With your loan, Paul seeks to improve his family's standard of living. He fully understands the loan obligations and is committed to paying his debts in full.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: Joaquin es un hombre de 55 años de edad dedicado al oficio de la confección desde hace 20 años, cuando inició organizando su propio taller y hoy en dia ha ganado mucho reconocimiento en su mercado, conformado por sus propios vecinos, familiares y referenciados por estos. Sus líneas de trabajo la conforman, la ropa para damas, caballeros y todo producto de sastrería, además de ofrecer servicios de arreglos de ropa, actividad complementaria con la que le va muy bien. Su mayor meta es poder ampliar su local y lograr abordar a un número mayor de clientes., para finalmente poder tener una solvencia económica y contratar empleados. Aunque su mayor desafío sea cumplir con sus obligaciones financieras e incrementar sus ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas de paño, entre otros insumos, y una vitrina, pues tiene muchos pedidos con motivo del día de las madres, que está muy cerca y este hecho contribuirá con el impulso de sus ventas; con esta inversión incrementará su capacidad de compra y producirá más ajustándose a la temporada de gran movimiento comercial,    aumentarán así sus inventario de productos y sus ventas, haciendo así de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Joaquin is a 55 year old man who works as a dressmaker. He began 20 years ago, when he set up his own workshop, and has now earned much recognition in his market, made up of his neighbors, relatives and those that they have recommended. 

His products consist of of clothing for ladies and men and all types of tailoring. He also offers clothing repairs as an additional service which is going very well. His greatest goal is to be able to expand his premises and to have the means to take on a larger number of clients, so that he could finally reach economic solvency and take on staff. Although his greatest challenge is to keep up with his financial obligations and increase his sales. 

He is currently requesting a loan from Kiva, his first loan using the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will buy fabric and other supplies, as well as a display cabinet. He has many Mother's Day orders, which is very close and contributes to a boost in sales. With this loan he will increase his capacity to buy and produce more, adapting to the busy season, increasing his product inventory and sales, and making his Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other supplies, as well as a display cabinet

loans.name: Jessica Lizeth

texts.es: JESSICA LIZETH: Es una señora amable de 33 años de edad, originaria del municipio de Waspam, casada con 2 hijos que estudian su primaria. Trabaja como enfermera. Con el propósito de brindarle a su familia una vivienda digna y segura, está solicitando su primer financiamiento para construir un anexo de madera, que será utilizado como parte del corredor de su vivienda. Con el préstamo va comprar madera cepillada, clavos, zinc y cubrir costos de mano de obra.  Ella sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en: JESSICA LIZETH is a friendly 33 year old woman. She is originally from the municipality of Waspam and is married with two children who study in Primary school. She works as a nurse. With the goal of providing her family with a dignified and secure house she is requesting her first loan to build a wooden annex that will be used as part of the veranda of the house. With the loan she will buy planed wood, nails, zinc sheeting and pay for labor costs. She dreams of having a pretty house with the best security and environment for her children.

loans.use: to construct an annex of wood.

loans.name: Lorenzo

texts.es:
Lorenzo tiene 33 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú, donde los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería principalmente.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 12 años y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha, esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Lorenzo is 33 years old. He lives in his own house made of rustic materials with his spouse and two young children in the district of Pomahuaca. This community is located in the province of Jaén, Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru. The inhabitants work mainly in agriculture and raising livestock.

Lorenzo farms, specifically growing coffee. He has 12 years of experience in this field and has good personal and labor references in the district. The loan that he has been awarded will be used in agricultural labors, applying and incorporating phytosanitary products, fertilizer and pay for labor to harvest. This will help him to improve his crops physiologically, morphologically and in production and also help have a timely crop and in the end have greater production and a better quality product. So he will have no problem selling his product which will generate higher income which will improve his quality of living and that of his family.

loans.use: to be used in agricultural labors, applying and incorporating phytosanitary products, fertilizer and pay for labor to harvest.

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is a villager and father of five; he is married and is 51 years old. The loan he is requesting from you will be used to buy 300 chickens and food for them. 

Tom has been keeping livestock and poultry for years. Currently, he has got about 100 chickens and sells roughly 40-50 organic eggs a day for ten months of the year to some workers who happen to work with Tom’s two daughters, 23 and 20, in a fish factory. Thus, his clientele has already been established. Tom has also got a dairy cow and sells one calf per year. Owning an agricultural tractor, he has been called upon to offer services such as ploughing and harvesting to other villagers.

Tom chose to be photographed in the animal stable because he did not want to disturb the existing chickens with light coming from the photographic camera.

loans.use: to invest in 300 chickens and food for them.

loans.name: Natasha

texts.en:
Natasha is 53 years old and a mother of four, she is with her grandchildren who wanted to be in the photograph, yet they felt shy to show their faces. She is requesting this loan to take her brother, who has been living with her now since she got married, to brain specialists. Natasha is his caretaker but does not get paid for it, while her brother receives a disability income of $195/month.  

Natasha’s little income has always come from the activity of agriculture she has been pursuing. She owns some land and rents more from others and plants mainly wheat, onions, fodder and Lucerne for the animals. She only sells part of the wheat, the remaining she uses it for the family.

loans.use: to take her brother to see brain specialists.

loans.name: Kristi

texts.en:
Kristi is 28 years old and recently married; he lives in southeastern Albania with his wife and his elderly father because his mother passed away this past year. 

He wants to start planting and selling cyani flowers (cornflowers), which are very beautiful seen in the field, with intense blue colour and blue pigments. They are used as a decaffeinated herbal tea. Some years back planting, selling and exporting this particular plant was a project implemented by EuroPartners Development in the Korca region, where Kristi lives, and the Chamber of Grevena. 

Until recently, Kristi bought and sold fruits and vegetables and also worked in a nearby hotel as a waiter. 

The reason why he is requesting this loan is to prepare the land for planting the cyani flowers and to do other things this flower might require.

loans.use: to prepare the land for planting cyani flowers and do other things that this flower might require

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a wider range of goods for her tuckshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks, instant soup, and other products.

loans.name: Blanca Amparo

texts.es:
Blanca tiene 42 años de edad, es casada, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijas en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza como perfumes, cremas corporales, talcos, entre otros, realiza esta actividad desde hace más de 10 años, cuenta con bastante experiencia en el rubro por lo que cuenta con bastante clientela en su distrito y zonas cercanas. El préstamo lo utilizará en la compra de mostradores y vitrinas para exhibir sus productos de belleza, esto le generará ingresos mayores que van a permitir que su calidad de vida mejore.
texts.en:
Blanca is 42 years old. She is married and lives in her own home with her husband and her three daughters in the Pucará District, a community where life is quiet and the people work mainly in agriculture, trade, and animal husbandry. It is located in the Jaén Province, region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountain range of Peru.                    

Blanca makes a living selling beauty products such as perfumes, body cremes, powders, among others. She has carried out this occupation for more than 10 years. She has enough experience in this line of work, thus she has quite a lot of customers in her district and nearby areas. She will use the loan in the purchase of counters and display cases to show her products; this will generate her greater income that will allow her quality of life to improve.

loans.use: to buy counters and display cases to show her beauty products.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es:
Valeria tiene 51 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad donde se puede apreciar grandes depósitos de ripio y arena que la población utiliza para la construcción de sus viviendas, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región de Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales y nutrientes, las ventas las realiza en su domicilio, así como en caseríos aledaños, cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y por ende va a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Valeria, 51, lives in Cayalti with her husband and children.  The area is rich in deposits of sand and gravel that local people use to build their houses.  Agriculture, commerce and animal-rearing are major occupations here in the Lambayeque region, along Peru's northern coast.

Valeria owns a natural medicines business.  She operates the business from her house and goes out to surrounding towns to sell too.  She has operated the business for many years and has good personal and work-related references.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with a variety of products.  The investment will increase her income and, in turn, improve her quality of life and the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to stock her natural medicines business.

loans.name: Panuel

texts.en:
Panuel is a married man, with one child. He describes himself to be determined and trustworthy. He operates a butchery and has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are locals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy livestock. His business goal is to have a well known butchery within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand business and have a great life. 

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.  He will use the anticipated profits to open another business outlet.

loans.use: buy livestock to be able to further expand his butchery business and open another outlet

loans.name: Janepher

texts.en:
Janepher is a single woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in an area with potential and her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to hire a business premise. Her business goal is to be a major supplier within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfince bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to hire a business premise to continue selling fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Zakiya

texts.en:
Zakiya is a 46-year-old woman who has been running a school for 23 years. Zakiya believes that all children, regardless of where they are born, deserve quality education. This has been her life’s work ever since she completed her own education. After years of hard work, today, there are 214 boys and girls in her school. 

She wants to improve the physical infrastructure of her school in order to improve the learning experience of the students. She requires a loan of PKR 110,000 to buy chairs and desks, and to conduct necessary repairs around the school.

loans.use: to buy chairs and desks, and to conduct necessary repairs around the school, for the benefit of the students and teachers

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
Hernan tiene 27 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa familiar en el distrito de Oyotún, la cual es una zona rural donde los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales, ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicios agrícolas como peón, realiza esta actividad desde hace 3 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para la compra de nuevas herramientas y para brindar mantenimiento a sus actuales herramientas ya que se encuentran en mal estado, esto le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus herramientas y darle una mejor apariencia para poder brindar mejores servicios, lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hernan, 27, is single and lives in the house where he grew up in Oyotun.  The town is in a rural part of the Lambayeque region along Peru's northern coast.  Agriculture, commerce and animal-rearing are major occupations here.

Hernan has worked as a farm laborer for 3 years.  He is experienced and has good personal and work-related references.  He is applying for a loan, part of which he will use to buy tools that he needs to work and the rest to repair the tools that he has.  The investment will help him to show that he can deliver the services that he offers and, in turn, continue to work for a better life.

loans.use: to repair some of his farming tools and buy others.

loans.name: Jose Paco

texts.es:
José Paco tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, se encuentra ubicado en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de caña de azúcar y destilación de aguardiente, una bebida que se procesa a base del jugo de caña de azúcar y lo comercializa en su mismo distrito y caseríos aledaños. Ha solicitado un préstamo para el mantenimiento de sus herramientas de trabajo las cuales utiliza para la destilación de aguardiente, con esto el espera mejorar la calidad de su producto lo que mejorará su nivel de ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
José Paco, 33, lives in Callayuc with his wife and two children.  The town is in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern mountains.  Agriculture, commerce and animal-rearing are major occupations here.

José Paco grows sugar cane and makes aguardiente, a drink distilled from sugar cane.  He sells what he produces to local buyers and to buyers from surrounding towns.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to maintain the equipment that he uses to distill aguardiente.  He expects the investment to improve the quality of his product and, in turn, his income and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain his work tools.

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika and Gezim or ‘joy’ in English are married and parents of two teenage children from south eastern Albania.  In the photograph they are holding in their hands the papers for the loan. 

Agriculture has been their focus for the past 24 years and they plant beans, peppers and tomatoes and they then sell them to wholesale buyers. In addition to vegetables, they also have fruit and nut orchards, such as 5 nuts, 30 plums and 50 pears that they also sell the fruits to wholesale buyers.
 
The reason that they are seeking your financial help is that they need to dig a new well for watering the plantations, because so far, the running water is not enough and the old well has dried out.

loans.use: to dig a new well for watering their vegetables and fruit and nut trees, to ensure good yields for the wholesale market

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en el distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y venta de ganado, cuenta con 25 años de experiencia en esta actividad y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo lo utilizará para la compra de una mayor cantidad de ganado vacuno para incrementar el stock de su negocio, con esto el espera obtener mayores ingresos que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sergio, 48, lives in Callayuc with his wife and three children.  The town is in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern mountains.  Agriculture and animal-rearing are major occupations here.  

Sergio has raised and sold cattle for 25 years.  He has good personal and work-related references.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to buy more cattle.  He expects the investment to increase his income and, in turn, improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle for his ranching business.

loans.name: Silberio

texts.es:
Silberio tiene 47 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus cuatro menores hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad pequeña dedicada a la ganadería y agricultura, esta ubicada en la provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 7 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha, esto lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Silberio, 47, lives in a modest house in Pomahuaca with his wife and four minor-aged children.  The town is in the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern mountains.  Agriculture and animal-rearing are major occupations here.

Silberio has made a living growing coffee for 7 years and has good personal and work-related references.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to pay for the labor and supplies that he needs to harvest his next crop.  The investment will improve his crop yields and deliver the physiological and morphological improvements that he needs to maximize his returns.  He expects to sell his crop easily, a result that will increase his income and, in turn, improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for the labor and supplies that he needs to harvest his next crop.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Dairy business is an important source of income to small-scale farmers in Kenya. Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva to provide financial and technical solutions to poor farmers such as Godfrey, a father of 2 in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Godfrey has been a mixed farmer for the past seven years, and his primary sources of income have been milk, eggs and food crops. The Nkubu region area has a cool climate, but sometimes experiences long dry spells, and these accounts for major crop failure leading to starvation. 

Godfrey is seeking a loan to purchase a high quality dairy cow. Easy availability of feed and fodder all year round makes dairy farming an ideal choice of investment in this region. Through the loan Godfrey will be able to fully satisfy the demand of milk that is in his village and through increased income, he will be able to improve his living conditions. 

This loan will be very important because it will not only improve Godfrey’s life, but also he will be able to get manure, which will be used on his farm and improve productivity. Through Juhudi Kilimo, Godfrey has been trained on how to save money, and he plans to use the extra income to increase his business and is planning to buy another dairy cow.   All that Godfrey waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow to expand his farming activity

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is a clever, industrious worker who is in the business of raising dairy cows, a very common and competitive activity in the Kericho area of Kenya. He wants to lay a good foundation for his family and grandchildren to come, which is why he started farming and has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. His primary sources of income have been eggs, crops, and some personal business that he does so as to accumulate more wealth. 

Jonathan is very passionate about dairy farming and, as he always says, “dairy farming is close to my heart. Dairy farming in Kenya has seen an upsurge in growth, and milk prices in the recent past have skyrocketed, which has translated to increased earnings for farmers. Jonathan, being a very hardworking and visionary farmer, will want to take advantage of the ready market, which is why he requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, which he will use to buy a good quality breed of dairy cow. Jonathan has already decided what type of dairy breed he requires and, because of his immense knowledge on preparing hay, his cows will have plenty of food and will produce more milk. Jonathan projects that the cow he acquires with the loan will be producing more than 10 liters a day. 

Because there is a ready market for milk, he does not worry too much about competition, and marketing the milk will not be a challenge. He will be selling it directly to the market as well as to big dairy processing firms, which will result in increased earnings. Additionally, Jonathan has planned that instead of selling the milk in its raw form, he will be packaging the milk, and this will also improve his income. Profits from selling milk will enable Jonathan to be very successful. He also plans that through accumulated profits, he will be able to construct a biogas digester to produce energy that he will use in cooking and other domestic chores. Kindly help him out!

loans.use: To purchase a quality dairy cow, which will enable him to construct a bio-gas digester in the future

loans.name: Vorf

texts.en:
Vorf is a 47-year-old and a villager who is photographed while doing work in the field. “I wear dirty and old clothes to work, but since this is a picture I have to be in my very best outfit. So I've got to change and then allow you to take a picture of me, “said Vorf to the loan officer on the day of interview.

Vorf has two children thirteen and eleven years old; he is asking for your financial help to prepare the soil for planting corn and also buy some fertilizers.  About two years ago he started the corn activity and most specifically he plants corn that is used for popcorn and also barbecued corn cobs. 

He then goes to some beaches nearby his village and sells barbecued corns; while during other months he has a little vending machine going around and making/selling pop corns. In addition to this, he’s got a saw and 15 chickens for the family. His wife works for a foreign company located in her region that administers sage, planting and gathering it.

loans.use: to prepare the land for planting corn, that is used for popcorn/barbecued corn cobs and also to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a 43-year-old man who has fought a thousand and one battles throughout his life, some won and others lost, but he has been always positive about life and he believes that there will be light at the end of the tunnel. Benson started farming on a small, inherited piece of land in Mwihoko, a remote village in the Ndaragwa area of Kenya. 

Today, this humble father of two children sells milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. He is a passionate farmer and, because of his immense knowledge of farming, he commands a lot of respect from other farmers in his village. Dairy farming is close to his heart, and every day he wakes up to milk his cow, and that makes him very proud. Although he makes profits through milk selling, he lacks a proper dairy unit, and he is seeking a loan to build one. 

Through the loan, he will have a humble time milking and feeding his cow. A good dairy unit provides a sheltering place where cows can relax, and it also helps to protect them from diseases that may arise if they are exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Benson believes that through this loan, his living conditions will change because he is going to have an increase in milk production. He will save money that he used to spend on treating his cows because he lacked a good dairy unit. Benson waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit for the welfare of his herd and to improve milk yield

loans.name: Kastriot

texts.en:
Kastriot is married and the father of two chidren, aged 13 and 4. He works as a DJ at weddings, engagements, birthdays and baptisms. He also handcrafts and sells furniture, shown in this picture. He has been doing both acticies for the past 10 years and earning roughly $200 per month. His wife,  who works as a teacher, eans $490 per month.

Kastriot is applying for this loan because he needs to buy some new musical equipment. He is the only musician in his town of approximately 10,000 residents, which he considers an advantage. 

As he has explained to his loan officer, "Since I was young, I loved music and, once I grew a bit older, I started studying it and [I have] no regrets. Maybe the money is not enough at all, but that’s my passion. Besides that, if I ever was given other opportunities to make more money, of course I would have never said 'no.'”

loans.use: to buy new musical equipment for his business

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith's heart harbours a desire to become one of the greatest horticulture farmers. She is hardworking, charismatic and cheerful, and has a very good sense of humour. These qualities have been her inspiration to work hard on her farm.

With children to raise, water to fetch, and food to cook, Edith has little time to make money to financially support her family. With the little time Edith has left, she sells crops from the family's small farm and also keeps dairy cows and poultry.

Edith is seeking a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings from Kiva lenders. She will use the loan to buy seeds and grow her horticulture business. Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by steadily rising exports.

Although experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that people with small farms and poor farmers are included in the opportunities in this market sector. It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Edith access to a loan. This loan will assist her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities, and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. 

With your loan, Edith’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of the family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: To buy seeds to start horticulture farming

loans.name: Sixto David

texts.es:
Sixto tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa familiar en el distrito de Oyotún, la cual es una zona rural que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales, ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de jornalería como peón agrícola, realiza esta actividad desde hace 15 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su comunidad. Solicita préstamo para la compra de herramientas nuevas como son palanas, pico, etc. para realizar su trabajo, esto con la finalidad de brindar mejores servicios a sus clientes lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Sixto is 30 years old, single, and lives in his family's home in the district of Oyotun, which is a rural zone dedicated to agriculture, commerce and animal raising. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru.

Sixto offers his services as a day laborer, an agricultural worker. He has done this for the last 15 years and can count on experience in this business and good personal and labor references in his community. 

Sixto is requesting a loan to purchase new work tools, such as shovels, pickaxes, etc., in order to do better work. He needs the loan for the purpose of offering his customers better services, which will permit him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: buy new tools such as shovels, pickaxes, etc. so that he can do his work.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Nancy, a very hardworking, energetic and honest mum who is 44 years of age. She lives in the rich highlands of Kerugoya. Nancy has been practicing farming for the past 10 years, and through those years she has been able to support her family. Her primary sources of income are eggs, milk, and crop farming. 

The Kerugoya area is populated and has a ready market for poultry products. However, Nancy's biggest challenge is lack of funds, which is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Poultry farming is one of the profitable business ventures in Kenya and you don’t need to be a large-scale farmer to benefit from it. Through the loan, Nancy will be able to sell eggs, meat and poultry feathers to the already existing market. The demand for chicken is always high, being such a popular meal for many people as can be proved when you visit fast food joints in her area. 

Nancy has been facing challenges accessing finances but she feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva are there to make her dream come true. Nancy chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loans is low and is on a reducing basis. Nancy underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, learning that saving is a continuous process in many microfinance institutions. Through the loan, Nancy's income will increase and her life will permanently change, leading to better living conditions for her family and a positive impact to the community.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Eliaza Group

texts.en:
Plaxedes is a cross border trader who has started her business 10 years ago. She ventured into this business when only few people especially women, used to be in this trade. She stood the test of time in 2007 and 2008 the dark days of all forms of business activity, which is a sure testimony of being a serious business lady. 

As a cross border she buy clothes from South Africa and sell them in Zimbabwe. She acknowledged that she make profits of almost the same as her capital, as long as the business go well with no interruptions from some unforeseen eventualities. She also told her story painfully that sometimes the borders are unfriendly, as she sometimes encounter cruel revenue inspectors who can confiscate some of their stock. As a cross border she is happy to have passed through all the hectic moments so she is now able to survive even the jungle law ‘survival of the fittest’.
 
Plaxedes together with her group members of Eliaza group, wants to thank Thrive for the training and support in uplifting all their effort as women in small businesses. As a cross border she has met all, she can act as a consultant to the upcoming cross borders.

loans.use: To buy goods in South Africa on behalf of her customers, which are then sold in Zimbabwe

loans.name: Mukadam

texts.ru: Мукадам живет на районе Чиликул. Ей 57 лет. Она замужем и мать троих детей. У нее один сын и двое дочери. Дочки замужем. Сын женат и имеет детей. Мукадам счастливая мать и бабушка. Она довольная женщина в своей жизни. Мукадам занимается растениеводством. Она на своей земле выращивает помидоры. Пришло время обработать землю минеральными удобрениями, чтобы получит здоровый и качественный урожай. Средства получены от займов пойдут на минеральные удобрения. Мукадам старается, чтоб люди принимали здоровую пищу без химикатов. Она надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Mukadam lives in the district of Jilikul. She is 57 years old, married, with 3 kids. She has a son and two daughters. Her daughters are married. Son is married, too, with kids. Mukadam is a happy mother and grandmother. She is very pleased with her life. 

Mukadam is growing plants for a living. On her land, she grows tomatoes. Now it’s time to apply fertilizers to ensure the future produce is disease-free and high-quality. She will use the borrowed money to buy fertilizers. Mukadam wants everyone to eat healthy food without chemicals. She is hoping for your support!

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers

loans.name: Anesti

texts.en:
Anesti, 45, is the father of two children, aged 13 and 16. They live in the rural southeastern part of Albania. 

He has been farming and raising livestock for the past 10 years, focusing on planting and selling onions, potatoes and corn. For about nine months a year, he also sells about 15 liters of raw milk every day from his dairy cow.   

While he has chosen his source of earning, Anesti's wife works in a foreign-operated clothing factory in the city of Korca and gets paid $195 per month.

Anesti is requesting this loan to prepare his agricultural land for seasonal plantings and to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to prepare the land for planting and to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Brayan Jassan

texts.es:
Brayan tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa familiar en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad rural dedicada a la agricultura y ganadería que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de mecánica, reparación de motos y autos, realiza esta actividad desde hace 2 años, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio. Solicita préstamo para realizar arreglos en la infraestructura de su taller ya que se encuentra en mal estado, también para la compra de nuevas herramientas para su negocio, esto le servirá para tener mejores herramientas y darle una mejor apariencia a su taller lo que le permitirá captar mayores clientes lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a permitirle tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Brayan is 22 years old, single, and lives in his family's home in the Oyotún district. Oyotún is a rural community dedicated to agriculture and ranching, located on the northern coast of Peru, in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region.

Brayan works as a mechanic, repairing motorcycles and cars. He runs his business from his own home, and has been doing this for the last two years. He is requesting a loan to make repairs to his workshop, which is is poor condition, and to buy new tools for his business. This will enable him to have better tools and give a better appearance to his workshop, which will attract more customers and generate better income, providing Brayan  with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to make repairs to his workshop, which is is poor condition, and to buy new tools for his business.

loans.name: Dalip

texts.en:
Dalip wants to buy a dairy cow with your loan. For the past years, his family members living under the same roof including his wife, daughter, son and daughter-in-law have been pursuing the activity of livestock. This activity has been the only source of income for his family. 

Currently they have dairy cows, rabbits, ducks, chickens, goats and sheep. Dalip’s family sells 150-170 rabbits and 100 ducks a year. They also sell some eggs, but not many, and they sell 17.5 liters of raw milk a day to a nearby dairy farm. For additional income, they also buy calves and sell them when they are grown.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Dile

texts.en:
In the photograph are Dila and her husband, Luigj. They are villagers who are both in their fifties. They are parents of four children ranging in age from 12-20 years old. They are located in northern Albania. Livestock/agriculture is the activity that they have pursued for the past 10 years. 

Currently they have a dairy cow, a calf and 20 chickens. They plant fodder for the animals. In the greenhouse they have built, they plant seeds. After the seeds become seedlings, they sell them. For about 8-9 months a year, they sell 9 liters of raw milk each day, a baby calf each year, 30 eggs each month, 9 quintals of red and green peppers and 2 quintals of beans each year. 

At the moment, the greenhouse has only the skeleton and is not covered; thus the loan will be used to buy material to cover it.

loans.use: to buy material to cover the greenhouse that at the moment has only the skeleton

loans.name: Dave

texts.en:
Dave is 55 and a married mother of two, 25 and 21 years old, with the youngest studying psychology in the public university. The loan that Dave is requesting will be used to pay for the schooling tuition fee of this daughter. Their income is the disability income of her husband in the amount of $150/month and hers ($180/month) for being his caretaker. Their oldest child, their son, does seasonal work in Greece and as such he brings the money home.

They live in a little town in the north where rural activities are limited; thus, despite the fact that Dave would want to have another job and income, there are no such opportunities.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education fee. She's majoring in psychology.

loans.name: Malika
