texts.ru: Малика целеустремленная женщина привыкшая добиваться всего сама. Ей 27 года и она из района Руми. Малика замужем и мать троих маленьких детишек. Ее прекрасные детишки это мотивация ради них она живет и трудиться. В течение примерно 6 года Малика занимается бизнесом. Она печет самбусы. Малика вкусно печет, и ее самбусы знаменит своими вкусами и запахами. Она имеет много клиентов.  Каждый раз Малика нуждается в муки и дрова, у нее проблема  этими. Она хочет запасти муки и дрова, чтобы не потерять своих клиентов и ежедневный доход. Малика старается для своих детей, чтобы обеспечить их едой и одеждой. Она обратилась к Вам за помощь. Поддержите Малику!
texts.en:
Malika is an ambitious woman used to achieving everything herself. She is 27 years old and she comes from the district of Rumi. She is married, a mother of three little kids. Her children are her motivation to live and work hard. 

Malika has been an entrepreneur for about six years. She bakes sambuses. Her baking is delicious, and her sambuses are famous for their taste and flavor. She has a lot of customers. Every day Malika has to buy flour and firewood, but there’s a problem with it. She wants to stock enough flour and firewood not to lose her customers and everyday income. Malika is working hard to provide food and clothes for her children. She is asking for your help. Please, support Malika!

loans.use: to buy flour and firewood

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Grace, a 36-year-old mother who is so humble, honest, and a very hardworking woman on this planet Earth. Grace is a mother of a lovely family that she really adores so much, and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs.  Grace hails from the Kerugoya area of Kenya. Grace never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white-collar job but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life. 

Grace started farming and has been doing farming for the past three years. Through those years she has gathered so much experience, and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. Grace practices mixed farming on her farm, and through the profits she has managed to take care of her family's needs and also give her children a good education because she believes that education is the only “key to success.” 

Grace is a woman who is very enterprising, and she is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to buy seedlings and start horticulture farming on her farm. Grace wants to take advantage of the favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, and reap more profits. Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring women like Grace make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Grace hopes that through the loan she will improve her living conditions.

Grace's dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets through exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. Grace is not a selfish woman, and will also want to positively impact society; that is why she will employ people to work for her on her horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Yzeir

texts.en:
This is Yzeir, a villager in his late 50’s who has been doing agriculture and livestock for a very long time. He owns some land and also rents some more from others. He plants beans, corn, wheat, fodder and lucerne (alfalfa). From the two cows he currently has, Yzeir sells around 25 liters of raw milk/day for most of the year and also two baby calves a year. This is all the income for his family.

Considering the terrain of the village and the demand from villagers, he now wants to invest in a tractor so that he could use it on his land and also upon requests from others in the villages around. Most of the villagers own lots of land where they plant corn, wheat and other grains in quantities in addition to potatoes and onions. Basically, for almost all of them the above plantations are their living.

loans.use: to invest in an agricultural tractor.

loans.name: Gavrosh

texts.en:
Gavrosh is 48. For the past 20 years, his focus has been on arboriculture. He has invested time and money in grapevines and cherries.  He is a married father of three ranging in age from 12 to 20. They live in rural central eastern Albania. His family owns about 8,000 square meters. He has grapevines in 6,000 of them and cherries in 2,000 of them. 

Up until now, he operated a little kiosk as well near a school, and he recently closed it. The economy in Albania has gotten worse in the past two years as a result of the government, and also from economic troubles in the neighbor country of Greece, where many Albanians had settled for good since the early 90’s. They are now coming back to their homeland, increasing unemployment.

The source of income for his family comes from selling cherries and grapes and also from his wife who works in a travel agency for a pay of $200/month. Gavrosh wants to continue investing in arboriculture and this is what your loan will be used for.

loans.use: to invest in the arboriculture business. He hass got grapevines and cherry orchards.

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.ru: 29 летный самостоятельный, умный молодой бизнесмен это Чамшед. Он женат и отец 3 летного сына. Чамшед живет вместе мамой, женой и маленьким сыном. Его жена талантливая шустрая женщина. Она ведет домашнее хозяйство и занимается шитьем женской одежды. Сам Чамшед не смотря ни на что трудиться. Потому что он обеспечить семью. Чамшед занимается торговлей одежды. Он на рынке продает мужские и детские одежды. Чамшед хочет увеличить товарооборот путем перевоза больше и разные одежды. Его доходы только от этой деятельностью. Чамшед надеется с увеличением увеличиться доходы от продаже.  По этой причине он с большими надеждами обратился к Вам за кредитом, чтобы не потерять бизнес постоянный доход. Поддержите Чамшед с финансовыми трудностями.
texts.en:
Jamshed is a 29-year-old self-reliant and smart businessman. He is married, a father of a three-year-old son. Jamshed lives with his mother, wife and son. His wife is a bright and talented woman. She does the housework and sews women’s clothing.
 
Despite everything, Jamshed himself is working hard to provide for his family. He sells clothes for a living. He sells men’s and children’s clothing. Jamshed wants to increase his turnover by expanding the range of products. This business is his only source of income. Jamshed hopes that more diversity will raise his sales revenue. That’s why, with his big hopes, he requested a loan not to lose his business and stable income. Support Jamshed in his difficult financial situation!

loans.use: to increase turnover and the range of clothing

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Agnes, who is 48 years old and has a clear vision of what she wants for her life: she is dedicated to succeeding and having a good life along with her family. She hails from Ndaragwa, which is a small rural town in the Central province of Kenya. This mother of four is interested in many farming activities. Currently, she is doing dairy farming, maize farming and poultry. She has put the last 10 years of her life into agriculture. She loves it! Her main sources of income are milk and poultry. She makes extra money on the side through venturing into other personal businesses. She is very appreciative of the fact that farming has sustainable returns. This enables her to enjoy profits and expand. 

Agnes is seeking a loan to purchase a chaff cutter, which is a mechanical device that she will use in cutting straw or hay into small pieces before being mixed together with other forage to feed her cows. Agnes has been having problems feeding her cows: most of the time her cows refuse to eat, but the chaff cutter will aid the animals' digestion and prevent the cows from rejecting any part of the food. Through proper feeding, her cows will produce more milk and, hence, increase income through milk sales. Agnes believes the key to increased milk production is proper health. A dairy cow needs roughage and protein in her diet to be healthy. A healthy cow is more productive, and that means more income for the owner. Through increased income from milk selling, she will provide a better life for her family and afford her children's education.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Phillis

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders, Juhidi Kilimo is introducing to you Phillis, a country woman full of dreams and ambitions -- chiefly to improve her family's life through the sweat of her brow. 

This goal is why she went into the business of raising poultry and dairy cows, which is a common livelihood in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. She has earned a reputation for her reasonable prices and the quality of the poultry and milk that she sells. To make ends meet and earn extra cash, she also has engaged in another small personal business. 

The Kerugoya area is very populated, and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, Phillis finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She says the most enjoyable part is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand, which is really high. 

Phillis lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, thus she is seeking a loan to buy poultry. As a woman, accessing funds is very challenging but, through institutions such as Juhudi, via Kiva, she feels relieved to know that her dream will be achieved, and that she will be able to buy more poultry.

As a result of this loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbours and to the local market. These sales will translate into increased profit margins and an improved income level. Phillis envisions accumulating more profits and increasing her poultry market to other markets. Doing so would further increase her income and improve her living conditions. 

She will use the extra income to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Working on the land is one of the hardest jobs because of the great effort you have to make to progress. However, Sharon is a mother who never gives up despite the weather or situations that happen. She always manages to meet the requirements of her family. She gets up very early in the morning to go to her farm where she works. She owns a small piece of land together with her lovely husband. They have been blessed with adorable children. On the land, they have kept dairy cattle and grown vegetables for five years. Their main income sources are milk and crops. They recently ventured into a small personal business to supplement the meager income they earn. From Kiva lenders, Sharon is seeking a loan of 50,000 KES to grow her horticultural business. Loans to smallholder farmers in Kenya are hard to get and it is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to afford Sharon access to a loan facility that will help her to grow her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increase employment opportunities, and bring about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With this loan, Sharon’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability. Your support of this young mother could give her an enormous push. Kindly help her out!

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farm

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en:
Evalyne is a very responsible mother. She has had to go through a great deal of adversity during her lifetime, although she has always had the strength to get ahead and to continue making progress with her family.

She hails from the Kerugoya area of Kenya, an area that has one of the best weather patterns on earth that favors farming. Evalyne’s upbringing was very challenging, and because of this, she promised herself that she would work hard to get out of poverty. That is why she started farming. Through kale and mixed farming, she has been able to earn a decent income, becoming the breadwinner of her family. This really pushes her to work hard so that her children will have a bright future and her parents will have a comfortable life.

Evalyne is seeking a loan to buy seedlings and start horticultural farming so that she can use the excess space on her land. She dreams of buying more land and increasing her horticultural farming. Accessing funds is very difficult for a woman in Africa, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva, Evalyne is optimistic that her dream will be realized and her life will completely change. Through the income from horticultural farming, Evalyne will assure her children of a bright future and will be able to pay tuition fees for her siblings who depend on her. Through your loan, the promise of supporting small-scale farmers will be achieved.

Improve this Kenyan's life by giving her a loan!

loans.use: To buy seedlings and start horticulture farming

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is humble and hardworking. She is also a fighter who has spent a long part of her life caring for her children. She lives in the Kerugoya area of Kenya.

She has been practicing agribusiness for the past five years and has never looked back. For a living, Catherine sells milk, tea and food products from her farm to the local market. She enjoys seeing clients coming back for more products and really feels satisfied. 

Although Catherine has been making profits through tea farming, she has always wanted to do poultry farming. Her main challenge is a lack of funds to get her business off the ground. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture in Kerugoya and can be done on a part-time basis to earn extra income. 

Catherine is seeking a loan to buy quality breeds of poultry. She does not worry too much about competition, because the market for poultry products is good. Chicken is a popular meal for many people, and this can be seen if you visit any fast-food joint. 

She plans to buy different breeds of broilers and layers and to sell eggs and meat to the local market and other major markets in Kenya. She also plans to start breeding, which will help increase the number of poultry on her farm. With this loan, Catherine is confident that her income will increase, and her increased profits will enable permanent change in her life. 

Other than profits from selling eggs, poultry feathers and poultry meat, Catherine will benefit from using the poultry manure, which is an excellent source of nutrients for her farm. Through this loan, she will assure her large family of a secure future and improved living conditions.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Hello lenders. Meet Caroline, a very industrious, honest and hardworking woman from the Chuka area of Kenya, near the famous Mount Kenya. Caroline, 46, has been farming for the past 18 years. Through these years, she has gathered much experience and is considered among the best farmers in her village. She has been practising mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, crops and some small business ventures that help her make ends meet. Caroline is very passionate about farming and loves cultivating her farm. That is why, every day, she wakes up very early to go to her farm to plow.

Although she makes profits from farming, she is not comfortable and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. That is why she is seeking this loan to buy cereals for resale. Kenya's Chuka area, one of the county's populated regions, has a high demand for cereals. This means that Caroline could increase her profits and satisfy the demand that is there.

Accessing funds has been a challenge for Caroline, but she now feels relieved, because Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva lenders to help aspiring women farmers like her turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Caroline believes that this loan will be of much help, and that she will be able to satisfy the demand for cereals. She also believes that the extra income she earns will enable permanent change in her life and increase her business. Increased profits will allow Caroline to repay this loan and secure the future of her school-going children.

Lenders kindly help her out!

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: На фотке запечатлена Дилбар. Ей 30 лет. Она еще не замужем. Дилбар вместе родителем живет на районе Чиликул. Дилбар после окончании средней школы не смогла поступить в университет, потому что у нее родителях не было возможность для  поступление Дилбар.  Она самостоятельная и активная девушка. Дилбар работает официанткой в ресторане, чтобы помочь родителям обеспечить семью. Она хорошо справляется со своей работой. Ей нравится своя работа. Ее родители хотят отремонтировать, но у них не хватает денежных средств для покупки стройматериалы и для оплаты услуги мастера. Дилбар решила помочь родителям  финансовыми трудностями, и она обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Дилбар очень надеется на Вашу поддержку, чтобы помочь родителям отремонтировать дом.
texts.en:
The woman in the picture is Dilbar. She is 30 years old, not married yet. She lives with her parents in the region of Jilikul. After graduating from high school, Dilbar could get into a university because her parents couldn’t afford it. She is an independent and bright woman.

Dilbar works as a waitress in a restaurant to help her parents provide for the family. She is very good at her job, and she likes this type of work. Her parents want to renovate their house, but they don’t have enough money to buy construction supplies and pay for the work. Dilbar decided to help her parents cope financially, and requested a loan from you. She is hoping for your assistance to help her parents renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to renovate the house and pay the work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs, such as high quality seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Tereze

texts.en:
Tereze liked to be photographed with her husband, Pashk. They are seeking your financial help to build a stable for their pigs and a henhouse for their chickens.  For the past six years, their focus has been on livestock mostly.  In the yard of their house, which is not more than 500 square meters, they usually plant little things that they can use themselves whether it is fruits, veggies or grains. However, they have three sows and chickens and sell piglets to the local market. Her husband works in construction.

Tereze is 37, a mother of two teen-aged children and their family lives in northern Albania. She plans on expanding the pig business by building a stable first to fit at least 7-8 pigs at the moment.

loans.use: to build a stable for her three sows and a henhouse for the chickens

loans.name: Sulejman

texts.en:
Sulejman is 49 years old and a married father of seven ranging in age from 11 to 23. To bring an income home for his family of nine, he’s been transporting people and pupils; however, the van broke down recently and he must buy a used one. Not only that, but he also works as a night man while his wife practices agriculture/livestock. 

“You’ve got to work hard to support a large family; it is a blessing though, no complaints,” said Sulejman smiling during his interview. In the agricultural land that his family owns, they plant mostly potatoes and beans and they sell most of these products. Having animals as well, 30 sheep and one horse, they plant food for them, so that they don’t have to buy it. In addition to all this, they have 10 beehives, but they do not sell honey.

loans.use: to buy a used van since the one he used to transport people and pupils broke down recently

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Osman is shown here with Arjan, the second of three children, who was born with mental challenges and lately has been extremely aggressive with family members. Osman is seeking your compassion to take Arjan to the mental-health specialist at an American hospital in the capital city of Tirana.

"Our son was never aggressive until these recent years, " says Osman's wife. "He is getting aggressive every time and unfortunately we fear for our lives," she added, wiping away tears and not wanting to show her face.

Osman and his family fall way below the poverty level. He works in construction, which is mostly seasonal work, while his wife looks after their son. In addition, Osman receives a pension of $98 per month for his work in the mining industry as well as social assistance of $68 per month and a disability income of $99 per month for their son.

They literally seek your compassion and understanding in this matter.

loans.use: to take his 25-year-old son, who has a mental illness, to a health specialist

loans.name: Kujtim

texts.en:
A loan of 70,000 Albanian Lek will help Kujtim buy tires for the tractor seen in the picture. 

Kujtim is 44 and a married father of three children who are 18, 17 and 15 years old. He works as a mechanic and also does plowing, planting and threshing upon requests from villagers in the region.  In the 4000 square meters his family owns, he plants corn, wheat and fodder for the dairy cow he has and from which he sells one baby calf a year. Thus, the income for the family comes from his mechanic work and the use of the tractor, a disability income that his wife receives and the baby calf he sells for about $550.

loans.use: to buy tires for the tractor seen in the picture that he uses upon request from villagers

loans.name: Kristjan

texts.en: The freeze costs about 600,000 Albanian Lek, but they have relatives who lent them 400,000 so the rest Kristjan is requesting from you. They have a goats business as well that they previously bought through the integration loan.

loans.use: to buy freeze for the tractor he and his father use on requests from villagers

loans.name: Shpresa

texts.en:
Shpresa or ‘Hope’ in English is requesting this loan to buy corn seeds and pay for the land that she has rented from other villagers. For 20 years now, she’s been pursuing rural activities. She is 51 years old and the married mother of two, 17 and 21. At the moment, she’s got three milk cows and she sells the raw milk to a nearby dairy farm. She also plants corn and beets and fodder for her animals.

The village where Shpresa lives is a field village lying at the foot of a mountain. Villagers practice mostly livestock (sheep and cows) raising versus planting.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds and pay for the agricultural land she has rented from other villagers

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 56 years of age and very passionate and diligent about farming. She is considered a pacesetter when it comes to farming in her village of Mugwe in the Chuka area of Kenya. Having done mixed farming for the past 37 years, she has gained much experience and she offers free extension services to young upcoming farmers. Catherine is happily married and blessed with a lovely family. 

Catherine enjoys generating income from selling milk, her harvest, and produce from her farm. She finds dairy farming very fulfilling, but the main challenge she faces is not being able to properly feed her dairy cows. She is seeking a loan to buy a chaff cutter. She will be able to cut hay into small pieces before mixing it with other forage to feed her cattle. The chaff cutter will aid her cattle in digestion and will prevent her dairy cattle from rejecting any part of their food. Proper feeding of cattle is one of the most important factors in maintaining high yield production of milk. Through proper feeding, her cow will produce more milk and this will translate into more profits and improved living standards. When she was asked how this loan will benefit her family, Catherine said “more income.” Profits from the loan will be used in fully repaying the loan and improving standards of living for her parents, family, and her school-going children.

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter

loans.name: Felleze

texts.en: Felleze wants to buy feed for her cow. Since she bought the cow with your loan, she's been selling roughly 15 liters of raw milk/day for 8-9 months a year. One of the cows she had, unfortunately, passed away.

loans.use: to buy food for the cow she previously purchased with your loan

loans.name: Lindita

texts.en:
Lindita has managed to pay off her previous loan in full, and this makes her feel good. "I'm responsible and I do not want to miss deadlines or amounts as well," she said to the branch assistant. 

Lindita needs your help again to stock up on thrifty clothes to resell. Kindly note that this activity in Albania has proved to be profit-making, especially among members of the Roma as well as Egyptians, who are both considered ethnic minorities.
 
Lindita is seen in the photograph with Alban, her husband, and their little one-year-old.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Hello lenders, meet Roselyn, who is a 52-year-old smallhold farmer from Kericho in Rift Valley Province, Kenya. She owns a half-acre farm on which she has practiced mixed farming for thirty years.

This kind, loving mother keeps dairy animals and poultry and grows tea and vegetables. She is very hardworking and is determined to increase her farm's output.

Roselyn is part of a self-help group of fifteen members that call themselves Kapkottet self-help group. She is seeking a 50,000 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to buy seeds to improve her horticulture farming.

Loans for smallholder farmers with little and irregular income and no solid collateral are hard to come by in Kenya. There are only a few organizations such as Juhudi Kilimo that support farmers like Roselyn. It uses group-based savings as collateral. It facilitates loans that empower smallholder farming women, as it believes that women, too, are actively involved in agriculture. Juhudi Kilimo represents an opportunity for reducing poverty through income generation among smallholders. It looks to empowering both unskilled and semi-skilled women, since, in the past, African women used to stay at home and look after the household.

Through this loan Roselyn will be able to sell horticulture produce both in the domestic market and in other international markets and this will translate to increased earnings and an improved standard of living. Invest in this heroine who strives to improve her living conditions!

loans.use: To buy seedlings to improve her horticulture farming

loans.name: Meerim

texts.ru:
Мээрим, 26 лет, она замужем, с мужем ждут пополнения в семье - их первенца. У Мээрим неоконченное высшее образование, она в академическом отпуске, но планирует продолжить обучение. Мээрим 3 года работала журналистом в местной газете. На сегодняшний день она занимается продажей одежды, в обороте есть товар на сумму 60,000 сом (KGS). Мээрим продает одежду на дому, а так же развозит по организациям. Идет на встречу постоянным клиентам, продавая одежду в долг до получения ими заработной платы. Ежемесячная прибыль от торговли - примерно 5,300 сом (KGS).

Супруг Мээрим - ее главный помощник во всем! Он работает директором музыкальной школы, также по совместительству преподает музыку в центре поддержки детей с ограниченными возможностями. Заработная плата у него стабильная, в школе - 10,104 сом (KGS), в центре поддержки детей - 2,000 сом (KGS). 

И Мээрим, и ее супруг очень любят детей и ждут с нетерпением своего первенца. Они понимают, что с рождением малыша потребуется дополнительный источник доходов, так как они хотят дать ему только самое лучшее! Поэтому, посоветовавшись с супругом, Мээрим решила приобрести скот и начать собственное сельскохозяйственное дело. Мээрим узнала, что в Банке "Бай-Тушум" есть возможность получить кредит на стартовый бизнес на льготных условиях, и обратилась за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). Она ответственно подошла к будущему делу и накопила на старт 15,000 сом (KGS). На часть кредитных средств, а именно на 45,000 сом (KGS), Мээрим приобретет дойную корову. Так как она хочет, чтобы у коровы были достойные условия содержания, часть средств Мээрим направит на постройку сарая для коровы, место для будущей постройки уже расчистили, присмотрели, где подешевле смогут купить строительные материалы. У Мээрим есть опыт ведения сельского хозяйства, ее родители держали коров, а Мээрим будучи маленькой девочкой во всем им помогала. Молоко Мээрим планирует продавать соседям, развозить по домам или торговать у себя дома. Домашнее, экологически-чистое молоко будет также очень полезно для самой Мээрим и ее будущего малыша. После всех мероприятий, оставшуюся сумму, Мээрим вложит в ее торговый бизнес, так как не хочет терять постоянных с таким трудом наработанных клиентов.

Мээрим очень надеется, что ее бизнес будет процветать, она прогнозирует продажу 10 литров молока в день, по 15 сом (KGS) за литр, таким образом, ежемесячная выручка от животноводства составит 4,500 сом (KGS). Свои доходы она направит на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, воспитание будущего ребенка и всяческое улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en:
Meerim is 26 years old, married, expecting her first baby. Meerim has unfinished higher education, she is currently taking a gap year, but is planning to continue her studies. Meerim had been working in a local newspaper as a journalist for three years. Now she sells clothes for a living, with the turnover of 60,000 som (KGS). She sells clothes from home and also delivers them to different organizations. She is willing to help her customers and sells on credit until they receive their salaries. Meerim’s monthly profit is about 5300 som (KGS). 


Meerim’s husband is her partner in everything! He is the headmaster in the music school, besides, he works part-time as a music teacher in the center for children with disabilities. His monthly salary is stable, 10,104 som (KGS) in the school and 2000 som (KGS) in the children’s center. 


Meerim and her husband love children and look forward to having their own baby. They realize that they are going to need more money as they want provide the best of everything for their child! That’s why Meerim having discussed it with her husband, decided to buy livestock and start her own agricultural business. She learned that Bai Tushum Bank provides soft loans for start-ups, and she requested a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). She has a sensible approach to the business and saved 15,000 som (KGS) as the seed capital. Part of the money, 45,000 som (KGS) will go to buy a dairy cow. Since she wants the cow to have good living conditions, Meerim will have to spend another part of money on building a barn for the cow. The place for the building has been selected and cleared, and they have already checked where to buy cheaper construction supplies. Meerim is has experience in agriculture as her parents kept several cows, and Meerim always helped them when she was little. Meerim is planning on selling milk to the neighbors, deliver it to other houses and trade from home. Eco-friendly home-made milk will also be good for Meerim and her future baby. After all these arrangement, the rest of the money will be invested in her current sales business, as she doesn’t want to lose the customers she’s worked so hard on having. 

Meerim is hoping that her business will be prosperous, and she expects to sell 10 liters of milk per day, at 15 som (KGS) per liter, thus, making 4500 som (KGS) in the dairy business monthly. The income will be reinvested to expand the business and spent on raising their child and improving their family’s welfare.

loans.use: to start her business by purchasing dairy cow to produce eco-friendly milk, build a barn for the cow, and partially increase the range of clothes on sale

loans.name: Mrike

texts.en: Mrike has been photographed in front of a primitive stable she has built for her animals. Now, with your help, she plans on building a better and safer one since the current one Mrike fears will collapse on her animals (three cows and a baby calf).

loans.use: To build a stable. She fears the one she has will collapse on her animals

loans.name: Malie

texts.en: Malie wants to buy cherry seedlings and vines to plant. "I love orchards and especially when they bloom like in the spring season. But I do love them in all the seasons anyways. Whether they have fruits, blooms, drop the leaves or are bare; all are equal to me," said Malie smiling and touching gently the little leaves in the orchards while she was being interviewed.

loans.use: to buy cherry seedlings and vines for planting.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Listening to Dickson referring to the different breeds of dairy cows on his compound, one would mistake him for a certified Agricultural Extension Officer. Dickson, from Chuka, a remote town in Kenya, is an active and progressive farmer in his locality. He has a wife and together they live on a small piece of land. Traditionally, his primary source of income has been eggs, crops, and a personal business, and he has been practicing farming for the past 11 years. Having done farming for such a long time, he has gained so much experience that he is always ranked the best farmer in his village. 

Kenyans drink a lot of milk. This tradition is probably derived from tribal culture - particularly the Kikuyu tribe (Dickson’s tribe) - where cows represent wealth. Demand for dairy milk has been high and Dickson wants to take advantage of the market. Therefore, he is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is another profitable agricultural venture in Kenya and Dickson has already identified the breed of dairy cow that he wants. Dickson always says that, “To become a successful dairy farmer, one does not need to be a livestock expert. All one needs is passion, information, and keenness to learn from the successful farmers.” 

He has planted so many trees on his farm that food for the cattle will never be a problem. Marketing of the dairy milk and dairy products will not be a challenge, because he will sell the milk directly to the market and also to big dairy processing firms. Through the loan, Dickson will not only benefit from milk, but will also benefit from manure (cow dung) that will be used in improving the fertility of his farm, thus saving money that would have been spent buying fertilizer. Dickson has been facing challenges in accessing finances, but feels relieved knowing that institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, are there to make his dream come true. Dickson chose Juhudi Kilimo because the interest rate on their loans is low and is on a reducing basis. Dickson underwent training through Juhudi Kilimo, and during the training session, he learned that saving is a continuous process in many micro finance institutions. Through accumulated profits, Dickson plans to permanently improve his living conditions, and to secure the future of his school-aged child by paying tuition fees for him. He plans that through increased income, he will be able to buy more dairy cows and build a bio-gas digester, hence saving costs incurred in buying fuel.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando tiene 42 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico con su cónyuge y sus cuatro menores hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, provincia de Jaén, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. En esta comunidad los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 5 años y con buenas referencias en su distrito. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha, lo cual lo ayudará a la mejora tanto fisiológica, morfológica y productiva de su cultivo, así como también a tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rolando is 42 years old, and he lives in his own home made of crude materials with his wife and their four younger children. They live in the district of Pomahuaca, in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Perú. In this community, the residents make a living primarily in agriculture and commerce, and by raising animals.

Rolando makes a living in agriculture, specifically by growing coffee beans. He has 5 years experience in this occupation, and he has good recommendations in the district. This loan will be used by Rolando in his agricultural work: the incorporation and application of sanitary products and fertilizers, as well as the labor costs of his harvest. This will help Rolando to improve the physiological and morphological aspects of his crop. It will also help the productivity and timeliness of his crop. Through this he will have a more productive and higher quality crop, and won't have any problems selling his product. As a result, Rolando will earn more income which is going to improve the quality of life for him and his family.

loans.use: to pay for agricultural supplies such as sanitary products and fertilizers, as well as the labor costs of his harvest.

loans.name: Leonard

texts.en:
Leonard lives on a hilltop in Chuka, Kenya with his wife and their child. From his house, he can see a bright future thanks to the farming that he does. Leonard passionately loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of his cows “Gatune”. Because of the immense farming knowledge, he has farmers flock into his homestead to learn the best farming practices.

However, the biggest challenge he faces is satisfying the demand for milk in his village. The demand is overwhelming. He is seeking a loan to buy another dairy cow. He believes that through the loan, he will be able to improve his living conditions and be able to secure the future of his children. Having gone through training with Juhudi Kilimo, he is confident that the skills he acquired will help him increase his business and he will be able to pay back the loan. Leonard is confident that if you invest in his dream, you will be impacting the life of his family and children.

Please consider lending to Leonard.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Zoje

texts.en: Zoje, who has been photographed with her young grandson, is applying for this loan to buy fruits and veggies/grains to resell. This activity of whole buying and wholesale is something that her married son (a father of three who lives with her) operates. He buys inventory once a week from other regions of Albania known for the largest quantity of agricultural products and sells them to regions that do not produce enough to meet demand.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and veggies to resell through wholesale

loans.name: Preng

texts.en:
Preng is 47 and married; he has four children, all between the ages of 15-19 years old. Their family lives in a small town in central northern Albania. 

Although Preng engages in wholesale and purchase of kitchen wears (making approximately $700/month) in this case he has been photographed near some holes drilled in some sturdy rocks nearby his place of living, where he manually makes some broody nests to warm up the eggs. Currently, Preng has 40 chickens and two saws.

Preng’s oldest son is studying communications technology: he is in his second year at a public school in the capital of Albania. The reason Preng is applying for this loan is to pay his son's education fees.

loans.use: to pay for his son's university fees

loans.name: Azira

texts.ru: Азира, 32 года, замужем, мать 3 дочерей. У нее неоконченное высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, выращивая клевер, люцерну на 5,85 ГА собственной земли для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы и 5 овец. На ежедневной основе продает молоко. Продукция пользуется большим спросом, поэтому Азира решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на посев клевера для продажи и заготовки корма для собственного скота. Доходы от кредита Азира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, и планирует накопить на установку системы отопление в доме.
texts.en:
Azira is 34 years old, married, a mother of three daughters. She has unfinished higher education, her main source of income for the family is raising livestock and cultivating crops. On their own land lot of 5.85 ha, Azira cultivates clover and lucerne for personal consumption and for sale. There are two cows and five sheep in the household. Daily Azira sells milk. 

This product meets a high demand, that’s why she requested a loan of 20,000 som (KGS) from Bai Tushum Bank to sow clover for sale and to feed their livestock. Azira plans to invest the borrowed money to expand her business and save enough money to install heating system in the house.

loans.use: to cultivate her land and sow clover to sell and to feed her livestock

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael has been a farmer for a long time and knows what it takes to succeed. He is a hard worker who always says, “I eat from my sweat.” He lives in Mukuuni, a rural village in the rich highlands of Chuka. He is happily married and has been blessed with angelic-looking children. He has farmed for over 40 years, and has never regretted it. His primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, and crops. Most of the small-holder farmers in Mukuuni village own approximately ¼ acre of land per household, and this has made them work extra hard to fully utilize their farms. He has been

Michael has planted many trees on his compound and also has Napier grass, which has high protein and is used to feed his dairy cow. This enhances his milk-selling profits. Because of increased demand, Michael requests a loan to buy a good quality dairy cow. Dairy farming is a very profitable venture, and he wants to take full advantage of the ready market for dairy products. Through the loan, Michael is sure of satisfying the demand for milk in his area. Through increased profits, Michael is sure that he will repay the loan on time and also be in a position to comfortably take care of his family.

Michael, with his entrepreneurial spirit, strength and tenacity, would like to continue fighting so that he can achieve his dream of owning his own business and empowering society by being a source of employment. Juhudi Kilimo, through its training, has helped Michael save more effectively. He plans to add value to his milk through packaging. He also hopes to one day start manufacturing milk products such as yoghurt and cream. Michael will be able to continue farming and succeed with your help!

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a lively and resilient woman. She is from the Chuka area, an area that is very affected by poverty, inequality and social conflict. She intends for her family to get ahead through her hard work and effort without complaint.

Emily has spent the past 20 years of her life farming. She sells milk, poultry and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet.

Emily is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities in which she involves herself, dairy farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and milk her cows and feed them with fodder that has high nutrient value. She is so keen and close with her cows, she has named them, which makes Emily very proud, and she feels fulfilled. Dairy farming being a very profitable business venture, Emily wants to take full advantage. She would like to expand her dairy business, but the biggest challenge she faces is feeding her cows.

She is respectfully asking for a loan to buy a chaff cutter. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device that is used for cutting hay into smaller pieces before being mixed with other forages for easy digestion by the cow. The loan will assist the cow in producing more milk because they will have plenty of food to feed on.

The profits from milk sales will allow Emily to grow her business further, by starting to package milk and by processing it into other dairy products. In addition, she will benefit from the organic manure from the cow. She projects that she will be able to start a bio-gas plant at her farm, which will save her money in fuel costs. With your loan, all that Emily dreams of is a secure future for her family. Emily awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a small-hold farmer in Itundu village who practices livestock farming to feed her family. She has been married for over a decade.

Helen and her husband own a small piece of land. On the land, they keep dairy cows and poultry. Their family's main income source is milk.

With the increasing number in her family, Helen is applying for a loan to buy pigs. The pigs will produce pork meat to sell at the market for extra income. Money from this investment will be used to meet the needs of their family.

Kindly help her out!

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a resourceful, loving man at heart. His fatherly love has been enough to show him that he needs to work hard to help his children get ahead with excellent values and education.

At age 31, Joshua is a small-hold farmer in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Over the past ten years, he has bred more than one dairy cow and sheep and has developed his farm. He has also planted and sold a variety of crops. He says the secret to his success is thinking of farming as a way to make money, not just as a traditional way of life – adopting new technologies and methods, plus crop diversification, record-keeping and good planning also help.

Joshua was unable to study to find a professional career because of the economic situation that his family faced. However, he never gave up and he has been practicing farming. Due to how much he likes farming, he has even nicknamed one of his cows “Mutune” which makes him a very proud farmer, especially when he is milking his cows. Through his dairy cow, he is able to get between 5-10 liters a day, and this helps him support his family.

Joshua also practices crop farming, but he has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements, and that is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, he will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer, and pesticides that he will use to greatly improve his crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques; using high-quality seeds will assure him of a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels.

Joshua is visionary, and his goal for the season is to boost his crop production and be able to get more crop output than the previous year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Joshua believes that through the loan, he will turn his family's life around and be able to give his child a solid educational background. This loan will be Joshua’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 37-year-old father who lives in the Kericho area, which is located in the Rift Valley province of Kenya.

Daniel is an ambitious man, and looks to a future when he is the leading supplier of horticulture products. He works 12 to 14 hours a day to fulfill his dream. He has farmed for five years, and earns an honest and decent income. Daniel has sugarcane vegetables and a dairy farm, and has a small business to make ends meet.

Although he has been making profits, life has not been easy for Daniel. However, he has managed to overcome every challenge that he faces.

Daniel seeks a loan via Juhudi Kilimo to venture into horticulture farming. His location is favorable to other types of farming due to the good road network, climate, and market demand. Daniel and his family will work very hard to take good care of their investment in horticulture, in which they put their hopes for a better life.

Daniel is disciplined regarding finances, and he plans to enter international markets to earn more income, and secure a stable future for his family.

loans.use: to venture into other areas of farming

loans.name: Luz Mary

texts.es:
Ella es Luz Mery una confeccionista de 64 años de edad que junto con su empleada trabajan 10 horas diarias todo por sacar el negocio adelante, ese negocio que les da de comer, para pagar arriendo, educación de hijos, esto que significa tanto para unas mujeres que ya por su edad no pueden encontrar trabajo y que no cuentan con una pensión, donde se esfuerzan tanto por lograr tener clientes y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Luz Mery tiene un sueño el cual es poder generar empleo a personas como ella de la tercera edad que buscan un medio para generar ingresos, quiere crear un grupo sólido y maduro con este tipo de personas pero para poder contratar necesita mejorar sus ingresos y tener mayor producción para confeccionar.
Luz Mery quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos para la confección como lo es hilos, agujas, telas, remaches, nylon, pero el principal motivo es comprar una maquina fileteadora, porque con la ayuda de esta máquina podrá aceptar mayor volumen de producción y ver la viabilidad de contratar a una empleada nueva, siguiendo la metodología que sea una persona de tercera edad que necesita recursos.
texts.en:
Luz Mery is a 64 year old seamstress who together with her employee works 10 hours daily, all to get her business ahead. This business earns their food to eat, pays the rent and education of her children. This means so much to other women that at her age can't find work and don't pay a pension where they work so hard to manage to have clients and improve their living conditions.

Luz Mery has a dream in which she can generate employment for other older people who are looking for a way to generate income. She wants to form a mature and unified group with this type of person.

But in order to hire them she needs to increase her income and have greater production sewing. Luz Mery wants to request a loan to buy supplies for sewing like thread, needles, fabric, rivets and nylon. But her main motive is to buy a serger as with the help of this machine she can accept a greater volume of production and see the viability of hiring a new employee, following her idea of it being an older person who is in want of resources.

loans.use: to buy a serger as with the help of this machine she can accept a greater volume of production.

loans.name: Derentina

texts.en: Derentina is a seamstress and your loan will help her buy fabric, raw materials and other necessary items for her seamstress business that she runs from home. She repairs clothes and designs and stitches draperies, bed linens, female outfits, etc.

loans.use: to buy fabric, raw materials and other necessary items for her seamstress activities

loans.name: Astrit

texts.en: Astrit wants to buy wooden planks. His woodworking business has been going well lately. Many households who can't afford buying imported furniture from the stores order or buy the furniture from shops like Astrit's at a better price.

loans.use: to buy wooden planks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a farmer in Ndaragwa who grows maize, raises poultry, and has dairy. He produces milk and eggs for commercial purposes as opposed to many rural farmers who are in it for subsistence. Peter also grows maize for food and sales. These commercial activities place him in a better position to engage in other agriculture-related businesses. 

Peter seeks a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to construct a cow shed. This will help him to significantly managing the animals’ health and hygiene. 

He has farmed for at least 25 years and plans to continue as he finds farming to be not only fulfilling but also lucrative. However, his biggest challenges are the poor road network and the lack of market. 

The loan will help Peter to construct a cow shed, which will later come in handy when he scales up and introduces zero-grazing. The long-term impact is an increase in productivity and improved animal health. The additional income from this development will go to his children’s education. Help out a Kenyan entrepreneur with great visions!

loans.use: To construct a modern cow shed

loans.name: Amparo Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ella es Amparo, fuerte, trabajadora, luchadora, responsable y soñadora, es una mujer de 68 años de edad que camina por las calles de Puerto Berrio empujando su coche de venta de alimentos puesto que con los ingresos que obtiene de este trabajo paga su alimentación, arriendo, vestimenta y demás gastos. 
Amparo tiene un hijo ya mayor de edad, este tiene su familia y también le ayuda con algo de dinero para el mantenimiento de su madre que vive sola con su pareja.
El amor su pareja, las ganas de salir adelante, vivir bien, no pasar necesidades son los motivos por los cuales esta mujer se despierta cada día y aunque la edad pese, aunque sea muy tedioso empujar ese puesto de alimentos ella lo hace porque sabe la importancia de los recursos que genera y cuanto esto ayuda para que ella y su pareja vivan estable y dignamente.
Amparo quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar surtido de alimentos, quiere comprar frutas, productos fritos, papas en bolsa, pasteles, entre otros productos.
texts.en:
This is Amparo: strong, hardworking, responsible, a fighter and a dreamer. She is a 68-year-old woman who walks the streets of Puerto Berrio pushing her food cart. With the income that she earns through this work, she pays for her food, rent, clothing, and other costs.

Amparo has a son who is now grown, and he has his own family. Amparo's son helps to support her financially, since Amparo only lives with her partner.

Amparo is motivated to get up everyday by the love she has for her partner, the desire to get ahead and live well, and the desire to not have to depend on someone else to take care of her needs. Although her age makes it tedious to push her food cart, she does it because she knows the importance of the income she earns, and she and her partner count on this so that they can have decent and stable lives.

Amparo would like to request a loan to buy an assortment of food. She wants to buy fruit, fried products, bags of potatoes, and cakes among other products.

loans.use: to buy fruit, fried products, bags of potatoes, and cakes, among other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy inputs and labor to plant more crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for farm transportation.

loans.name: William De Jesus

texts.es:
William es un hombre casado de 49 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 10 años de edad, tiene una familia unida y amorosa, su esposa se encarga de las labores de la casa mientras el sale a trabajar toda la semana 8 horas por día, William tiene su negocio propio que es una ebanistería, donde fabrica y repara hermosos muebles, como cajones para cocina, comedores, muebles, sillas, closet, entre otros productos.
Inicio este negocio porque quiere cumplir un sueño y compartirlo con toda su familia el cual es comprar una vivienda propia, por esta razón monto en el año 2014 este negocio, buscando su propio camino y algo para mantenerse y poder dejarle a su familia. 
En el momento William ofrece un empleo que es lo que puede pagar, su idea es generar muchos más empleos para consolidar un grupo de trabajo y firme con el cual pueda progresar y ver su sueño de comprar su casa cada vez más cerca.
William quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de sus insumos principales que son madera y pintura, este préstamo será muy importante porque con ellos fabricara unos pedidos de cajones para cocina, closet y camas que tiene pendiente.
Anímate a prestarle a William que inicio hace poco su empresa y busca todos los medios para mantenerse y ser competitivo en el mercado.
texts.en:
William is a 49-year-old married man. He has a 10-year-old son. He has a close and loving family, and his wife takes care of the household while he works all week for 8 hours a day. 

William has his own cabinet-making business, where he makes and repairs beautiful pieces of furniture such as kitchen cabinets, dining room sets, chairs, closets, and other pieces of furniture.

He began this business because he wanted to achieve a dream and share it with his family: to buy his own home. For this reason, he started this business in 2014 while searching for his own way and trying to find a way to support himself and leave behind something for his family. 

At the moment, William has one employee which is all he can pay for. His idea is to hire many more employees and form a group with which he can make further progress, and see his dream of buying a home come closer everyday.

William would like to request a loan to buy the main supplies of his business which are wood and paint. This loan will be very important because with it, he will build various requested items that are pending such as kitchen cabinets, closets, and beds. 

Go for it by lending to William who recently began his business, and is searching for every way he can to support himself and be competitive in the market.

loans.use: to buy the main supplies to make furniture: wood and paint.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a brilliant woman who has been married for three years and has one child. Her husband heads the family and she supports him in many ways, including provision of the family's basic needs. Mary ventured into farming three years ago, around the same time she got married. Today, she owns two acres of land where she keeps dairy cows and poultry and grows trees.

In preparation for the planting season, Mary is seeking a loan to pay for farm implements. The new implements will replace her old tools. Better and improved tools will make her work on the farm easier and faster. The quality of work achieved by modern tools will be much higher and so will the yields at the end of the season.

loans.use: to buy farm implements to make her work on the farm easier and faster

loans.name: Hilda Rosa

texts.es:
Hilda es una mujer de 60 años de edad, toda una luchadora, trabajadora, una mujer que tiene los pantalones bien puestos ya que no se dejó vencer por un mal momento que paso en su vida que fue la separación con su esposo, donde pensaron que se iba a desmoronar ya que su expareja daba todos los ingresos para su hogar, pero ella con sus capacidades y su conocimiento en confección monto, un taller de confección a terceros.
Hilda tiene dos hijos ya mayores de edad y necesita tu apoyo para mejorar y mantener su negocio y aún más porque tiene una meta, un deseo que es comprar una vivienda propia, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de dos maquinarias que necesita y no ha podido comprar por falta de capital que es una maquina plana y una maquina fileteadora.
Tu apoyo servirá para que esta gran mujer tenga herramientas para trabajar y buscar con sus manos realizar su preciado sueño, anímate presta.
texts.en:
Hilda is a 60-year-old woman. She is a fighter, and a hardworking woman who stands by her convictions. She hasn't let the separation from her husband defeat her. Others thought she was going to crumble, since her ex-husband use to provide for the household. However, Hilda with her ability and knowledge of tailoring, launched a tailoring shop for third parties. 

Hilda has two children who are now both grown, and she needs your support to improve and maintain her business, even more so because she has a goal. Her desire is to buy her own home. For this reason, she would like to request a loan to buy two machines which she needs and hasn't been able to buy due to a lack of capital: a stationary sewing machine and a serging machine.

Your support will help with great woman to have the tools to work, and realize her precious dream. Go for it and give a loan!

loans.use: to buy a stationary sewing machine and a serging machine.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah, a youthful 45 year old, is a wise farmer whom neighbors and fellow farmers respect as a mentor. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kitale, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Annah is happily married and blessed with a lovely family. For the past 15 years, she has been involved in mixed farming and her main source of income has been growing maize, vegetables, tomatoes. She also keeps dairy cows. Annah has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She also operates a posho mill as a side business. 

Although Annah has made profits selling a variety of food crops, she is faced with the challenge of timely delivery of produce to the market. This challenge has not made her give up; “I have to do something for my family,“ she said. Annah mobilized other women in her village and joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that helps aspiring women like her. She is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike.

Annah is from a remote village that has poor feeder roads, and transporting her produce to market has been a challenge, which is why she has suffered so many losses. Perishable products such as milk, vegetables, and tomatoes require timely delivery to the market if you are to fetch a high price, and through this loan Annah is going to achieve her dream and goals. Accessing a financial solution for women in Kenya is an uphill battle, but Annah feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva that help women so that they can gain respect and equality. The benefits of this loan are astronomical because Annah will never suffer losses due to delay in delivery of produce to the market and also she will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. She is a woman who is making a change for herself and for others in her community because she intends to employ someone who will be riding the motorbike and helping in farm work. With your loan, she will improve her living conditions and assure her children and grandchildren to come of a secure future.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Consolata, 45 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Naitiri, a remote village in Kitale. She is happily married and is blessed with 4 adorable children.

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last twenty-six years and has gained a great deal of experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business.

The Kitale area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high.

She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, so she is seeking a loan of 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman seeking to access funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry.

As a result of the loan, she will sell more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions.

The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions, and secure the future of her school-going children. Help her out!

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
In 2007, Margaret ventured into farming as a way of life so that she would be able to produce food for her family. Eight years down the line, Margaret is deep into commercial dairy and horticultural farming. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and vegetables. The money she makes from her various investments has helped elevate the quality of life of her four children who are in school.

Margaret is seeking a loan to expand her horticultural farm. The crops she grows on her farm are insufficient to fulfill the demand. However, to grow more crops, she needs more income. Caught up in this situation, Margaret will find your loan very handy. With KES 45,000 she is also going to pay for the resources necessary to expand her horticulture production. She has made a commitment to herself that the money she will make from this investment will go to loan repayment and her children's education. The money will also offset some of the farm expenses. She is certain that your lending will have a very big impact on her life.

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farming

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Peninah. She is 31 years of age and a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Ikonge, a remote village in Nyamira. She is happily married and blessed with three adorable children. Peninah has been practicing mixed farming for the last ten years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has also been engaged in another small personal business.

The Nyamira area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, Peninah finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the very high demand. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 25,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry.

Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, Peninah feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market and this will translate into increased profits and an improved income. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry business to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently changing her living conditions, and securing the future of her school-going children.

Kindly help her out!

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
Carlso es un vendedor de frutas y verduras tiene su negocio bien ubicado y pro su largo recorrido ha creado muy buena empatía con sus clientes lo que le ha servido para fidelizarlos, su negocio es muy importante porque es la fuente de ingresos para su familia, no tiene una pensión, ni una persona que le ayude solo su negocio y empieza desde las 3 de la mañana yendo a surtir a la plaza para tener siempre productos frescos disponibles para sus clientes.
Carlos quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de frutas y verduras, su idea es ampliar su inventario ya que las ventas han ido creciendo y tiene que aprovechar esta situación que será muy lucrativa y beneficiosa para su hogar.
texts.en:
Carlos is a fruit and vegetable vendor and has his business well situated. Over the long haul he has created very good relationships with his customers, which has served to maintain their loyalty.

His business is very important because it is the source of income for his family. He doesn't have a pension, nor anyone who helps, just his business. He starts at 3 in the morning going to stock en the square to always have his products fresh and ready for his customers.

Carlos wants to ask for a loan to purchase stock of fruits and vegetables. His idea is to expand his inventory since his sales have been growing and he needs to take advantage that the situation will be very lucrative and beneficial for his home.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables to increase his stock as demand has increased

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena es una señora de 32 años de edad, es casada tiene una hermosa familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 4 y 10 años, ellos viven en una comunidad de Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan.
Magdalena con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia trabaja como maestra de educación primaria desde hace 11 años, pero ella para mejorar sus ingresos tiene 25 cuerdas de cultivo de banano y café.
Magdalena se encuentra muy preocupado porque su cultivo de café ya necesita de su mantenimiento, pero ella en este momento ya no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder adquirir su fertilizantes y darle el mantenimiento necesario a su cultivo, pero ella a ahora ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo de Q 4000.00, y tiene las esperanzas de poder conseguirlo para no perder su cultivo, así poder comprarse un vehículo y construirse una casa de block.
texts.en:
Magdalena is a 32-year-old woman, is married and has a beautiful family of two children who are four and 10 years old. They live in the community of Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan. 

In an effort to make an income and support her family, Magdalena has worked as a primary school teacher for 11 years. But, to improve her income, she has 25 plots of land to grow bananas and coffee. 

Magdalena is very concerned because her coffee crop already needs maintenance, but at the moment she no longer has enough money to purchase fertilizer and provide the necessary maintenance on her crops. However, she has now made the decision to request a loan of 4,000 quetzales and has hopes that she will receive it so she doesn’t lose her crops – and thus will be able to buy a car and build a house of cinderblocks.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow coffee.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a farmer from Nyamira village in the Nyanza region of Kenya. As a mother, for 30 years, she has depended on mixed-farming to look after her husband and six children. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, vegetables, and other crops. She is also involved in temporary side-businesses. In the past, Jane has invested a lot of time and effort in crop cultivation. As much as she enjoyed and felt passionate about the activity, frequent occurrences of dry spells and market uncertainties messed things up for her and her dependents. Jane shifted her focus to a section of her business that she, for the first time, saw was close to being risk-free and very reliable: poultry. On closer look, the free-range hens on the farm were busy wandered about fending for themselves, laying eggs, hatching chicks, dropping manure on her farm, and also aerating the soil while looking for bugs. She started treating poultry farming not as a subsistence activity, but as a business. 

Jane is seeking a loan to acquire more poultry. This is in a bid to increase the scale of her poultry business. Additional income from the investment will go to her children's school fees and other family expenses.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is married and has six children. She is from Nyamira, Kenya. For the past 45 years, Florence has been involved in mixed farming. Her primary sources of income have been milk, eggs, and a personal business she engages in to make extra cash. Florence has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She passionately loves poultry farming. The biggest challenge she faces is a lack of capital to buy additional poultry birds. 

Florence requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to purchase high-quality poultry breeds that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs. She believes the excess maize she has can be used to feed the poultry, and sorghum can be used to give the poultry energy and green grams used for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay better quality eggs, which will translate into more income. With this loan, Florence will also benefit from fertilizer as the poultry droppings have a lot of nitrogen. With the additional income, she will be able to support her family and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy high-quality poultry breeds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Meet Lilian. She is 32 and a smallholder dairy farmer based in Nyamira, Kenya. She has two lovely children. Lilian has been doing dairy farming for fourteen years now. Her primary sources of income are milk, eggs, maize, and veggies.

Lilian is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry. This venture will diversify her product portfolio and help her manage risks that may affect a single product line. With poultry, she will be able to sell eggs and other poultry products in the market to boost her income. The money will help her manage to pay the high costs of inputs that have given her sleepless nights in the past. She loves farming and she aspires to keep growing her business. She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo and its partners for being supportive to smallholder farmers and making financial loans to farmers affordable. She plans to keep leveraging her business to grow her farm and improve her family's living standards.

Kindly help out this enterprising Kenyan!

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Hellen. She is 65 years of age and a very hardworking and self-driven farmer who is based in Ekerenyo, a remote village in Nyamira. This region has harsh weather patterns, and poultry farming is the only profitable business venture that thrives. Hellen is happily married and blessed with six children. For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary sources of income have been selling milk and crop farming. Hellen passionately loves poultry farming. When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, her reply was “selling eggs.” Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds to increase her poultry farming. 

Hellen is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Poultry farming is the only business that thrives in the Nyamira area because of the harsh weather patterns, so she wants to take full advantage of the poultry business. Hellen is a member of Omorare Self-help Group and through the group, she has received training on financial management and saving. Through the loan, she will sell eggs to the local market and to her neighbors, hence improving her living conditions and getting out of poverty. She will use the profits she earns as a result of the loan to repay the loan and increase her business.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Yunes

texts.en:
Yunes is a farmer who lives in the village of Ekerenyo near the town of Nyamira in Kenya. Yunes has three children. She has supported her family in the last decade through mixed farming. Her primary income sources are selling milk and maize. She also makes significant money selling eggs.

Yunes would love to expand her poultry business to make more profit. She does have limited funds and needs 10,000 KES to purchase more poultry. This loan will totally transform her business. She will be able to sell crates of eggs each blessed day.

Yunes will use the income from this investment to repay her loan, support her family, and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a mother from Molo, a remote town in Kenya. She has spent the past seven years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet.

Susan is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her animals. She is so close with her animals that she has nicknamed one of them.

Susan wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 KES, which she will use to buy additional poultry. With your loan, Susan will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money.

Susan is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Susan dreams of a secure future for her children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Geraldine Alexandra

texts.es:
Geraldin es una tierna y angelical joven de tan solo 21 años de edad, que con carisma y sonrisas sabe cómo lograr una venta, ella tiene gran amor por los animales, por ello quiso buscar una profesión en donde pudiera generar dinero y de algún modo estar cerca de los animales peludos que tanto alegran un hogar y desde el año 2011 tiene una tienda de productos para mascotas, vende cuido para perros, gatos, aves, contenedores, juguetes, crocretas, vende medicamentos comunes, arena para gato entre otros productos.
Ella es soltera, no tiene hijos, su responsabilidad es mantener y hacer crecer su negocio, ayudar incondicionalmente a sus padres y aparte generar ingresos extras para pagar su educación, en ese orden de ideas están estipuladas las prioridades de esta trabajadora Joven.
Hay algo que tiene muy contenta a Geraldine y es el aumento de demanda en su tienda, hay ganando clientes y algunos recurrentes que siempre acuden a ella para comprar algún producto para su mascota y esto es un motivo de felicidad.
Geraldin quiere solicitar un préstamo para abastecer su tienda, quiere aprovechar este buen momento que significara un crecimiento exponencial para ella, el préstamo lo invertirá en medicamentos, arena para gato y alimento.
texts.en:
Geraldine is a tender and angelic young 21-year-old woman. With charisma and smiles, she knows how to sell.
