She has a great love for animals, and for this reason she wanted to find a profession in which she could earn money, and somehow also be close to furry animals that brighten up homes. Since 2011, she has had a pet supplies store, where she sells products for dogs, cats, and birds. She sells containers, toys, common medicine, and kitty litter among other products.

She is single, and she doesn't have any children. Her responsibilities are to maintain and grow her business, help her parents unconditionally, and earn extra income to pay for her education. This is the order of priorities for this hardworking young woman. 

Geraldine is very happy because the demand in her store is increasing. She is winning over new clients, and there are some recurring clients who always turn to her to buy some product for their pets, and this makes her happy.

Geraldine would like to request a loan to stock her store. She wants to take advantage of this moment which will result in exponential growth for her. She will use the loan to buy medicine, kitty litter, and food.

loans.use: to buy medicine, kitty litter, and food for her pet shop.

loans.name: Jorge Ivan

texts.es:
Jorge es un joven de 20 años de edad, luchador, trabajador, emprendedor, que pro querer estudiar, superarse, sacar su familia adelante, monto un negocio de lavado de motos y carros en la vereda, con el fin de pagar sus estudios, apoyar en el mercado de la casa, sentirse útil y usar su juventud para algo productivo.
Quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de un compresor y reparar sus hidrolavadoras para seguir ejerciendo su trabajo y buscar un mejor futuro para toda su familia
texts.en:
Jorge is a 20-year-old, young man who is determined, hardworking and entrepreneurial. He wants to study, improve himself and help his family move forward. He set up a business washing cars and motorcycles along the roadside in order to pay for his studies, support his household, feel useful and use his youth to do something productive. 

He is asking for a loan to purchase a compressor and repair his pressure washer in order continue carrying out his work and seek a better future for all of his family.

loans.use: to buy a compressor and repair his pressure washer.

loans.name: Germana

texts.en:
The picture above presents Germana from the Kitale area of Kenya, a dedicated farmer practicing mixed farming. She is a woman in her early fifties from a community not known for farming, but she has been earning well through agriculture.

For the past 15 years, her primary source of income has been milk, maize and a variety of crops she plants. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has in farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud.

Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit, and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding it. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain.

Germana believes that through this loan her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Germana awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus 3 menores hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad de clima caluroso y abundante vegetación, sus pobladores son amables y se dedican al cultivo de frutales, café, maíz y hortalizas, ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al cultivo de café variedad catimore resistente a enfermedades, esta actividad la realiza hace 3 años, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café y con buenas referencias por parte de los pobladores de su distrito. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como gallinas, cuyes, cerdos, entre otros. El destino del crédito será para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café, el espera mejorar la calidad del producto que ofrece a sus clientes y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Fidel is 35 years old. He lives with his partner and his 3 youngest children in their own home made of rustic materials in the Santo Tomas district. It is a community with a hot climate and abundant vegetation. Its residents are kind, and earn a living farming fruits, coffee, corn, and vegetables. It is located in the Cutero province in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru.

He earns a living growing coffee of the catimor variety which is resistant to sicknesses. He has performed this occupation for 3 years. He has experience in the field of coffee farming and has good references from the residents of his district. Additionally, he works raising small animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, pigs and other animals. The loan will be used to buy compost and fertilizers to provide maintenance to his coffee crop. He hopes to improve the quality of his product that he offers to customers and ultimately he will obtain a greater income to then be able to improve his quality of life, and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers to provide maintenance to his coffee crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy small appliances amongst other items.

loans.name: Ana Oveida

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer de 54 años de edad, que reside en una vereda, ella es una mujer humilde y madre de 4 muchachos, con su negocio de venta de productos como frituras en papas y productos de la canasta familiar, con sus ingresos paga la alimentación y el arriendo de la vivienda por lo que su negocio es de vital importancia para su familia.
Ana quiere superarse ser mejor vendedora y tendera pro ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de una vitrina, estanterías y surtido de productos de la canasta familiar que ayudaran a mejorar sus ventas y tener un surtido más amplio que ofrecer a los clientes, beneficiándose y pudiendo generar más ingresos que caerían muy bien a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is a 54-year-old woman, who lives in a village. She is a poor woman, and the mother of four young boys. With the income from her business selling products such as potato chips and family food basket products, she pays for food and for the rent for her home. That is why her business is vitally important for her family.

Ana wants to improve, to be a better saleswoman and shopkeeper. That is why she wants to request a loan for the purchase of a display case, shelving, and a supply of family food basket products. This will help her to have a wider assortment to offer the customers, which will be to her benefit, enabling her to generate more income that will be very good for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a display case, shelving, and a supply of family food basket products.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Working in the fields is one of the hardest jobs these days because of the great effort one must do to progress, but Damaris is a woman who has never given up. Despite the weather or the circumstances that can happen, she is always ready to get resources for her family. She is a 38-year-old smallholder farmer based in Nyamira, which is a small rural town in Nyanza area of Kenya. Damaris and her husband have been blessed with three children. For 6 years, Damaris has been a mixed-farmer. She keeps poultry on her farm. She also grows maize, among other crops. Despite prevailing poultry diseases, she finds poultry farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. Besides poultry farming, she has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive hobby for women. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden; any woman with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing her best to make her little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful. Damaris, however, is taking this a little step further. Damaris is seeking a loan to buy seedlings and start horticultural farming. This is a big deal for her. She is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses she has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, she will finally be able to satisfy her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Amauri Antonio

texts.es:
Amaury Antonio es un joven estudiante de Ingeniería Industrial, él solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativos, esta es su Historia:
Mi Nombre Amauri Antonio, tengo 21 años de edad, vivo en el pinito sabaneta La Vega, nacido en La Vega y crecí en el pinito sabaneta. Tengo tres hermanas y soy soltero mi padre es agricultor y mi madre es ama de casa.

Estudio en UCATECI Ingeniería industrial y voy por el 6to cuatrimestre, me gusta esta carrera  porque a través de esta  puedo servir a mi comunidad y a las industrias de mi país, me apasiona la materia de estadísticas, me identifico mucho con ella. 

Mi familia es de muy escasos recursos y no pueden seguir ayudándome con mis estudios, por lo que para mí sería  casi imposible continuar los mismos y me vería en la necesidad de tener que dejarlos y trabajar  con mi padre en el campo, algo  no que quiero que pase.  

Mis metas son trabajar en la Industria, estar lidereando grupos de personas, generando ideas y estrategias para el beneficio de la misma y que aporte al de desarrollo de mi país.
texts.en:
Amauri Antonio is a young Industrial Engineering student. He is requesting a loan to be able to cover his education costs. This is his story:

"My name is Amauri Antonio. I am 21 years old and live in El Pinito Sabaneta, La Vega. I was born in La Vega, and I grew up in El Pinito Sabatena. I have three sisters and I am single. My father is a farmer and my mother is a homemaker.

I am studying in UCATECI Industrial Engineering and am entering the sixth quarter. I like this profession because through it, I can serve my community and the industries of my country. I'm passionate about the subject of statistics because I can identify with it well.

My family has scarce resources and cannot continue supporting me in my studies, which would make it almost impossible for me to continue and I would need to stop studying to work with my father on the farm. I do not want this to happen.

My goals are to work in the industry, and be leading groups of people generating ideas and strategies to benefit them and support the development of my country."

loans.use: to pay the costs of higher education.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer de 56 años de edad, que tomo la decisión de iniciar un negocio de venta de ropa con la única intención de mejorar las condiciones de vida en su familia y pensando que está en una época donde necesita recursos pues que no tiene hijos y no cuenta con una pensión y en su vejez quien la va a mantener?, por ello opto por volverse emprendedora y que con tu ayuda puede lograr su objetivo ya que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de una vitrina para exhibir productos y surtido de ropa para hombre y mujer.
texts.en:
Rosa is 56-year-old woman who decided to start her own business selling clothing with the sole intention of improving her family’s living conditions – thinking that at a time when she needs resources and has no children or pension in her old age, who is going to support her?

This is why she opted to become an entrepreneur, and with the lenders’ help she can achieve her goal – which is requesting a loan to purchase a display cabinet to exhibit her products and an assortment of men and women’s clothing.

loans.use: to buy a glass case to display products and an assortment of men and women’s clothing

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Hello, world – meet Beatrice! Beatrice is a 40-year-old mother of four who does mixed farming for a living. She comes from Nyamira (Nyanza province, Kenya), where she has been doing this work for six years. Her primary sources of income are selling eggs and maize, as well as some personal business. Beatrice’s hobby is feeding chicks. She ensures the health of her farm by watering plants and tending to her animals. Beatrice is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry. Many rural farmers in Kenya keep poultry because it provides them with food, feathers, and companionship. With her loan, Beatrice will not only enjoy raising chickens for fresh eggs and meat, but also tap into the large commercial chicken industry. The money she will make as a result will help her pay for her children’s education. Her family will enjoy an improved standard of living.

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 35 años de edad vende mercancía variada mediante guías especializadas de productos o catalogas. Desde hace 6 años con la necesidad de generar ingresos para resolver gastos familiares, su cónyuge dio el primer capital para que Carmen empezara y desde entonces no se ha detenido. En su oferta de productos  se encuentran los perfumes, cremas  y artículos varios que le solicitan sus clientes y que presentan de una rotación frecuente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará perfumería, bisuterá, colonias, tratamientos capilares etc; con esta inversión Carmen logrará responder a sus pedidos y ganar un poco mas,  haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa. Su meta más adelante es tener su propia vivienda y a nivel empresarial incrementar el volumen de sus ventas para genera más ingresos, mientras la rentabilidad sobre sus ventas es 17%, la rentabilidad sobre la inversión es 15,5% , indicadores financieros desde los cuales se proyecta.
texts.en: Carmen is 35 years old. She sells a variety of merchandise through specialized product guides or catalogues. Six years ago, because of her need to generate income to cover the family's expenses, her husband gave her the initial capital so that Carmen could get started and she has not stopped since. Among the products she offers one can find perfumes, creams, a variety of items that her customers ask for, and items that she presents on a frequent rotation. Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her primary financing through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she will use to purchase perfumes, costume jewelry, colognes, and hair care products. With this loan Carmen will be able to fulfill her orders and earn a little more income, making her Kiva loan a successful investment. Her longterm goal is to have her own home and, on a business level, to increase her sales volume to generate more earnings. While the return on her sales is 17%, the return on investment is 15.5% according to her projections.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, costume jewelry, colognes and hair care products, etc.

loans.name: Ruldenny Francheska

texts.es:
Ruldenny Franchesca es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: 
Mi nombre es Ruldenny Francheska tengo 18 años de edad, nací y vivo en la ciudad de la vega, tengo dos hermanas, soy soltera no tengo hijos, y vivo con mis padres.

Yo quiero estudiar en la (Universidad Católica Tecnológica Del Cibao Ucateci), la carrera de  medicina porque desde pequeña he querido ser médico y es mi gran sueño y si Dios quiere la voy a lograr, no he podido estudiar por no tener mis padres  los recursos necesarios para costear mi carrera. Mi padre trabaja como moto concho y tiene todo el peso de los gastos del hogar, por lo que se le hace difícil poder  ayudarme, y mi madre no trabaja.       

 Sueño con ser  profesional  ayudar a mi familia  tener hijos  y ser una mujer de bien   después que yo termine mi  profesión  la voy a ejercer con orgullo  y ayudar a las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Ruldenny Franchesca is a young medical student. She is requesting a loan so that she can cover her eduational expenses. This is her story:

"My name is Ruldenny Francheska and I am 18 years old. I was born and live in the city of La Vega. I have two sisters. I am single, I have no children, and I live with my parents.

"I want to study medicine at the Catholic Technological University of Cibao Ucateci. Since I was little, I have wanted to be a doctor. That is my biggest dream, and God willing, I am going to achieve it. I have not been able to go to school because my parents lack the resources necessary to pay for my degree. My father works as a motorcycle-taxi driver and he bears the full weight of the household expenses, so it has been difficult for him to be able to help me. My mother does not work.

"I dream of being a professional, helping my family, having children, and being a respectable woman. When I earn my degree I am going to practice medicine with pride and help the neediest people."

loans.use: to cover higher education expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Novis

texts.es: Novis de 41 años de edad, es la propietario de una tienda de ranchos, víveres, cárnicos, lácteo y artículos de la canasta familiar, que su clientela ubicada en el barrio donde habita, consume diariamente de acuerdo con sus posibilidades de compra.  Novis vive al sur dela ciudad con su cónyuge y sus dos hijas en las edades de 5 y 17 años, quienes lo impulsan diariamente a esforzarse para ofrecerle la mejor educación que le sea posible, hasta convertirlas en profesionales, como es su mayor sueño de prosperidad. Hace 3 años,  Novis inició su negocio que es de origen familiar, apoyado por su hermana a quien paga arriendo y soportado por su cónyuge, pues requiere salir a hacer compras y ella siempre está al frente de la venta diaria. Con este negocio le va muy bien desde que inició en Mayo del 2012, y por eso necesita hacerlo crecer, para vender de todo un poco. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una vitrina nueva y mercancía con la cual surtirla de artículos de rotación permanente, que requiere tener ordenados y bien exhibidos, para lograr mayores inventarios y por consiguiente un mayor impulso de sus ventas, lo cual hace de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Novis, who is 41 years old, is the proprietor of a store that sells groceries, meat products, dairy products, and items for the family food basket, which his customers, who are located in the neighborhood where he lives, use daily, according to the possibility that they will be purchased. Novis lives in the south of the city with his wife and their two daughters, ages 5 and 17, who impel him daily to exert himself to offer them the best education possible until they become professionals, which is his greatest dream of prosperity. Three years ago, Novis set up his business, which is in his family background, aided by his sister, to whom he pays rent, and supported by his wife, since he needs to go out to make purchases, and she is always in charge of the daily sales.

This business has been going very well for him since he began in May of 2012, and for this reason he needs to make it grow, in order to sell a little of everything. This is the reason why he has turned to a Kiva loan, the first financing that he has had from Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, through which he will buy a new display case and merchandise, with which he will stock the articles that he regularly sells, which need to be organized and well displayed, in order to achieve a greater inventory and as a result give a greater boost to his sales, which will make his Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy a new display case and merchandise such as groceries, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Isaac Daniel

texts.es:
Todo lo que ven en la foto es lo que necesita el señor Isaac un hombre de 28 años para iniciar su negocio de fábrica de calzado, y se lo muestra porque su anterior jefe está dispuesto a venderle su taller para que este trabaja ya que encontró en Isaac excelentes cualidad, pues es un hombre, honesto y responsable, servicial y sonriente que da todo por la familia. 
Por ello Isaac quiere solicitar un apoyo para que junto con sus ahorros pueda tener su propio taller de calzado y empezar un nuevo mundo que de seguro será muy beneficioso para él, ya que mejorara considerablemente la calidad de vida y dignidad de su familia.
texts.en:
Everything you see in the photo is what 28-year-old Issac needs to start his shoemaking business. It is shown because his former boss is ready to sell his workshop to Isaac. This is because he found Isaac to have excellent qualities and because Isaac is an honest, responsible, smiling, obliging man who does everything he can for his family.

For this reason, Isaac wants to request a loan so that he can use it and his own savings to get his own shoemaking workshop and embark on a new life that will be very beneficial for him since it will improve his family’s quality of life considerably.

loans.use: to buy the shoemaking workshop that you can see in the photo

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a 44-year-old farmer. She is among the farmers who stand out for their strength, vigor, responsibility, honesty and friendliness. Florence has been practicing mixed farming for the last 24 years and has gained much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her family, she has been selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has engaged in another small personal business. 

The Nyamira area is very populated, and demand for poultry products, including eggs, is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable. She says that the most enjoyable part of poultry farming is, “The increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the high demand. She lacks the funds to increase her poultry farming, so she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. 

It is very challenging for a woman her age to access funds but, through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva, she feels relieved to know that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. Through this loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbours and the local market, and this will translate into increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, Florence intends to accumulate more profits and broaden her poultry business to other markets. This will increase her income and improve her living conditions. She will use the extra income to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Damaris Susana

texts.es:
Doña Damaris es una mujer ya adulta, ella se desempeñó como ama de casa, a través de los años han superado grandes adversidades, ha pasado por momentos difíciles, por momentos alegres como una persona normal, pero estos tiempos se han tornado difíciles y el dinero no alcanza, ella cansada de esta situación quiso hacer algo por su familia y tomo al decisión de solicitar un préstamo para iniciar con un negocio de tienda de productos de la canasta familiar que quiere iniciar lo más rápido posible para mejorar las condiciones en su vivienda.
Con el préstamo Damaris comprara estanterías, y surtido como granos abarrotes, en pocas palabras productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Damaris is a housewife. Over the years she has overcome great adversities and experienced both difficult and happy moments, like any normal person, but these are difficult times for her and the money is not stretching far enough. Tired of this situation and wanting to do something for her family, she made the decision to request a loan in order to open a general store. She wants to start as soon as possible so she can improve her living conditions.

With the loan, Damaris will buy shelves and stock, such as grains and groceries—in short, basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy shelves, staple grains, and groceries

loans.name: Abigael

texts.en:
Abigael is a 53-year-old mother who has fought a thousand and one battles throughout her life, some won and others lost, but she has always had the strength to pick up herself.  Abigael is arguably among the most successful clients of Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance institution that deals only with smallholder farmers in rural parts of Kenya. She practices mixed farming that is dairy and poultry farming.

To capitalize more on returns from the booming farming business, Abigael is seeking a loan of KES 65,000 to build a greenhouse. Unlike her competition, Abigael conducts proper soil preparation and uses modern farming techniques to ensure high quality produce. By doing this, she has created a name for herself and a demand for her produce. Your lending will contribute greatly to the actualization of Abigael’s goal, which is to expand the greenhouse.  In the future, she is also planning to introduce zero grazing method, intensify her maize farming, and start value addition.

Kindly help her out!

loans.use: To build a green house

loans.name: Edmundo

texts.es:
Edmundo es un joven estudiado de 27 años de edad, que quiere iniciar un negocio de veterinaria, él quiso estudiar esta carrera debido al aprecio y amor que tienes por los animales ya hora que termino quiere poner al servicio de todos los conocimientos que adquirió todo su tiempo de estudio y prácticas, pero para ello necesita tu apoyo, con un aporte Edmundo podrá comprar vitrina, medicamentos, adecuar el consultorio, comprar un cavitron para realizar profilaxis y/o odontología canina.
Apoya a este joven con un sueño de ayudar a todos los animales que pueda que es su gran sueño y compromiso el cual se auto impuso
texts.en:
Edmundo is a 27-year-old young man. He wants to start a veterinary clinic. He wanted to study towards this degree because of his love of animals. Now that he has finished his degree, he wants to put all the knowledge he acquired during his studies into practice, but he needs your help. With a loan, Edmundo will be able to buy showcases and medications, fit out the clinic, and buy a Cavitron scaler for dental prophylaxis and/or canine dentistry.

Help this young man to achieve his dream of helping all animals. It is his great dream and he is committed to making his repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy showcases and medicine, fit out his veterinary clinic, and buy a Cavitron scaler for dental prophylaxis and/or canine dentistry

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: La venta de productos fritos al por mayor como papa rellena, carimañola, empanadas, arepas, chicha de maíz entre otros refrescos, es el negocio con el que Isabel y su cónyuge genera ingresos para satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar. Este negocio lo inició ella hace 15 años, cuando por la necesidad que tenía ella y su esposo de generar ingresos familiares y poder pagar los estudios de su hija, decidió emprender una tarea independiente que le resultara rentable. Decidida, empezó a vender fritos en pequeñas cantidades y hoy lo hace en un mayor volumen trabajando desde las 4 dela mañana hasta las 2 dela tarde, y vendiendo de contado a diferentes microempresas del sector, quienes son sus principales clientes; su meta es lograr aumentar la productividad, para aumentar sus ingresos y finalmente terminar de pagar su vivienda. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará masa, papa, yuca, huevos, plátanos, aceites, entre otros insumos, con el fin de incrementar su productividad y vender mucho más haciendo así de su credikiva una buena inversión.
texts.en: Isabel works selling fried products in bulk such as stuffed potatoes, empanadas, arepas, carimañola, and chicha, a corn based alcoholic beverage, among other drinks.  Isabel and her life partner generate income in this way to satisfy the needs of their family.  Isabel began this business 15 years ago when, out of necessity, she and her husband needed to generate income in order to pay for their daughter's education.  Isabel decided to start her own business to generate income.  Determined, she began to sell fried goods in small quantities and today she sells in large volumes working from 4 in the morning until 2 in the afternoon.  She sells for cash to different micro-businesses in her area, who are her main customers.  Her goal is to increase productivity, increase sales, and finally to finish paying off her home.  Currently she is applying for a loan from Kiva, her first loan from Kiva field partner Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy corn meal, potatoes, yucca, eggs, plantains, oils, and other food items, with the aim of increasing productivity and selling much more, making her Kiva loan a good investment.

loans.use: to buy corn meal, potatoes, yucca, eggs, plantains, oils, and other food items

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, at 44 years of age, due to the lack of opportunities for employment and economic need, is motivated to become independent and earn an income on his own. For this reason, he started farming fifteen years ago.

John is a passionate smallholder farmer based in Molemu village in the Kitale area of Kenya. For the last fifteen years, he has been practicing mixed farming to support his family and siblings. John makes money keeping goats and selling a variety of food crops, such as maize, from his farm.

John is seeking a loan because he wants to get into the poultry business. This is a diversification from crop farming. He enjoys dairy farming as much as he does crop farming. However, the region usually experiences long dry spells, which inevitably affect crop harvests negatively. For this reason, John is seeking a loan to buy poultry.

Poultry will serve both subsistence and commercial purposes. There is a high demand for poultry products in the developing town of Kitale, which is the nearest town to John's village. Proceeds from the sale of eggs will help John cope with the rising farm expenses that are putting many farmers in the region out of business.

His long-term plan is to free his family from the chains of poverty. For John, this support will be very important, since it will be the first loan that he has gotten in his 44 years. The years are heavy, but he will continue working hard to give his family and siblings a good inheritance.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Philister

texts.en:
Philister is an enterprising mum, a dreamer, a creative person who, with only a little, has achieved great things. She hails from the Molo area of Kenya, an area that is a city of champions because of producing so many elite athletes. Being the bread winner of her family comes with lots of responsibility, and feeding this large family requires a lot of hard work; hence, Philister has to put in extra efforts to comfortably take care of her family. 

Philister started farming just after finishing high school since she never advanced her education. Because of the high unemployment rate, she ventured into farming, and she has never regretted this because of the profits she has been making. Philister practices mixed farming and is regarded as one of the hardworking farmers in her village because she is able to juggle between keeping dairy cows and also crop farming. 

She also has a side hustle business (motorbike business).  Philister is a visionary and enterprising person and has always wanted to do dairy farming on a large scale, but one of the challenges she has faced is lack of enough capital. That is why she is kindly seeking a loan to buy a dairy cow. Through the loan Philister is confident that her life will be transformed and her dream of providing a secure future for her siblings will be achieved. Philister is relieved to know that her life can be secured through partners such as Kiva lenders who help small-scale and aspiring women such as Philister.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es: Jessica de 28 años de edad se dedica  a la venta de verduras comprando diariamente y vendiendo en esta misma frecuencia de contado y a crédito a sus vecinos del barrio donde habita y a restaurantes cercanos. Como madre de 1 niña de 3 años, diariamente se esfuerza por generar ingresos para sostenerla y salir con ella adelante. Su negocio inició hace menos de dos años, cuando al sentir que trabajaba mucho y ganaba poco decidió emprender su propia aventura emprendedora, vendiendo tomate, cebolla, cilantro entre otras verduras de uso diario de los consumidores.    Su meta más adelante es adecuar su local y tener su propia vivienda pues su gran desafío y sueño de prosperidad es incrementar sus ganancias. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará tomate, cebolla, cilantro, en mayor volumen, con lo cual disminuirá la frecuencia de compra y generará menos costos, haciendo a si de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Jessica is 28 years old. She works selling vegetables that she buys on a daily basis and sells with the same frequency for cash and credit to her neighbors from her community and nearby restaurants. As a mother of a 3 year old girl, she works hard each day to earn income to sustain and get ahead with her daughter. She began her business less than two years ago at a time when she felt like she was working very hard and earning very little. She decided to begin her own entrepreneurial adventure selling tomatoes, onions and cilantro among other vegetables that are used for daily consumption. Her longterm goal is to update her location and to have her own home. Her biggest challenge and her dream for prosperity is to increase her earnings. Currently, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, that she will use to purchase tomatoes, onion and cilantro in large quantities which will allow her to decrease her frequency of purchases and will generate fewer costs. This is how her Kiva loan will be a successful investment.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions and cilantro in large quantities.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia, mujer casada y madre de 2 hijas en las edades de 14 y 16 años, se dedica a la venta de mercancía variada, como cremas, colonias, accesorios femeninos etc. Su negocio inició hace 5 años, cuando su amiga la invitó a promover las ventas de estos artículos, mediante guías especializadas de productos, como efectivamente hizo desde que inició. Hoy sus metas no se detienen, pues necesita cada vez más, apoyar la educación de sus hijas  y en general su bienestar, por eso está empeñada en que sus ventas se incrementen para que su actividad sea más productiva. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace la Fundación Mario santo Domingo, mediante le cual comprará perfumería, cosméticos y colonias. Con más surtido alcanzará más ventas y por consiguiente más ingresos y esto es justamente lo que hace que su credikiva sea muy exitoso. Para ello  sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito durante todos los días, trabajando con mucho esmero desde las 2 hasta las 6 de la tarde ofreciendo en un local, todo lo que su clientela necesita, desea y requiera comprar.
texts.en:
Claudia, a married woman and mother of two girls aged 14 and 16, makes a living selling various products, like creams, colognes, feminine accessories etc. She started her business five years ago, when her friend invited her to promote the sales of these items through specialised catalogues, which is what she has done since she started. She continues to work towards her goals today, since she needs more in order to support her daughters' education and general well-being. So she is determined to increase her sales and make her business more profitable.

That is why she has turned to a Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, in order to buy perfume, cosmetics and cologne. Having more stock will allow her to achieve greater sales and consequently a higher income, and this is exactly what makes her Kiva loan so successful. She makes her sales in cash and on credit every day, working with great care from 2pm until 6pm in business premises where her customers can buy all the things they need, want and require.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cosmetics and cologne.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Stella, 34 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Karingaini, a remote village in Chuka, Kenya. She is happily married and is blessed with one adorable child. 

Stella has been practicing mixed farming for the last 12 years and has gained a great deal of experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her child, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and earn extra cash, she has also been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Chuka area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she states that the most enjoyable part about it is the increased profits she enjoys. 

Stella's biggest challenge, however, is meeting the high demand. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy more poultry. Being a woman and accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. 

As a result of the loan, Stella will be able to sell more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate into an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market into other markets. She will use the resulting extra income to fully repay the loan, change her living conditions, and secure the future of her child.

loans.use: to pay for poultry.

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es: Jairo se dedica al comercio de productos desechables y salsamentarías desde hace 6 años, cuando su padre, propietario inicial  de este negocio, empezó a trabajar como conductor y se lo dejó a él, pues no le quedaba tiempo para atenderlo. Como Jairo cuando regresaba del colegio lo atendía aprendió a manejarlo y por eso cuando finalizó sus estudios y se graduó de bachiller, le propuso a su padre que buscaran un local para hacerlo más visible y fue así como decidió ubicarlo en una de las principales vías del sur, la cual es muy transitada, todo ello con el fin de impulsar sus ventas y como lo hizo, por eso desde el año pasado está ubicado en un local. Sus ventas las hace de contado, a vendedores de productos alimenticios principalmente, trabajando desde la 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen productos desechables, para lograr precios competitivos, con los que pueda impactar positivamente a su clientela. Con esta inversión planea vender mucho más y tener su negocio más surtido, lo cual hace de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Jairo has been selling disposable products and pork deli meats for 6 years. His father, the initial owner of this business, started to work as a driver and left the business to Jairo, since he did not have time to look after it. 

When Jairo went back to the school he attended, he learnt how to manage the business, and this is why when he finished his studies and graduated with his diploma, he proposed to his father that they should look for a premises to make the business more visible. This then led to his decision to locate his business in one of the main roads in the south, which is very busy. This was all with the aim of propelling sales and it did, over the last year. His sales are all made in cash, mainly to sellers of food products. He works from 7 am to 8 pm. 

He is now applying for a Kiva loan, which is the first financing he has undertaken with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the loan to buy disposable products in bigger quantities, in order to keep his prices competitive, which will positively impact his customers. With this investment he plans to sell a lot more and have more stock for his business, which will make his Kiva loan a success.

loans.use: buy disposable products in bigger quantities.

loans.name: Marco Alexis

texts.es:
Marco es un hombre de 33 años de edad dedicado a la agricultura, es un hombre soltero pero con una gran responsabilidad la cual es apoyar a sus padres incondicionalmente en su mantenimiento, comprando sus drogas, la comida y lo hace con el campo de cultivo que fundo en el año 1998 y que desde entonces le ha dado de comer todo este tiempo.
El sueño principal de marco es mejorar sus cultivos expandirlo, conocer a una mujer y formar una familia.
Marco quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de insumos agrícolas como lo son abonos, gallinaza, pesticidas, fungicidas e insecticidas, que son insumos de mantenimiento de cultivos, esperando acabar con una plaga que tiene y que está devorando lo que con tanto esfuerzo cultivo.
texts.en:
Marco is a 33-year-old man who works in agriculture. He is single, but he has a great responsibility, which is to unconditionally support and care for his parents, purchasing their medications and food. He does this with the farm that he set up in 1998, which has been providing him with food since that time onward. 

Marco’s main dream is to improve his crops, expand them, meet a woman, and start a family.  Marco wants to request a loan for the purchase of farm supplies, such as compost, poultry manure, pesticide, fungicide, and insecticide to care for his crops. He is hoping to put an end to an infestation that he has, which is devouring what he worked so hard to grow.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Artin

texts.en:
Artin is a 40-year-old father of three. The oldest is 13 and the youngest is six. In the photograph it is the two youngest ones who were born with autism. Since they live in the village, the school where his daughter went to was in the village as well; however, it presented challenges for the girls. After enough consideration, he went on to register them in a school in the city that treats these kids differently. The transportation for them, though, became hard, because he had no vehicle and school buses did not accept the kids and for this he planned on buying a vehicle to take his daughters to the school. Buying the vehicle is the reason for the loan and Artin is almost begging you to end this difficult matter.

Artin pursues livestock as a source of income and practices his talents as a mechanic. His wife works as a kitchen helper in a famous Albanian bio-restaurant built on a farm, while his elderly parents take care of his children.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle to allow him to take his autistic young daughters to a proper school in the city.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Aprovechando la oleada de calor que azota a Colombia, Santiago un joven de 20 años de edad  que quiere aprovechar esta gran oportunidad para volverse emprendedor y crear un negocio de venta de guaralapo, que es una bebidas extraída naturalmente de la caña de azúcar, pero su principal inconveniente es el alto costo de la maquinaria, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para comprar una maquina picadora de caña, comprar caña de azúcar, pagar los permisos para trabajar e iniciar con su labor de inmediato en el centro.
Tu préstamo ayudara a este joven a tener un empleo para apoyar a su familia que es humilde y a pagarse sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Taking advantage of the heat wave that has hit Colombia Santiago, a 20 year old youth who wants to take advantage of this great opportunity to return to being an entrepreneur and create a business selling "guaralapo", which is a drink that is naturally extracted from sugar cane. 

His main difficulty is the high cost of the machinery, thus he wants to ask for a loan to buy a chopping machine for the cane, to buy sugar cane, to pay for the work permits and to start work immediately in the center.
 

Your loan will help this young man to have a job to help his humble family and pay for his university studies.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to chop sugar cane and to purchase sugar cane.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela, 37, is a housewife who practices small-scale dairy farming in Mugwe village in the Chuka area of Kenya. Pamela is active when it comes to commercial activities. She is a pragmatic problem solver. Her distinguishing factor is that she adds a business angle to every cultural way of life. While her community keeps cattle and poultry for food, she does the same on a greater scale in order to sell the surplus.

Pamela is seeking a 15,000 KES loan through Kiva's field partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a flock of hens. She will use the same technique she used to grow her dairy farm to grow her poultry farm. The flock of hens will lay eggs, half of which will be sold and the rest kept for hatching and family consumption. From the clutch of chicks, chick breeding will be conducted where female chicks will be kept, for they are destined to lay eggs for commercial purposes, while male chicks will be culled because they are more relevant to meat production.

With your investment, Pamela will be able to improve her family's livelihood by contributing to the income they generate. She will use the money from the poultry farm to grow the business and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase a flock of hens.

loans.name: Dominador

texts.en:
Dominador is grateful that he was granted a 10000 PHP loan which he used to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs needed on his farm. Through his earnings he is able to support his family's daily needs.

He would now like to apply for a Php 12000 loan which he will use to buy more fertilizer and farm inputs for a more productive pineapple harvest on his farm. It will definitely help cover his family’s daily needs and for his children’s education. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given him. 

Dominador dreams for his farm to flourish and so he could send his children to good schools. He prays for God's guidance and blessing for a happy and a quiet life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs and farm fertilizer to improve his pineapple farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy equipment to make cheese sticks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase dairy goats to raise as an addition to his farm  “I will be able to educate my children and also feed my family.”

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy another dairy cow, which will increase milk yield and be able "to transform lives".

loans.name: Anah

texts.en:
Anah lives in Kapsowar, an area with conditions that favor horticulture farming: good climate, soil, a transport system and a market. For the past year she has been actively involved in mixed farming. She has been earning good profits from her dairy. Anah is a woman with a great future ahead of her.

Anah has always wanted to diversify into horticulture farming, but her biggest challenge is her lack of capital. Through the Kapyego self-help group, whose members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan, she joined Juhudi Kilimo, a microfinance organization that supports young and enterprising farmers.

Anah is now applying for a 20,000 KES loan to embark on farming. With this loan she intends to buy good-quality vegetable and flower seeds, plus potato starts. Proximity to an airstrip will allow her to transport the produce faster to an international market, enabling her to make more money.

This loan will improve Anah's living conditions and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan says she is not looking for a job right now because she is comfortable doing pig farming. Susan is a very honest, hardworking and dedicated farmer who hails from the Kerugoya area of Kenya, known to have the best weather patterns that favor crops and animal farming. Susan has so much experience in pig farming, having done it for the past 10 years that she is considered one of the best farmers in her village. Susan’s primary source of income is selling pig meat, milk, eggs and crops. 

Susan has space on her farm that is unused, and she wants to use it to keep pigs. She is kindly seeking a loan to buy additional pigs. This will help Susan to improve her living conditions and also the conditions of her children by providing them with a solid education, because education is the “key to success.” 

The Kerugoya area has a large population and a ready market for pork. Hence, Susan will not have a problem selling the pork and increasing her income level. Susan is very disciplined with finances, and she is sure that, through accumulated profits, she will open a large pork selling butchery and be able to pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: To pay for additional pigs so as to expand her successful business and make it even better

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
When smallholder women farmer in Kenya come together, they are powerful,” says Gladys, a 28-year-old farmer who lives in the village of Kagumo in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. Because she knows the importance of coming together she decided to join Gakui self-help group. For the past year, Gladys has been actively involved in mixed farming, and because she is from rural Kenya, gender roles still adhere. 

Kerugoya is one of the places with conditions that favor horticulture farming: good climate, soils, transport system, and market. Gladys has always wanted to diversify and start horticultural farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is lack of funds. 

She is therefore requesting a loan to buy seedlings and start horticultural farming. Through the Gakui self-help group, whose members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan, Gladys joined Juhudi Kilimo, a micro finance organization that supports young and enterprising farmers. With your loan she intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers and potatoes. Proximity to an airstrip will allow her to transport the produce faster to an international market, hence enabling her to make more money. 

This loan will improve Gladys's living conditions and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and start horticulture farming, to secure the future of her children by producing good quality produce, even for export

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a modest and hardworking resident of the town of Kerugoya whose life is full of dreams, hopes and the best wishes for her family. For the past five years, Millicent has been actively involved in dairy and mixed farming. Kerugoya is one of the places that has favorable conditions for horticulture farming - good climate, soils, transport system, and market. 

Millicent has always wanted to diversify and start horticulture farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is lack of funds to start the business off the ground. She requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to buy seedlings to start horticulture farming. She joined Juhudi Kilimo because it supports young and enterprising farmers. 

With the loan, she intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers, and potatoes. This loan will improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: To buy seeds and start horticulture farming, to expand her farm and secure the future of her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing and shoes for women.

loans.name: Yesenia

texts.es: Hace 9 años, Yesenia hizo un curso de modistería porque quería aprender a elaborar vestidos, allí aprendió todas las operaciones de la confección y apoyada por una amiga suya, aprendió rápidamente a operar la máquina familiar y después la máquina plana, que le proporcionó el trabajo que hoy tiene, porque empezó a ganar dinero y poco a poco y ahorró y empezó a comprar cada máquina con la que organizó su pequeño taller e inició la confección de sus primeros vestidos, desde su propia casa. fabrica blusas, suéteres, ropa deportiva, vestidos, pantalones etc. trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche sin cesar, pues tiene el propósito de poner un almacén de su propia costura y  este es su sueño de prosperidad y gran desafío. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materia prima como telas, e insumos como hilos aplicaciones etc, con los cuales fabricará conjuntos para venderlos a su clientela, conformada principalmente por vecinos del barrio donde habita y ubicada en colegios cercanos. Con esta inversión se incrementará su producción  y haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Nine years ago, Yesenia took a clothes-making course because she wanted to learn to make dresses. In that course she learned all the operations of clothing production. Supported by one of her friends, Yesenia learned quickly how to operate a household sewing machine and later the stationary machine, with which she carries out her work today. She began to earn money and, little by little, Yesenia saved and began to buy each machine with which she organizes her small workshop. She began making her first dresses from her home. Yesenia makes blouses, sweaters, athletic clothing, dresses, pants, etc. working from 8 a.m. until 7 p.m. without stopping. Her goal is to stock a warehouse with the clothing she makes. This is her dream of prosperity and a big challenge. 

Yesenia is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan, through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy basic materials such as fabrics and supplies like thread and applications, etc. with which to create outfits to sell to her customers. Her customer base is made up of mostly neighbors from her neighborhood, and the nearby schools. With this investment she will increase her production, making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy basic materials such as fabrics and supplies like thread and applications.

loans.name: Perisi

texts.en:
Perisi is a person who has had to overcome a lot of adversity in her life. However, she has always had the strength to overcome it and move forward with her children. Kiva lenders! Meet Perisi, one of the most hardworking women on earth. She is 38 years of age, very hardworking and a go-getter. She hails from Kararia, a remote village in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin, but Perisi has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. She also gets some income through personal business. 

Perisi is contented with the farming way of life. Perisi is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her children and family of a decent meal. The Kapsowar area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. 

Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Perisi feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Perisi is well disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children. Please help Perisi so that her horticulture farming can flourish!

loans.use: To start horticulture farming for an increase in her business for the betterment of her children

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a 29-year-old mother who lives in the Kapsowar area, which is located in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. Gladys is an ambitious mum, and looks to a future when she is the leading supplier of horticulture products. She's working 12 to 14 hours a day to fulfill her dream. She has farmed for five years, and earns an honest and decent income. 

Gladys has both vegetables and a dairy farm, and has a small business to make ends meet. Although he has been making profits, life has not been easy for Gladys. However, she has managed to overcome every challenge she faces. Gladys seeks a loan via Juhudi Kilimo to venture into horticulture farming. Her location is favorable to this types of farming due to the good road network, climate, and market demand. 

Gladys and her family will work very hard to take good care of their investment in horticulture, in which they put their hopes for a better life. Gladys is disciplined regarding finances, and she plans to enter international markets to earn more income, and obtain a stable future for her family.

loans.use: To venture into other areas of farming like horticulture to help educate her family

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith who, with her entrepreneurial spirit and desire to succeed, began farming 5 years ago. Faith hails from Chuka which is a cosmopolitan town where most of the people are very hardworking small-scale farmers. Faith is 41 years old and the proud mother of 3 lovely children. Faith can be described as very hardworking because filling her family's and her siblings' stomachs is not easy. However, she has managed to pull through and has always put food on the table for this large family. 

Faith practices mixed farming to make ends meet and, through animal and crop farming, she has been able to get more profits. Faith sells her products at the nearby market and has been able to build a large customer base. Faith has farmed for the past 18 years and has gained a wealth of experience. She has been able to face good times and bad times. Although Faith makes profits, she still faces the challenges of feeding her large family, and so she wants to start a poultry business. Faith requests 10,000 KES to buy poultry and increase her income. An increased income level will help her to educate her children and provide a brighter future. Please support this Kenyan woman and her dreams for her family!

loans.use: To pay for poultry to help her children's education for a bright future

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 35-year-old woman from the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She has been married to her husband for over 5 years. Esther has been a farmer for as long as she has been a wife. She operates on a small piece of land under her husband's name, keeping dairy and poultry and growing crops and trees. 

Esther is seeking a small loan of KES 20,000 to pay for farm implements. Working with modern tools will make her work move faster and become more efficient. She expects to see major improvements in the quality and quantity of yields led by the use of improved tools.

loans.use: To pay for farm implements which will improve her yields

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is a woman of experience, wisdom, and a lot of patience. She is a 39-year-old farmer from Kapsowar, which is a small, rural town in Rift valley, Kenya. This lovely mother is interested in many farming activities. Currently, she is doing dairy farming, maize farming, and poultry. She has put the last five years of her life into agriculture. She loves it. 

Her main sources of income are milk and maize. She makes extra money on the side through venturing in other personal businesses. She is very appreciative of the fact that farming has sustainable returns! This enables her to enjoy profits and expand. Daisy is seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow. This is aligned with her strategy to boost milk production. The demand for milk is very high in Kapsowar. 

Daisy believes the key to increased milk production is proper health. A dairy cow needs roughage and protein in her diet to be healthy. A healthy cow is more productive, and that means more income for the owner. The extra income will enable her to provide a better life for her family and afford her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, keep it healthy with good food and help her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a toitlet

loans.name: Novylinda

texts.en:
Novylinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a internet shop business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 60000 through NWTF to buy additional unit of computer for her internet shop business.

Novylinda has been in this business for 5 years. Novylinda earns more income from buy and sell beauty products. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Novylinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy an additional computer for her internet shop business

loans.name: Delma

texts.en:
Delma is 52 years old, married with four children.

Delma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, noodles and other groceries to sell.

Delma has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Delma aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, spices, noodles and other groceries to sell

loans.name: Hyacinth

texts.en:
Hyacinth is 52 years old and married with five children. With two children are still in school, Hyacinth works very hard to provide for them.

Hyacinth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and other personal care products.

Hyacinth has been in this business for 12 years. 

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks and to send her children to college

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 40 years old, married with three children.

Mary Ann works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell like milk, coffe, spices, noodles, etc.

Mary Ann has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from raising pig.

Mary Ann aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell like milk, coffee, spices, noodles, etc to be able to send her kids to college

loans.name: Marialyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Marialyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell fish. Marialyn is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy fishing net, gasoline, bamboo, etc for her fishing business.   She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Marialyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, gasoline, bamboo, etc to save money for her kid's college fund

loans.name: Jazeline

texts.en:
Hello Lenders! Meet Jazeline a marvelous, good hearted young woman who makes her living through practicing mixed farming. She is ambitious and full of hope for the future. She makes a living doing mixed farming in Kaptich village, located in the Kapsowar area of Kenya. She keeps dairy cows and poultry for commercial milk and eggs respectively. Besides mixed farming, Jazeline is also very concerned about the health of the environment. She spends most of her time working on her farm. 

Jazeline is seeking a KES 30,000 loan to purchase farm implements. These tools will make the work on her farm move much faster and easier. Tending to her farm involves a lot of digging, uprooting, planting and packaging. There are various tools in the market that are handy for a woman in her line of work. The equipment does not come cheap, however. The increase in income from this investment will go to her family's welfare and her children's education.

loans.use: To buy farm implements, designed for women to make her work easier and support her family

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es madre de 3 hijos en las edades de 18 a 2ª años de edad. Ella genera ingresos para el sustento de su familia mediante un negocio donde ofrece el servicio de alquiler de máquinas lavadoras, las cuales son transportadas a las viviendas de sus clientes cuando estos requieren el servicio. Sus principales clientes son sus vecinos, que día a día lavan la ropa de su familia con lavadoras, que mejoran los tiempos de la tarea, evitando adicionalmente  el inclemente sol del caribe. A María le ha ido muy bien, ella empezó con 2 máquinas y hoy cuenta con 12. Su meta es lograr que sus hijos logren estudiar sus carreras técnicas y que su negocio tenga la maquinaria adecuada y actualizada. . En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará nuevas lavadoras, para reemplazar algunas que se encuentran funcionando parcialmente. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará pues prestará un mejor servicio, lo cual impactará positivamente su oferta de servicios, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Maria is the mother of 3 children from ages 2 to 18. She earns a living to support her family through a business offering washing machine rental services. The washing machines are transported to the homes of her customers when they require the service. Her main clients are her neighbors, who wash their families' clothing each day using the washing machines, which complete the task in less time in addition to avoiding the harsh Caribbean sun. Maria has been doing well. She started with 2 machines and now operates 12. Her goals are to allow her children to be able to complete studies in technical professions and that her business has adequate and up-to-date machinery. She is currently applying for a loan, her first financing made by the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy new washing machines to replace some that are only partially functioning. With this investment her business will improve because she will offer a better service, which will positively impact her service, making the loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy new washing machines

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melanie is 41 years old and has five children are still in school.

Melanie has a weaving business in the Philippines. Melanie requested a PHP 19000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fibers and other materials for her business.

Melanie has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fibers and other materials for her business to help her save for her children to go to college

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 23 years old and a proud mother of a lovely family that she really adores and cherishes. It is through Lydia’s perseverance and courage that her family can have a respectable life. Other than doing a side hustle business, Lydia is a hardworking farmer who has been farming for the past four years. She has gained so much experience through those years of farming. Lydia practices mixed farming. That is, she grows maize and keeps poultry, and through these activities, she has been able to earn a decent and honest income. Because of the passion she has for farming, she has even nicknamed animals on her farm. She really enjoys taking care of her poultry. 

Although Lydia has been making profits through farming, not everything has been easy for this humble and industrious mum. Her farm has not been producing as much of a harvest because of the lack of fertilizer and good seeds and the presence of pests and diseases. 

That is why she is seeking a loan of KES 30,000 to be able to buy farm implements. Through the loan, Lydia will be assured of a bumper harvest, and this will translate into more profits and cash. Through the use of good seeds and fertilizer, Lydia will reap more, which will assure her of comfortably taking care of her family and repaying the loan. Lydia's plan is to be able to increase her farming and to be able to save more money so that she can buy more land for farming. Help her out!

loans.use: To buy farm implements which will increase her yield and enable her to buy more land

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana is a married mother of two who resides with her family in the city of Korca. The reason why she is seeking your compassion and understanding is that she wants to pay for her husband’s medical visitation to a health specialist in the capital city. Suzana’s younger son of 24 years old became a paraplegic long ago; thus, she has to take care of both husband and son.

“All our incomes add up to $603/month and that is not enough at all. Medication is very expensive, especially for my husband, but then again there are things needed for my son that cost lots of money and at times I find myself drowned mentally, physically and emotionally in all this situation. I feel like crying and want to cry out loud at times,” said Suzana to the loan officer.

The guy in the photograph with her is David, her oldest son.

loans.use: to pay for her husband's health specialist visitation.

loans.name: Estanita

texts.en:
Estanita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, fruits, beans, etc for her food vending business.

Estanita has been in this business for 8 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Estanita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, fruits, beans, etc to further expand her business

loans.name: Nerma

texts.en:
Nerma is 56 years old and married with two children. She runs a raising pig business in the Philippines. Nerma is borrowing PHP 19000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Nerma has been in this business for 15 years and also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig and earn money to expand her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell personal collection products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy additional products to sell for her business for her buy and sell personal collection products business.
Susan has been in this business for 1 year. Susan earns more income from motorcycle transport. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. 

Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell for her business which will help her save to send her children to college

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 61 years old and married with seven children.   She runs a raising pig business in the Philippines. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Merlinda has been in this business for 5 years and also earns additional income from general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs to save money to expand her business

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is 70 years old, and widow with nine children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mercedita runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF, in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

Mercedita has been in this business for 25 years, and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, noodles, and other groceries. 

In the future Mercedita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Salamita

texts.en:
Salamita works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a weaving business in the Philippines.

Salamita has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF, to buy additional fibers and other materials for her business.

Salamita has been in this business for 2 years, and also earns additional income from her general store.

In the future, Salamita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fibers and other materials for her business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Rosalie is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to  buy additional fibers and other materials for her business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fibers and other materials for her weaving business to save for her kids to go to college

loans.name: Roselie

texts.en:
Roselie works hard to support her family. Roselie is single and has a weaving business in the Philippines.

Roselie requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fibers and other materials for her weaving business.

Roselie has been in this business for 5 years now, and also earns additional income from raising pig.

In the future, Roselie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fibers and other materials for her weaving business for the betterment of her family

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.

She has a weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Rosemarie is borrowing 9,000 PHP through NWTF to  buy fibers and other materials for her business.

Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fibers and other materials for her business

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es: Blanca es una mujer casada que habita en un municipio cercano a la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su esposo y sus 2 hijas en las edades de 4 y 11 años. Ella tiene una miscelánea y una confecciona que inició hace 5 años, cuando procedente de su tierra natal, llegó a Soledad lugar donde  había sido traslado a su esposo y desde donde empezó su vida comercial nuevamente, pues tenía en su antigua casa un negocio que había dejado atrás y quería dedicarse a el nuevamente. Blanca empezó promocionando entre sus amigas varias mercancías a crédito y por encargo respondía a esta clientela, la que poco a poco la fue conociéndola y empezó a comprarle; aun así Blanca  no se detuvo ahí,  empezó a estudiar diseño y confección y adicionó a su negocio la oferta de ropa elaborada por ella misma. Hoy su meta no para y quiere incrementar sus inventarios y finalmente tener una marca propia,  para lograr que sus hijas logren una educación profesional de calidad. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará telas hilos, calzado accesorios femeninos, para diversificar su oferta, producir más y lograr aumentar sus ventas, lo que hace de su credikiva una inversión de éxito.
texts.en:
Blanca is a married woman who lives in a municipality near the city of Barranquilla with her husband and their two daughters, ages 4 and 11. Blanca has a corner shop and dress-making shop that she opened 5 years ago when she came from her native land. Blanca arrived in Soledad, a place where her husband was moved to and since then she began her new life as a businesswoman. She used to run it from her old house that she left behind and decided to start up again. Blanca began promoting her business among her friends, she sold clothing on a credit system and filled her customers' orders. Little by little others got to know her and began to buy from her.
