Blanca did not stop there, she began to study design and production and added on to her business, offering clothing she made herself. 

Today, Blanca's goal has no end. She wants to expand her inventory and obtain her own brand. This would help her daughters to get an education of professional quality.  Blanca is applying for this Kiva loan, her first loan, through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. The loan will help her to buy fabric, thread, shoes, and women's accessories to produce more and increase her sales. That would make her Kiva investment a success.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, shoes, and women's accessories.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
When talking to Janice, you can't help but notice that she is a farmer born and bred, with the beautiful values of her rural home - hard work and humility being the most representative values. Janice is a smallholder farmer from Mitheru in Chuka, Kenya. She is a mother of three. Like many farmers in the region, she keeps a dairy cow. Chuka has a thriving market for dairy products. Janice has sustained herself through dairy farming for eighteen years now. She enjoys the farming lifestyle. She has a connection with farm animals that goes deep to the extent that she names each of them. She has aspirations of expanding her dairy farm but due to financial constraints, she has been unable to do so until now.

From Kiva lenders, Janice is borrowing KES 30,000 to purchase a high yielding dairy cow. This cow will boost milk production on the farm. As a result, she will have more quantity for both consumption and sales. With the money from the additional sales, she will be able to service her loan on time. With increased income from the loan, Janice plans to spend money to settle the high farming cost of production. Many farmers compromise quality because of the high cost of inputs. However, with increased income, Janice will not take such measures. In the long run, her family will realize an improved standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Lina, a 30-year-old youthful mum. She is a very hardworking, honest, and ever-smiling mother. She lives with her husband in a remote village in Kapsowar, in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. Lina passionately loves farming. She has been farming for the past 10 years and has always managed to provide for her family. Feeding her family requires a lot of hard work and determination. Her other sources of income are milk, crops and some personal business that she does in order to provide food for her parents and family. In farming, she enjoys the returns she gets but is challenged to maintain a good standard of living. 

The main challenge that Lina faces is that her cows stray to her neighbour's compound. This has been causing many losses to her, because she has to compensate for the damages caused by the animals. She is requesting a loan to buy barbed wire. Through the loan she will be able to control her animals, and this will help her a great deal. She will save more money. This loan will change her life and will secure the future of her school-going children. She awaits your kindness. Kindly help her out!

loans.use: To buy a barbed wire to prevent her cattle from straying

loans.name: Karen Elizabeth

texts.es:
Keren, necesita de un crédito para comprar alambre, papelería y pegamento para continuar produciendo piñatas, con otra parte surtirá su negocio con artesanías y variedad bebidas para atender a sus clientes como es debido.
Su negocio se ha mantenido en el mercado con la ayuda de créditos, pues los ingresos han mejorado pero los utiliza para darles a sus hijos educación, vestuario y alimento.
texts.en:
Keren needs a loan to buy wire, paper goods, and glue so she can continue making piñatas.  She will also use some of the money to stock her business with handicrafts and a variety of beverages so she can tend to her customers as she should.

Her business has survived the market with the help of loans, her income has improved, but she uses it to dress and feed her children and pay for their education.

loans.use: to buy supplies and stock her business.

loans.name: Zhanyl

texts.ru: Жаныл, 51 год, замужем, имеет 5 детей. Занимается сельским хозяйством уже более 30 лет. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 3 лошади. На 1,23 Га собственной и 1,80 Га арендованной земли она выращивает картофель и люцерну. Жаныл обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян эспарцета для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Свои доходы  Жаныл планирует и дальше вкладывать в бизнес, она хочет арендовать дополнительно земельные наделы.
texts.en:
Zhanyl is 51 years old, married and the mother of five. She has been engaged in  farm work for over 30 years. She has two cows and three horses on her farm. Zhanyl grows potatoes and alfalfa on 1.23 ha [3 acres] of own and 1.8 ha [4.5 acres] of leased land.  

Zhanyl has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan in the amount of 15,000 som (KGS) to buy seeds of sainfoin  [a plant used for animal fodder] in order to grow sainfoin for sale and for use on her  farm. Zhanyl plans to keep reinvesting her revenues; she would like to lease additional land plots.

loans.use: to cultivate her land and sow sainfoin for sale and as a feed for her livestock.

loans.name: Irene Eufrosina

texts.en:
Irene Eufrosina is a hardworking female entrepreneur.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF, in order to purchase more items such as canned goods, diapers, noodles, and other groceries.

Irene Eufrosina successfully paid back her previous loan, and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Irene Eufrosina dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, diapers, noodles, and other groceries.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a 62-year-old married woman, with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Josefina runs a general store in the Philippines, and has requested a loan of 21,000 PHP through NWTF, in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Josefina has been in this business for eleven years, and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, sugar, diapers, and other personal care products. 

In the future, Josefina would like to save enough money to expand her business and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Enriqueta

texts.es: Enriqueta, hace 3 años inició su actividad comercial, apoyada por su cónyuge quien le dio el primer capital para que lo iniciara. Ella se vinculo a una empresa mediante la cual hasta la presente vende productos mediante guias especializadas, a través de la cual ofrece artículos de belleza, accesorios femeninos etc, especialmente impulsando las ofertas que traen descuentos y que gusta mucho a su clientela. Sus ventas las realiza  a crédito y de contado, obteniendo una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 12, 5%. Desde la cual planea su nueva inversión. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva mediante el cual comprará cosméticos, accesorios entre otros artículos, para hacer crecer su negocio, por lo cual su credikiva es una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Enriqueta opened her business three years ago, supported by her husband, who provided her first loan. With this capital, she became linked to a business through which she sells products from special catalogs. In this business, she sells beauty items, women's accessories, and sale items her clients like. 

Enriqueta sells her items on credit and by account. She has obtained a profitability on her sales of no less than 12.5 percent. From her profits, she is planning a new investment. Enriqueta is requesting a Kiva loan through which she will buy cosmetics, accessories, and other items to help expand her business. This will make her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, accessories, and other items.

loans.name: Solomany's Group

texts.fr: Solomany qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à gauche, porte un habit noir en manche courte et cole ouvert, est membre d’un groupe de 21 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro qui vivent et travaillent dans le village de Chocoro au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Solomany, âgé de 34 ans, est le père de 3 enfants âgés de 1 à 8 ans, et dont l'un d’entre eux est actuellement scolarisé. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Solomany à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 25 ans. Solomany cultive l'arachide, le mais, le mil, le sorgho, le maraichage, le niebe, le soja sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Solomany entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrit en raison du système de paiement et des semences de qualité, ainsi que des engrais de qualité. Cette année Solomany effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.5 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 25 ans que Solomany cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Solomany planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'élevage et de diversifier ses cultures comme semoir, charrue, sarclage. Enfin Solomany espère aussi pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants ainsi qu'assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Solomany is in the back row on the far left of the photo, wearing a short-sleeved black shirt with an open collar. He is a member of the group of 21 farmers registered with myAgro, who live and work in the village of Chocoro, southeast of Bamako in Mali. Solomany, age 34, is the father of three children, ages 1 to 8 years old, one of which is currently in school. 

The establishment of the family tradition of farming and agriculture allows Solomany to ensure his family's self-sufficiency. Agriculture, the home's primary source of revenue and food, encouraged Solomany to work in this business for 25 years now. 

Solomany grows peanuts, corn, millet, sorghum, black-eyed peas, and soy on his plot of land. As a farmer, he must cope with difficulties such as lack of rain, farming materials, and quality fertilizer. Solomany is starting on his second year with myAgro and re-registered because of the payment system and quality seeds as well as fertilizer. 

This year, Solomany is carrying out payments to buy a package of myAgro fertilizer for growing peanuts in order to increase his yields on his plot of .5 hectares. Solomany has grown peanuts for 25 years now because of their food-producing value, explaining that peanuts are directly edible for his family and is used as a base for sauce in cooking. With the increase of his yields and his revenue, Solomany is planning to start raising livestock and to diversify his techniques, i.e. a seed drill, plow, hoe. 

Finally, Solomany also hopes to be able to cover the tuition costs for his children as well as to ensure his family's dietary self-sufficiency.

loans.use: to acquire a package of fertilizer for growing peanuts.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is from Nyamira. She is a humble mother, with a quick smile and a strong character. She is a mother with leadership and initiative. 

The Nyamira region has harsh weather patterns, and poultry farming is the only profitable business venture that thrives. Josephine is happily married and blessed with a beautiful family. For the past 30 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary sources of income have been selling milk and farming crops. 

Josephine passionately loves poultry farming. When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, her reply was “selling eggs”. Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds to increase her poultry farming. She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry because she wants to take full advantage of the poultry business that thrives in Nyamira. 

Josephine is a member of hope self-help group and through the group, she has received training on financial management and saving. With the loan, she will be able to sell eggs to the local market and to her neighbors, hence improving her living conditions and rising out of the poverty. Profits from the loan will be used in repaying the loan and increasing her business.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 51 years old and married with one child. Belinda works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care and other groceries.

Belinda has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Belinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Anita is 56 years old and has one child who is in school.

Anita has a tricycle passenger business in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle.

Anita has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Anita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy wheels and spare parts for her tricycle in order to expand her business

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 41 years old, with one child.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Edna is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Edna has been raising pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell ready to wear.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock and provide a secure future for her family

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es: Nidia de 51 años de edad se dedica a la venta de mercancía mediante guías especializadas de productos,  desde hace 10 años, cuando una amiga suya, que es comerciante, le propuso que hiciera lo mismo que ella y Nidia decidió empezar su aventura emprendedora. Entre los artículos que vende se encuentran las cremas, los cosméticos, ropa interior, accesorios etc.  Nidia vende directamente a su clientela  a crédito y de contado, a través de sus catálogos, donde ofrece los mejores precios de artículos que llegan con descuentos especiales. Su trabajo comercial Nidia lo desarrolla desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 8 de la noche todos los días sin cesar, promoviendo su oferta entre vecinos amigos y referidos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa interior, cremas, colonias y cosméticos, con el fin de aumentar su oferta y vender mucho más. Con lo cual hace de su credikiva una inversión de éxito.  Más adelante tiene como meta dar apertura a un local, lo cual es su mayor propósito, mientras su desafío es incrementar sus ventas y ahorrar.
texts.en: Nidia is a 51-year-old woman who has worked in the sale of merchandise through specialized catalogs of products for 10 years, after her friend that is a salesperson proposed to her that Nidia should do the same, and Nidia decided to begin her entrepreneurial venture. Among the articles that she sells are creams, cosmetics, undergarments, accessories, etc. Nidia sells directly to her customers by credit and cash, through her catalogs, where the best prices are offered for items that come with special discounts. She works at her sales job from 8 in the morning until 8 in the evening everyday without a break, promoting her offers to neighbors, friends and referrals. She is currently applying for a loan, her first financing made through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy undergarments, creams, colognes, and cosmetics, with the goal of increasing her offerings and selling much more. Her work in this way will make the loan a successful investment. Her future goal is to open a store, which is her greatest goal, while her challenge is to increase her sales and save.

loans.use: to buy undergarments, creams, colognes and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings and start horticulture farming.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.es: Lilibeth de 39 años de edad, tiene un almacén mediante el cual vende cosméticos y artículos de papelería. Su negocio surgió cuando su vecina le sugirió abrir un almacén, atendiendo a que no existía alrededor de estas, ningún negocio con estas características y por eso se convertia en una necesidad de la comunidad. Lilibeth hoy tiene 3 años de haberlo iniciado y vende de contado y a crédito trabajando desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche,  comprando a mayoristas para obtener los mejores precios. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cremas, colonias, perfumería,, cosméticos papelería con el fin de tener una oferta diversificada aumentar sus ventas y sus necesidades, haciendo de su credikiva una inversión exitosa. Su meta más adelante es remodelar su vivienda y fidelizar la clientela para impulsar el incremento sostenido de sus ventas.
texts.en:
Lilibeth, 39 years old, has a small store where she sells cosmetics and paper products. Her business surged when her neighbor suggested that she open a store in an area where no other of these existed. For this reason, she became indispensable in her community. Lilibeth has three years of experience in this business. She sells items by credit and on customer accounts and she works from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. Lilibeth buys merchandise in bulk in order to obtain better prices. 

Currently, Lilibeth is requesting a Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to buy creams, colognes, perfume, cosmetics, and paper products. This will help her to diversify her merchandise and increase her sales. This will make her Kiva loan a successful investment. Lilibeth's goal is to eventually renovate her home and promote loyalty in her customers to promote sustained growth in sales.

loans.use: to buy creams, colognes, perfume, cosmetics, and paper products.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a 25-year-old mother. She is married and works in one of the most typical trades of the region, which is raising poultry. This is a tradition in her family. She practices dairy and poultry farming for a living. 

Doris joined Owalo Self-help Group that was formed to empower its members to become entrepreneurs and provide for their families. Through the group, she gained access to the financial services offered to rural smallholder farmers by Juhudi Kilimo. Through Juhudi Kilimo, Doris is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. She owns 20 heads of poultry, but with your money, she is going to double the number of hens she keeps. This will lead to a dramatic increase in the number of eggs produced and hatched. Income generated from this investment will be used by Doris to provide for her family and uplift their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a smallholder farmer based in Molo, Kenya. She grows maize and keeps cows and poultry. She started farming three years ago. It was a means of looking after the family. Besides farming, she started planting trees to give the farm an aesthetic appearance. Since then, she has become a hardened farmer. 

Josephine is seeking a loan to purchase farm implements like fertilizers and potato seeds. She is going to use the money to purchase modern seeds that are of good quality, efficient and improved in design and usability. She opted out of using old seeds that produce poor output. She believes she is going to realize a better harvest as a result of using better seeds. She will use the additional income to provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy farm implements like fertilizers and potato seeds.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 61 years old and has nine children. She is married, and one of her children is in school.

Leonila is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and other supplies to raise livestock.

Leonila has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Leonila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs and other supplies to raise livestock.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 32 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, Marites works very hard to provide for them.

Marites runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, condiments, personal care products and other groceries. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Marites would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, condiments, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elvie is 39 years old, and her two children are in school.

Elvie has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Elvie has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
Enriquita is 53 years old, married and has eight children, with two still at school.

Enriquita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Enriquita requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs & other supplies to raise livestock.  Enriquita has been raising pigs for 30 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Enriquita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs & other supplies to raise livestock and save money for her college fund

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is a married woman,23, with three children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Juvy has a business making and selling dried fish in the Philippines. Juvy requested a PHP 19000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her dried fish making business.

Juvy has been in this business for three years. In the future, Juvy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her dried fish making business and to be able to expand it

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina is a 69-year-old married woman with ten children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Carolina has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall. She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Carolina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en: Hellen is a married 58-year-old Kenyan lady with four children. With 24 years of experience in mixed farming, she runs a 10-acre farm where she conducts dairy, poultry, and crop farming. Currently, she owns two dairy cows, 10 heads of poultry, and a maize farm. Maize farming is a lucrative business, and it is her main income source. Hellen's family has a bright future, which seems to be dependent on the success of her maize farm. To safeguard quality production, Hellen is seeking a loan to pay for modern farm implements that are well-designed, versatile, durable, and more effective compared to traditional tools. Hellen is confident that replacing outdated tools with modern ones will also play a role in increasing her maize yields. Having an increase in maize yield at the end of the season will enable her to meet the growing demand in the market.

loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 47 years old, with three children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell personal product care in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy items like comb, face powder, etc..

Erlinda has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell personal product care for 18 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Erlinda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like combs, face powder, etc.to help save money to send her children to college

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es:
Manuela es una mujer de 50 años de edad es soltera, tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 18 y 30 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Nahuala.
Manuela con el afán de obtener sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa típica, este negocio lo tiene ella desde hace ocho años.
Manuela ahora se ha dado cuenta que el mundo todos los días evoluciona es por ello que es necesario  surtir su negocio con trajes modernos y de buena calidad, pero lamentablemente, ella no tiene el capital suficiente para  poder realizar esta inversión, por tal motivo ella tomo la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para comprar güipiles, cortes, fajas, y ofrecer una variedad de productos.
El gran sueña  de Manuela es poder construir su casa de block y comprar un terreno para cultivar.
texts.en:
Manuela is a 50 year old, single woman with a lovely family of four children between the ages of 18 and 30. This humble family lives in Nahuala.
Manuela buys and sells typical clothing so that she can earn an income and she has had this business for eight years.

Manuela has learned that the world changes every day and she needs to stock her business with good quality modern outfits, but unfortunately she doesn’t have enough capital so she decided to ask for a loan to buy güipiles, cortes, and fajas so she can offer a variety of products.

Manuela’s greatest dream is to build a house out of cinder block and buy some farmland.

loans.use: to stock her business.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is 37-year-old woman and has one child, who is in school.

Mirasol is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs and other supplies to raise livestock. She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Mirasol would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs and other supplies to raise livestock.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Margaret. She is a mother of four with a deeply engraved passion for dairy farming. After all, that is what she has been doing for over 15 years. She owns a small farm in Shamata village which is situated in the Central Province of Kenya. The income she makes from farming is not sufficient to comfortably sustain her family. As a result, Margaret has ventured into a couple of small side businesses to make extra shillings. With the aid of her husband, Margaret also rears poultry, cows, goats and grows maize, amongst other crops.

Margaret is seeking a loan of KES 70,000 for constructing a cowshed. She plans to put up a well-designed barn that will provide a clean, comfortable home for her herd and a pleasant, efficient workplace for her. In a bid to increase milk production, the cowshed will provide a favourable environment for the cows. With your loan, Margaret has carefully planned for the storage and handling of milk, feed, bedding and manure, as these account for most of the labour on any dairy farm. The housing will have a plentiful, dependable supply of good water, made available 24 hours a day. The income she will make from this investment will put her in a position to comfortably afford increasing farming costs. Her family also stands to benefit from the growth of their agribusiness.

Help her out!

loans.use: to construct a cowshed.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
Felipa is 49 years old and has three children. Felipa is married and has two children who are in school.

Felipa is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Felipa requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs & other supplies to raise livestock.

Felipa has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Felipa would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs & other supplies to raise livestock and save for sending her children to college

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 50 years old, married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Emelia has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. Emelia requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more clothes to sell.

Emelia has been in this business for four years. In the future, Emelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell and thus expand her business for the future

loans.name: Jeany

texts.en:
Jeany is 42 years old and has five children. Jeany is married and has four children in school.

Jeany is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jeany requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs & other supplies to raise livestock.

Jeany has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jeany would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs & other supplies to raise livestock to secure the future of her family

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a small-holder dairy farmer from Bomet County in Kenya. Vivian practices poultry farming as well. She started farming three years ago and has been able to significantly grow her asset base over the period. Vivian now owns one dairy cow, 20 head of poultry and over 50 trees on her family's 2-acre farmland. 

Her short-term business goal is to expand her poultry business. Her approach is to increase the number of poultry on the farm. To achieve this, she needs external financing. She is seeking a loan of KES 20,000. The loan will be used to buy a brood of hens that will lay eggs and hatch chicks in large numbers. The sale of eggs, chicks and cockerels will bring enough income for Vivian to comfortably pay her debt obligation and run the operational costs of her business. Once the loan is fully serviced, she can use the money to meet her family's basic needs and grow her business to greater heights.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio, está ampliando su negocio con el apoyo de créditos, atiende mejor a sus clientes y sus trabajaos son de mayor calidad, su situación económica ha mejorado pero ha enfrentado problemas de salud por lo que tenido otros gastos.
Hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito a Padecomscredito y a los inversionistas Kiva con el que comprara pegamento, espuma, telas, barniz y otros materiales para resurtir la tapicería, espera tener estabilidad económica para cumplir con sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Sergio has been expanding his business through the help of loans.  He serves his customers and his work is of high quality.  His financial situation has improved but he has had some problems with his health so he has had other expenses.

He is asking for a new loan through Padecomscredito and the Kiva lenders to buy parchment, foam, varnish, and other materials to begin upholstering again.  He expects to have the financial ability to meet his commitments.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Jacquelyn

texts.en:
Jacquelyn is 39 years old and married with four children in school. 

Jacquelyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jacquelyn requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs & other supplies to raise livestock.

Jacquelyn has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jacquelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs & other supplies to raise livestock and save for her children's college education

loans.name: Yarikza

texts.es: Yaritza de 21 años comercializa ropa, calzado, perfumes, colonias y cremas. Desde el año 2014 sus compañeros universitarios le propusieron vender mercarcia y ella acogio esa idea, en la cual haincursionado con éxito. Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito todos los días desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche , promoviendo sus productos entre compañeros de estudios y vecinos  que son su principal mercado. Su meta es lograr el incremento paulatino de sus ventas y fidelizar a su clientela, pues sueña con comprar su propio apartamento, aunque su mayor desafío es aumentar el grado de satisfacción de su clientela. . En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará en mayor volumen, calzado, vestidos perfumes y cremas, para responder a su clientela, incrementar sus ventas y así mismo sus utilidades, lo que hacen de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Yaritza is 21 years old and sells clothing, perfumes, colognes and creams. In 2014 her university classmates proposed the idea to sell merchandise to her and she embraced the idea, in which she has been excelling. She conducts her sales by credit and cash every day from 8 in the morning until 8 in the evening, marketing her products among classmates and neighbors, who are her main customers. Her goal is to gradually increase her sales and establish a loyal customer base, because her dream is to buy her own apartment, although her greatest challenge is to increase the satisfaction of her customers. She is currently applying for a loan, her first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy footwear, dresses, perfumes and creams in large quantities to meet the demand of her customers, increase her sales and in this way her profits, which will make the loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy footwear, dresses, perfumes and creams in large quantity

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a 23-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and one child. She is working hard and trying her best to be as helpful as she can in her family. She opened a beauty salon in her town in 2005 near to her house. She has her loyal customers, and is glad with the results she has attained so far. Today, she’s looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase new chairs and beauty products. In that way, she will be able to serve her customers with good quality products.

loans.use: to purchase new chairs and beauty products

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 29 years old. Virginia is married and has two children who are in school.

Virginia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Virginia has been in this business for three years now, and she has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 40 years old and married with one child who is in school. 

Gemma is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Gemma has been in this business for six years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her business.

In the future, Gemma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Beatriz is 51 years old and one of her children is in school.

Beatriz has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Beatriz has been in this business for four years. In the future, Beatriz would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dolores is 47 years old and all three of her children are in school.

Dolores has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Dolores has been in this business for one year now. In the future, Dolores would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marivic works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling spices in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from selling vegetables. Marivic is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy spices to sell in her stall like onnions, garlic, etc.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spices to sell in her stall like onions, garlic, etc.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ofelia is 50 years old and has one child in school.

Ofelia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ofelia requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Ofelia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 50 years old and married with three children. Luciana works very hard to provide for them.

Luciana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, beverages, personal care products, and other groceries.

Luciana has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, Luciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk food, beverages, personal care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Marycel

texts.en:
Marycel is 40 years old and married with two children. Both of her children are sent in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Marycel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marycel has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, snack food, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Marycel would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell so as to ensure her children will go to school

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Antonieta works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending. Antonieta is borrowing PHP 14000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Antonieta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing supplies which will ensure a safe future for her family

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos, atiende un negocio en el que vende productos de la canasta básica, tiene una experiencia de diez años, al realizar dicha actividad genera los ingresos que necesita para cumplir con sus obligaciones; actualmente vive con su familia compuesta por su esposa e hijos, manifiesta que no tiene apoyo económico de familiares.
Para poder aumentar el porcentaje de sus ganancias necesita de un crédito con el que surtirá mejor el inventario, comprara aceite, granos básicos, bebidas, boquitas, pan, huevos, etc., de esta manera tendrá la facilidad de cubrir las demandas de sus clientes.
Sueña con tener un negocio reconocido en su localidad, cancelar sus deudas y enseñar a sus hijos a trabajar para que sean personas útiles a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Carlos sells basic food products and has been doing so for 10 years.  With this he generates the income he needs to meet his commitments.  He lives with his family which includes his wife and children and he says that he doesn’t get any additional financial support from them.

He needs a loan so he can increase his profits.  He will use the money to better stock his business by buying cooking oil, basic grains, bread, eggs, etc.  In this way he will be able to cover his customer demand.

He dreams of having a well-known business, pay all his debts, and teach his children to work so that they will be useful to society.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Fifteen years ago, Grace started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Magena, a remote village in the Kenyenya area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer, and because of the immense knowledge she has in farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. 

Although she makes a profit through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan, she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevents them from getting diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Grace believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Grace waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie, a 31-year-old married mother of three children, two of whom are in school, is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She  has had a a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines for six years.

Rosalie has requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more supplies of ready-to-wear products such as slippers, shirts, t-shirts, underwear etc. She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of ready-to-wear products like slippers, shirts, t-shirts, underwear, etc.

loans.name: Johnattan

texts.es: Johnattan de 27 años de edad comercializa productos para el hogar,  desde que un amigo le propuso hacerlo y el accedió con mucho éxito como hasta la presente, esto hace 6 años y sus metas de crecimiento y expansión no se detienen.  Johnattan trabaja 8 horas diarias vendiendo a crédito principalmente, para generar ingresos que le permita el sustento de su hogar conformado por su cónyuge y sus 2 hijas en las edades de 7 y 15 años, con quienes sueña llevarlos a que logren estudios superiores. Su mayor desafío es su insuficiente capital de trabajo para hacer compras significativas, que le permitan ganar un poco más. Esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará artículos para el hogar, electrodomésticos menores, accesorios etc, con el fin de incrementar su capital de trabajo las ventas y las utilidades del negocio, lo cual hace que su credikiva sea una inversión exitosa.
texts.en: Johnattan is 27 years old and sells products for the home. Since a friend proposed to him that he do it and he agreed, he has done it with much success. He has worked in this job for 6 years and his goals for growth and expansion have not deterred him. Johnattan works 8 hours daily selling mainly by credit, to generate earnings that permit him to pay for living expenses for his spouse and their two daughters, who are 7 and 15 years old and who he dreams of supporting to achieve higher studies. His main obstacle is his insufficient capital from his work to make large purchases, that would permit im to earn a bit more. This is understandably the reason why he is applying for a loan, his first financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which he will use to buy articles for the home, small home appliances, accessories, etc., with the goal of increasing his capital, sales and profits from his business, which will make the loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy articles for the home, small home appliances, accessories, etc.

loans.name: Ratbek

texts.ru: Ратбек, 50 лет, женат, 5 детей. У него среднее образование, с 1992 года занимается полеводством и животноводством, мастер в своем деле. В хозяйстве Ратбека есть 3 коровы, 4 теленка, лошадь и 30 овец. На 2,0 Га земли выращивает картофель, кукурузу, клевер. Ежемесячная прибыль Ратбека составляет до 13,000 сом(KGS). В целях увеличения поголовья скота, он обратился в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 70,000 сом(KGS) на покупку коров для откорма. Доходы от кредита Ратбек направит на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса, он также хочет дать достойное образование своему сыну.
texts.en:
Ratbek is 50 and married with five children. He has a high school education and has been working in agriculture and animal husbandry since 1992. He is skilled in his field and has three cows, four calves, a horse and 30 sheep on his farm as well as 2 hectares of land where he grows potatoes, corn and clover. His monthly income is about 13,000 KGS.

With the goal of increasing his head count of livestock, Ratbek has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 KGS to purchase cows for fattening. He intends to put profits from the loan into further developing his business and also wants to give his son a good education.

loans.use: to purchase some cows for fattening and to increase his herd

loans.name: Leskia

texts.es: LESKIA: Es una señora amable de 36 años de edad, pertenece a la etnia miskita del municipio de Waspam. Casad con 3 hijos: El mayor de 17 años estudia su segundo año de carrera universitaria, el de 10 años su cuarto grado de primaria y un pequeño de 3 años. Trabaja como técnica en proyecto de educación. Con el propósito de brindarle a su familia una vivienda digna y segura, está solicitando su financiamiento para comenzar con la construcción de su vivienda de concreto, iniciara construyendo un anexo. Ella sueña con tener una casa bonita, con mejores condiciones de seguridad y mejor ambiente para  sus hijos.
texts.en:
Leskia is a friendly 36-year-old woman of Miskito descent from the Waspam municipality. She is married with 3 children, a 17-year-old who is a 2nd-year university student, a 10-year-old who is in 4th grade, and a 3-year-old. She works as an education specialist. 

In order to provide her family with a decent and safe home, Leskia is requesting finances to start construction on her concrete home. She will begin by creating an extension. She dreams of having a beautiful house with great security and a better environment for her children.

loans.use: to begin construction on her concrete house.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
Marleny tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia en el distrito de Oyotún, la cual es una zona rural donde la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, realiza esta actividad desde hace 01 año y cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales en su distrito. Solicita préstamo para realizar arreglos y mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que actualmente se encuentra en mal estado, ella espera poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le generará ingresos mayores que van a mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marleny is 37 years old and lives in a home of her own in Oyotun, a rural area where life is relaxed and the locals farm, work as merchants, and raise livestock.  It’s located in the Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, along the northern coast of Peru.

She provides transportation with her moto-taxi and has been doing this for a year.  She has good personal and professional references in the district and is asking for a loan to repair and maintain her vehicle because it’s in bad shape at the moment.  She wants to be able to provide better service to her customers and a better life for her family.

loans.use: to repair and maintain her moto-taxi

loans.name: Felda Marie

texts.en:
Felda Marie is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Felda Marie is 26 years old and two of her children are in school.

Felda Marie has a fish vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to sell.

Felda Marie has been in this business for two years. In the future, Felda Marie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to sell
